53 // 6 comes from OPCODE (1) + vch.size() (1) + BIGNUM size (4)

111 // Internal stuff
112 namespace
113 {
114 struct CBlockIndexWorkComparator {
115  bool operator()(CBlockIndex* pa, CBlockIndex* pb) const
116  {
117  // First sort by most total work, ...
118  if (pa->nChainWork > pb->nChainWork) return false;
119  if (pa->nChainWork < pb->nChainWork) return true;
120 
121  // ... then by earliest time received, ...
122  if (pa->nSequenceId < pb->nSequenceId) return false;
123  if (pa->nSequenceId > pb->nSequenceId) return true;
124 
125  // Use pointer address as tie breaker (should only happen with blocks
126  // loaded from disk, as those all have id 0).
127  if (pa < pb) return false;
128  if (pa > pb) return true;
129 
130  // Identical blocks.
131  return false;
132  }
133 };
134 
135 CBlockIndex* pindexBestInvalid;
136 
141 set<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndexWorkComparator> setBlockIndexCandidates;
143 int nSyncStarted = 0;
145 multimap<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndex*> mapBlocksUnlinked;

148 std::vector<CBlockFileInfo> vinfoBlockFile;
149 int nLastBlockFile = 0;
150 
155 CCriticalSection cs_nBlockSequenceId;
157 uint32_t nBlockSequenceId = 1;

166 struct QueuedBlock {
167  uint256 hash;
168  CBlockIndex* pindex;
169  int64_t nTime;
170  int nValidatedQueuedBefore;
171  bool fValidatedHeaders;
172 };
173 map<uint256, pair<NodeId, list<QueuedBlock>::iterator> > mapBlocksInFlight;

195 namespace
196 {
197 struct CMainSignals {
199  boost::signals2::signal<void(const CTransaction&, const CBlock*)> SyncTransaction;
201 // XX42 boost::signals2::signal<void(const uint256&)> EraseTransaction;
203  boost::signals2::signal<void(const uint256&)> UpdatedTransaction;
205  boost::signals2::signal<void(const CBlockLocator&)> SetBestChain;
207  boost::signals2::signal<void(const uint256&)> Inventory;
209  boost::signals2::signal<void()> Broadcast;
211  boost::signals2::signal<void(const CBlock&, const CValidationState&)> BlockChecked;
212 } g_signals;
213 
214 } // anon namespace
215 
216 void RegisterValidationInterface(CValidationInterface* pwalletIn)
217 {
218  g_signals.SyncTransaction.connect(boost::bind(&CValidationInterface::SyncTransaction, pwalletIn, _1, _2));
219 // XX42 g_signals.EraseTransaction.connect(boost::bind(&CValidationInterface::EraseFromWallet, pwalletIn, _1));
220  g_signals.UpdatedTransaction.connect(boost::bind(&CValidationInterface::UpdatedTransaction, pwalletIn, _1));
221  g_signals.SetBestChain.connect(boost::bind(&CValidationInterface::SetBestChain, pwalletIn, _1));
222  g_signals.Inventory.connect(boost::bind(&CValidationInterface::Inventory, pwalletIn, _1));
223  g_signals.Broadcast.connect(boost::bind(&CValidationInterface::ResendWalletTransactions, pwalletIn));
224  g_signals.BlockChecked.connect(boost::bind(&CValidationInterface::BlockChecked, pwalletIn, _1, _2));
225 }
226 
227 void UnregisterValidationInterface(CValidationInterface* pwalletIn)
228 {
229  g_signals.BlockChecked.disconnect(boost::bind(&CValidationInterface::BlockChecked, pwalletIn, _1, _2));
230  g_signals.Broadcast.disconnect(boost::bind(&CValidationInterface::ResendWalletTransactions, pwalletIn));
231  g_signals.Inventory.disconnect(boost::bind(&CValidationInterface::Inventory, pwalletIn, _1));
232  g_signals.SetBestChain.disconnect(boost::bind(&CValidationInterface::SetBestChain, pwalletIn, _1));
233  g_signals.UpdatedTransaction.disconnect(boost::bind(&CValidationInterface::UpdatedTransaction, pwalletIn, _1));
234 // XX42 g_signals.EraseTransaction.disconnect(boost::bind(&CValidationInterface::EraseFromWallet, pwalletIn, _1));
235  g_signals.SyncTransaction.disconnect(boost::bind(&CValidationInterface::SyncTransaction, pwalletIn, _1, _2));
236 }
237 
238 void UnregisterAllValidationInterfaces()
239 {
240  g_signals.BlockChecked.disconnect_all_slots();
241  g_signals.Broadcast.disconnect_all_slots();
242  g_signals.Inventory.disconnect_all_slots();
243  g_signals.SetBestChain.disconnect_all_slots();
244  g_signals.UpdatedTransaction.disconnect_all_slots();
245 // XX42 g_signals.EraseTransaction.disconnect_all_slots();
246  g_signals.SyncTransaction.disconnect_all_slots();
247 }
248 
249 void SyncWithWallets(const CTransaction& tx, const CBlock* pblock)
250 {
251  g_signals.SyncTransaction(tx, pblock);
252 }

255 //

258 
259 namespace
260 {
261 struct CBlockReject {
262  unsigned char chRejectCode;
263  string strRejectReason;
264  uint256 hashBlock;
265 };
266 
273 struct CNodeState {
275  CService address;
277  bool fCurrentlyConnected;
279  int nMisbehavior;
281  bool fShouldBan;
283  std::string name;
285  std::vector<CBlockReject> rejects;
287  CBlockIndex* pindexBestKnownBlock;
289  uint256 hashLastUnknownBlock;
291  CBlockIndex* pindexLastCommonBlock;
293  bool fSyncStarted;
295  int64_t nStallingSince;
296  list<QueuedBlock> vBlocksInFlight;
297  int nBlocksInFlight;
299  bool fPreferredDownload;
300 
301  CNodeState()
302  {
303  fCurrentlyConnected = false;
304  nMisbehavior = 0;
305  fShouldBan = false;
306  pindexBestKnownBlock = NULL;
307  hashLastUnknownBlock = uint256(0);
308  pindexLastCommonBlock = NULL;
309  fSyncStarted = false;
310  nStallingSince = 0;
311  nBlocksInFlight = 0;
312  fPreferredDownload = false;
313  }
314 };
315 
317 map<NodeId, CNodeState> mapNodeState;
318 
319 // Requires cs_main.
320 CNodeState* State(NodeId pnode)
321 {
322  map<NodeId, CNodeState>::iterator it = mapNodeState.find(pnode);
323  if (it == mapNodeState.end())
324  return NULL;
325  return &it->second;
326 }
327 
328 int GetHeight()
329 {
330  while (true) {
331  TRY_LOCK(cs_main, lockMain);
332  if (!lockMain) {
333  MilliSleep(50);
334  continue;
335  }
336  return chainActive.Height();
337  }
338 }
339 
340 void UpdatePreferredDownload(CNode* node, CNodeState* state)
341 {
342  nPreferredDownload -= state->fPreferredDownload;
343 
344  // Whether this node should be marked as a preferred download node.
345  state->fPreferredDownload = (!node->fInbound || node->fWhitelisted) && !node->fOneShot && !node->fClient;
346 
347  nPreferredDownload += state->fPreferredDownload;
348 }
349 
350 void InitializeNode(NodeId nodeid, const CNode* pnode)
351 {
352  LOCK(cs_main);
353  CNodeState& state = mapNodeState.insert(std::make_pair(nodeid, CNodeState())).first->second;
354  state.name = pnode->addrName;
355  state.address = pnode->addr;
356 }
357 
358 void FinalizeNode(NodeId nodeid)
359 {
360  LOCK(cs_main);
361  CNodeState* state = State(nodeid);
362 
363  if (state->fSyncStarted)
364  nSyncStarted--;
365 
366  if (state->nMisbehavior == 0 && state->fCurrentlyConnected) {
367  AddressCurrentlyConnected(state->address);
368  }
369 
370  BOOST_FOREACH (const QueuedBlock& entry, state->vBlocksInFlight)
371  mapBlocksInFlight.erase(entry.hash);
372  EraseOrphansFor(nodeid);
373  nPreferredDownload -= state->fPreferredDownload;
374 
375  mapNodeState.erase(nodeid);
376 }
377 
378 // Requires cs_main.
379 void MarkBlockAsReceived(const uint256& hash)
380 {
381  map<uint256, pair<NodeId, list<QueuedBlock>::iterator> >::iterator itInFlight = mapBlocksInFlight.find(hash);
382  if (itInFlight != mapBlocksInFlight.end()) {
383  CNodeState* state = State(itInFlight->second.first);
384  nQueuedValidatedHeaders -= itInFlight->second.second->fValidatedHeaders;
385  state->vBlocksInFlight.erase(itInFlight->second.second);
386  state->nBlocksInFlight--;
387  state->nStallingSince = 0;
388  mapBlocksInFlight.erase(itInFlight);
389  }
390 }
391 
392 // Requires cs_main.
393 void MarkBlockAsInFlight(NodeId nodeid, const uint256& hash, CBlockIndex* pindex = NULL)
394 {
395  CNodeState* state = State(nodeid);
396  assert(state != NULL);
397 
398  // Make sure it's not listed somewhere already.
399  MarkBlockAsReceived(hash);
400 
401  QueuedBlock newentry = {hash, pindex, GetTimeMicros(), nQueuedValidatedHeaders, pindex != NULL};
402  nQueuedValidatedHeaders += newentry.fValidatedHeaders;
403  list<QueuedBlock>::iterator it = state->vBlocksInFlight.insert(state->vBlocksInFlight.end(), newentry);
404  state->nBlocksInFlight++;
405  mapBlocksInFlight[hash] = std::make_pair(nodeid, it);
406 }
407 
409 void ProcessBlockAvailability(NodeId nodeid)
410 {
411  CNodeState* state = State(nodeid);
412  assert(state != NULL);
413 
414  if (state->hashLastUnknownBlock != 0) {
415  BlockMap::iterator itOld = mapBlockIndex.find(state->hashLastUnknownBlock);
416  if (itOld != mapBlockIndex.end() && itOld->second->nChainWork > 0) {
417  if (state->pindexBestKnownBlock == NULL || itOld->second->nChainWork >= state->pindexBestKnownBlock->nChainWork)
418  state->pindexBestKnownBlock = itOld->second;
419  state->hashLastUnknownBlock = uint256(0);
420  }
421  }
422 }
423 
425 void UpdateBlockAvailability(NodeId nodeid, const uint256& hash)
426 {
427  CNodeState* state = State(nodeid);
428  assert(state != NULL);
429 
430  ProcessBlockAvailability(nodeid);
431 
432  BlockMap::iterator it = mapBlockIndex.find(hash);
433  if (it != mapBlockIndex.end() && it->second->nChainWork > 0) {
434  // An actually better block was announced.
435  if (state->pindexBestKnownBlock == NULL || it->second->nChainWork >= state->pindexBestKnownBlock->nChainWork)
436  state->pindexBestKnownBlock = it->second;
437  } else {
438  // An unknown block was announced; just assume that the latest one is the best one.
439  state->hashLastUnknownBlock = hash;
440  }
441 }
442 
445 CBlockIndex* LastCommonAncestor(CBlockIndex* pa, CBlockIndex* pb)
446 {
447  if (pa->nHeight > pb->nHeight) {
448  pa = pa->GetAncestor(pb->nHeight);
449  } else if (pb->nHeight > pa->nHeight) {
450  pb = pb->GetAncestor(pa->nHeight);
451  }
452 
453  while (pa != pb && pa && pb) {
454  pa = pa->pprev;
455  pb = pb->pprev;
456  }
457 
458  // Eventually all chain branches meet at the genesis block.
459  assert(pa == pb);
460  return pa;
461 }
462 
465 void FindNextBlocksToDownload(NodeId nodeid, unsigned int count, std::vector<CBlockIndex*>& vBlocks, NodeId& nodeStaller)
466 {
467  if (count == 0)
468  return;
469 
470  vBlocks.reserve(vBlocks.size() + count);
471  CNodeState* state = State(nodeid);
472  assert(state != NULL);
473 
474  // Make sure pindexBestKnownBlock is up to date, we'll need it.
475  ProcessBlockAvailability(nodeid);
476 
477  if (state->pindexBestKnownBlock == NULL || state->pindexBestKnownBlock->nChainWork < chainActive.Tip()->nChainWork) {
478  // This peer has nothing interesting.
479  return;
480  }
481 
482  if (state->pindexLastCommonBlock == NULL) {
483  // Bootstrap quickly by guessing a parent of our best tip is the forking point.
484  // Guessing wrong in either direction is not a problem.
485  state->pindexLastCommonBlock = chainActive[std::min(state->pindexBestKnownBlock->nHeight, chainActive.Height())];
486  }
487 
488  // If the peer reorganized, our previous pindexLastCommonBlock may not be an ancestor
489  // of their current tip anymore. Go back enough to fix that.
490  state->pindexLastCommonBlock = LastCommonAncestor(state->pindexLastCommonBlock, state->pindexBestKnownBlock);
491  if (state->pindexLastCommonBlock == state->pindexBestKnownBlock)
492  return;
493 
494  std::vector<CBlockIndex*> vToFetch;
495  CBlockIndex* pindexWalk = state->pindexLastCommonBlock;
496  // Never fetch further than the best block we know the peer has, or more than BLOCK_DOWNLOAD_WINDOW + 1 beyond the last
497  // linked block we have in common with this peer. The +1 is so we can detect stalling, namely if we would be able to
498  // download that next block if the window were 1 larger.
499  int nWindowEnd = state->pindexLastCommonBlock->nHeight + BLOCK_DOWNLOAD_WINDOW;
500  int nMaxHeight = std::min<int>(state->pindexBestKnownBlock->nHeight, nWindowEnd + 1);
501  NodeId waitingfor = -1;
502  while (pindexWalk->nHeight < nMaxHeight) {
503  // Read up to 128 (or more, if more blocks than that are needed) successors of pindexWalk (towards
504  // pindexBestKnownBlock) into vToFetch. We fetch 128, because CBlockIndex::GetAncestor may be as expensive
505  // as iterating over ~100 CBlockIndex* entries anyway.
506  int nToFetch = std::min(nMaxHeight - pindexWalk->nHeight, std::max<int>(count - vBlocks.size(), 128));
507  vToFetch.resize(nToFetch);
508  pindexWalk = state->pindexBestKnownBlock->GetAncestor(pindexWalk->nHeight + nToFetch);
509  vToFetch[nToFetch - 1] = pindexWalk;
510  for (unsigned int i = nToFetch - 1; i > 0; i--) {
511  vToFetch[i - 1] = vToFetch[i]->pprev;
512  }
513 
514  // Iterate over those blocks in vToFetch (in forward direction), adding the ones that
515  // are not yet downloaded and not in flight to vBlocks. In the mean time, update
516  // pindexLastCommonBlock as long as all ancestors are already downloaded.
517  BOOST_FOREACH (CBlockIndex* pindex, vToFetch) {
518  if (!pindex->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_TREE)) {
519  // We consider the chain that this peer is on invalid.
520  return;
521  }
522  if (pindex->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA) {
523  if (pindex->nChainTx)
524  state->pindexLastCommonBlock = pindex;
525  } else if (mapBlocksInFlight.count(pindex->GetBlockHash()) == 0) {
526  // The block is not already downloaded, and not yet in flight.
527  if (pindex->nHeight > nWindowEnd) {
528  // We reached the end of the window.
529  if (vBlocks.size() == 0 && waitingfor != nodeid) {
530  // We aren't able to fetch anything, but we would be if the download window was one larger.
531  nodeStaller = waitingfor;
532  }
533  return;
534  }
535  vBlocks.push_back(pindex);
536  if (vBlocks.size() == count) {
537  return;
538  }
539  } else if (waitingfor == -1) {
540  // This is the first already-in-flight block.
541  waitingfor = mapBlocksInFlight[pindex->GetBlockHash()].first;
542  }
543  }
544  }
545 }
546 
547 } // anon namespace
548 
549 bool GetNodeStateStats(NodeId nodeid, CNodeStateStats& stats)
550 {
551  LOCK(cs_main);
552  CNodeState* state = State(nodeid);
553  if (state == NULL)
554  return false;
555  stats.nMisbehavior = state->nMisbehavior;
556  stats.nSyncHeight = state->pindexBestKnownBlock ? state->pindexBestKnownBlock->nHeight : -1;
557  stats.nCommonHeight = state->pindexLastCommonBlock ? state->pindexLastCommonBlock->nHeight : -1;
558  BOOST_FOREACH (const QueuedBlock& queue, state->vBlocksInFlight) {
559  if (queue.pindex)
560  stats.vHeightInFlight.push_back(queue.pindex->nHeight);
561  }
562  return true;
563 }
564 
565 void RegisterNodeSignals(CNodeSignals& nodeSignals)
566 {
567  nodeSignals.GetHeight.connect(&GetHeight);
568  nodeSignals.ProcessMessages.connect(&ProcessMessages);
569  nodeSignals.SendMessages.connect(&SendMessages);
570  nodeSignals.InitializeNode.connect(&InitializeNode);
571  nodeSignals.FinalizeNode.connect(&FinalizeNode);
572 }
573 
574 void UnregisterNodeSignals(CNodeSignals& nodeSignals)
575 {
576  nodeSignals.GetHeight.disconnect(&GetHeight);
577  nodeSignals.ProcessMessages.disconnect(&ProcessMessages);
578  nodeSignals.SendMessages.disconnect(&SendMessages);
579  nodeSignals.InitializeNode.disconnect(&InitializeNode);
580  nodeSignals.FinalizeNode.disconnect(&FinalizeNode);
581 }
582 
583 CBlockIndex* FindForkInGlobalIndex(const CChain& chain, const CBlockLocator& locator)
584 {
585  // Find the first block the caller has in the main chain
586  BOOST_FOREACH (const uint256& hash, locator.vHave) {
587  BlockMap::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.find(hash);
588  if (mi != mapBlockIndex.end()) {
589  CBlockIndex* pindex = (*mi).second;
590  if (chain.Contains(pindex))
591  return pindex;
592  }
593  }
594  return chain.Genesis();
595 }
596 
597 CCoinsViewCache* pcoinsTip = NULL;
598 CBlockTreeDB* pblocktree = NULL;
599 CZerocoinDB* zerocoinDB = NULL;
600 CSporkDB* pSporkDB = NULL;
601 
603 //
604 // mapOrphanTransactions
605 //
606 
607 bool AddOrphanTx(const CTransaction& tx, NodeId peer)
608 {
609  uint256 hash = tx.GetHash();
610  if (mapOrphanTransactions.count(hash))
611  return false;
612 
613  // Ignore big transactions, to avoid a
614  // send-big-orphans memory exhaustion attack. If a peer has a legitimate
615  // large transaction with a missing parent then we assume
616  // it will rebroadcast it later, after the parent transaction(s)
617  // have been mined or received.
618  // 10,000 orphans, each of which is at most 5,000 bytes big is
619  // at most 500 megabytes of orphans:
620  unsigned int sz = tx.GetSerializeSize(SER_NETWORK, CTransaction::CURRENT_VERSION);
621  if (sz > 5000) {
622  LogPrint("mempool", "ignoring large orphan tx (size: %u, hash: %s)\n", sz, hash.ToString());
623  return false;
624  }
625 
626  mapOrphanTransactions[hash].tx = tx;
627  mapOrphanTransactions[hash].fromPeer = peer;
628  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTxIn& txin, tx.vin)
629  mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev[txin.prevout.hash].insert(hash);
630 
631  LogPrint("mempool", "stored orphan tx %s (mapsz %u prevsz %u)\n", hash.ToString(),
632  mapOrphanTransactions.size(), mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev.size());
633  return true;
634 }
635 
636 void static EraseOrphanTx(uint256 hash)
637 {
638  map<uint256, COrphanTx>::iterator it = mapOrphanTransactions.find(hash);
639  if (it == mapOrphanTransactions.end())
640  return;
641  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTxIn& txin, it->second.tx.vin) {
642  map<uint256, set<uint256> >::iterator itPrev = mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev.find(txin.prevout.hash);
643  if (itPrev == mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev.end())
644  continue;
645  itPrev->second.erase(hash);
646  if (itPrev->second.empty())
647  mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev.erase(itPrev);
648  }
649  mapOrphanTransactions.erase(it);
650 }
651 
652 void EraseOrphansFor(NodeId peer)
653 {
654  int nErased = 0;
655  map<uint256, COrphanTx>::iterator iter = mapOrphanTransactions.begin();
656  while (iter != mapOrphanTransactions.end()) {
657  map<uint256, COrphanTx>::iterator maybeErase = iter++; // increment to avoid iterator becoming invalid
658  if (maybeErase->second.fromPeer == peer) {
659  EraseOrphanTx(maybeErase->second.tx.GetHash());
660  ++nErased;
661  }
662  }
663  if (nErased > 0) LogPrint("mempool", "Erased %d orphan tx from peer %d\n", nErased, peer);
664 }
665 
666 
667 unsigned int LimitOrphanTxSize(unsigned int nMaxOrphans)
668 {
669  unsigned int nEvicted = 0;
670  while (mapOrphanTransactions.size() > nMaxOrphans) {
671  // Evict a random orphan:
672  uint256 randomhash = GetRandHash();
673  map<uint256, COrphanTx>::iterator it = mapOrphanTransactions.lower_bound(randomhash);
674  if (it == mapOrphanTransactions.end())
675  it = mapOrphanTransactions.begin();
676  EraseOrphanTx(it->first);
677  ++nEvicted;
678  }
679  return nEvicted;
680 }
681 
682 bool IsStandardTx(const CTransaction& tx, string& reason)
683 {
684  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
685  if (tx.nVersion > CTransaction::CURRENT_VERSION || tx.nVersion < 1) {
686  reason = "version";
687  return false;
688  }
689 
690  // Treat non-final transactions as non-standard to prevent a specific type
691  // of double-spend attack, as well as DoS attacks. (if the transaction
692  // can't be mined, the attacker isn't expending resources broadcasting it)
693  // Basically we don't want to propagate transactions that can't be included in
694  // the next block.
695  //
696  // However, IsFinalTx() is confusing... Without arguments, it uses
697  // chainActive.Height() to evaluate nLockTime; when a block is accepted, chainActive.Height()
698  // is set to the value of nHeight in the block. However, when IsFinalTx()
699  // is called within CBlock::AcceptBlock(), the height of the block *being*
700  // evaluated is what is used. Thus if we want to know if a transaction can
701  // be part of the *next* block, we need to call IsFinalTx() with one more
702  // than chainActive.Height().
703  //
704  // Timestamps on the other hand don't get any special treatment, because we
705  // can't know what timestamp the next block will have, and there aren't
706  // timestamp applications where it matters.
707  if (!IsFinalTx(tx, chainActive.Height() + 1)) {
708  reason = "non-final";
709  return false;
710  }
711 
712  // Extremely large transactions with lots of inputs can cost the network
713  // almost as much to process as they cost the sender in fees, because
714  // computing signature hashes is O(ninputs*txsize). Limiting transactions
715  // to MAX_STANDARD_TX_SIZE mitigates CPU exhaustion attacks.
716  unsigned int sz = tx.GetSerializeSize(SER_NETWORK, CTransaction::CURRENT_VERSION);
717  unsigned int nMaxSize = tx.ContainsZerocoins() ? MAX_ZEROCOIN_TX_SIZE : MAX_STANDARD_TX_SIZE;
718  if (sz >= nMaxSize) {
719  reason = "tx-size";
720  return false;
721  }
722 
723  for (const CTxIn& txin : tx.vin) {
724  if (txin.scriptSig.IsZerocoinSpend())
725  continue;
726  // Biggest 'standard' txin is a 15-of-15 P2SH multisig with compressed
727  // keys. (remember the 520 byte limit on redeemScript size) That works
728  // out to a (15*(33+1))+3=513 byte redeemScript, 513+1+15*(73+1)+3=1627
729  // bytes of scriptSig, which we round off to 1650 bytes for some minor
730  // future-proofing. That's also enough to spend a 20-of-20
731  // CHECKMULTISIG scriptPubKey, though such a scriptPubKey is not
732  // considered standard)
733  if (txin.scriptSig.size() > 1650) {
734  reason = "scriptsig-size";
735  return false;
736  }
737  if (!txin.scriptSig.IsPushOnly()) {
738  reason = "scriptsig-not-pushonly";
739  return false;
740  }
741  }
742 
743  unsigned int nDataOut = 0;
744  txnouttype whichType;
745  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTxOut& txout, tx.vout) {
746  if (!::IsStandard(txout.scriptPubKey, whichType)) {
747  reason = "scriptpubkey";
748  return false;
749  }
750 
751  if (whichType == TX_NULL_DATA)
752  nDataOut++;
753  else if ((whichType == TX_MULTISIG) && (!fIsBareMultisigStd)) {
754  reason = "bare-multisig";
755  return false;
756  } else if (txout.IsDust(::minRelayTxFee)) {
757  reason = "dust";
758  return false;
759  }
760  }
761 
762  // only one OP_RETURN txout is permitted
763  if (nDataOut > 1) {
764  reason = "multi-op-return";
765  return false;
766  }
767 
768  return true;
769 }
770 
771 bool IsFinalTx(const CTransaction& tx, int nBlockHeight, int64_t nBlockTime)
772 {
773  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
774  // Time based nLockTime implemented in 0.1.6
775  if (tx.nLockTime == 0)
776  return true;
777  if (nBlockHeight == 0)
778  nBlockHeight = chainActive.Height();
779  if (nBlockTime == 0)
780  nBlockTime = GetAdjustedTime();
781  if ((int64_t)tx.nLockTime < ((int64_t)tx.nLockTime < LOCKTIME_THRESHOLD ? (int64_t)nBlockHeight : nBlockTime))
782  return true;
783  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTxIn& txin, tx.vin)
784  if (!txin.IsFinal())
785  return false;
786  return true;
787 }
788 
798 bool AreInputsStandard(const CTransaction& tx, const CCoinsViewCache& mapInputs)
799 {
800  if (tx.IsCoinBase() || tx.IsZerocoinSpend())
801  return true; // coinbase has no inputs and zerocoinspend has a special input
802  //todo should there be a check for a 'standard' zerocoinspend here?
803 
804  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vin.size(); i++) {
805  const CTxOut& prev = mapInputs.GetOutputFor(tx.vin[i]);
806 
807  vector<vector<unsigned char> > vSolutions;
808  txnouttype whichType;
809  // get the scriptPubKey corresponding to this input:
810  const CScript& prevScript = prev.scriptPubKey;
811  if (!Solver(prevScript, whichType, vSolutions))
812  return false;
813  int nArgsExpected = ScriptSigArgsExpected(whichType, vSolutions);
814  if (nArgsExpected < 0)
815  return false;
816 
817  // Transactions with extra stuff in their scriptSigs are
818  // non-standard. Note that this EvalScript() call will
819  // be quick, because if there are any operations
820  // beside "push data" in the scriptSig
821  // IsStandard() will have already returned false
822  // and this method isn't called.
823  vector<vector<unsigned char> > stack;
824  if (!EvalScript(stack, tx.vin[i].scriptSig, false, BaseSignatureChecker()))
825  return false;
826 
827  if (whichType == TX_SCRIPTHASH) {
828  if (stack.empty())
829  return false;
830  CScript subscript(stack.back().begin(), stack.back().end());
831  vector<vector<unsigned char> > vSolutions2;
832  txnouttype whichType2;
833  if (Solver(subscript, whichType2, vSolutions2)) {
834  int tmpExpected = ScriptSigArgsExpected(whichType2, vSolutions2);
835  if (tmpExpected < 0)
836  return false;
837  nArgsExpected += tmpExpected;
838  } else {
839  // Any other Script with less than 15 sigops OK:
840  unsigned int sigops = subscript.GetSigOpCount(true);
841  // ... extra data left on the stack after execution is OK, too:
842  return (sigops <= MAX_P2SH_SIGOPS);
843  }
844  }
845 
846  if (stack.size() != (unsigned int)nArgsExpected)
847  return false;
848  }
849 
850  return true;
851 }
852 
853 unsigned int GetLegacySigOpCount(const CTransaction& tx)
854 {
855  unsigned int nSigOps = 0;
856  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTxIn& txin, tx.vin) {
857  nSigOps += txin.scriptSig.GetSigOpCount(false);
858  }
859  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTxOut& txout, tx.vout) {
860  nSigOps += txout.scriptPubKey.GetSigOpCount(false);
861  }
862  return nSigOps;
863 }
864 
865 unsigned int GetP2SHSigOpCount(const CTransaction& tx, const CCoinsViewCache& inputs)
866 {
867  if (tx.IsCoinBase() || tx.IsZerocoinSpend())
868  return 0;
869 
870  unsigned int nSigOps = 0;
871  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vin.size(); i++) {
872  const CTxOut& prevout = inputs.GetOutputFor(tx.vin[i]);
873  if (prevout.scriptPubKey.IsPayToScriptHash())
874  nSigOps += prevout.scriptPubKey.GetSigOpCount(tx.vin[i].scriptSig);
875  }
876  return nSigOps;
877 }
878 
879 int GetInputAge(CTxIn& vin)
880 {
881  CCoinsView viewDummy;
882  CCoinsViewCache view(&viewDummy);
883  {
884  LOCK(mempool.cs);
885  CCoinsViewMemPool viewMempool(pcoinsTip, mempool);
886  view.SetBackend(viewMempool); // temporarily switch cache backend to db+mempool view
887 
888  const CCoins* coins = view.AccessCoins(vin.prevout.hash);
889 
890  if (coins) {
891  if (coins->nHeight < 0) return 0;
892  return (chainActive.Tip()->nHeight + 1) - coins->nHeight;
893  } else
894  return -1;
895  }
896 }
897 
898 int GetInputAgeIX(uint256 nTXHash, CTxIn& vin)
899 {
900  int sigs = 0;
901  int nResult = GetInputAge(vin);
902  if (nResult < 0) nResult = 0;
903 
904  if (nResult < 6) {
905  std::map<uint256, CTransactionLock>::iterator i = mapTxLocks.find(nTXHash);
906  if (i != mapTxLocks.end()) {
907  sigs = (*i).second.CountSignatures();
908  }
909  if (sigs >= SWIFTTX_SIGNATURES_REQUIRED) {
910  return nSwiftTXDepth + nResult;
911  }
912  }
913 
914  return -1;
915 }
916 
917 int GetIXConfirmations(uint256 nTXHash)
918 {
919  int sigs = 0;
920 
921  std::map<uint256, CTransactionLock>::iterator i = mapTxLocks.find(nTXHash);
922  if (i != mapTxLocks.end()) {
923  sigs = (*i).second.CountSignatures();
924  }
925  if (sigs >= SWIFTTX_SIGNATURES_REQUIRED) {
926  return nSwiftTXDepth;
927  }
928 
929  return 0;
930 }
931 
932 // ppcoin: total coin age spent in transaction, in the unit of coin-days.
933 // Only those coins meeting minimum age requirement counts. As those
934 // transactions not in main chain are not currently indexed so we
935 // might not find out about their coin age. Older transactions are
936 // guaranteed to be in main chain by sync-checkpoint. This rule is
937 // introduced to help nodes establish a consistent view of the coin
938 // age (trust score) of competing branches.
939 bool GetCoinAge(const CTransaction& tx, const unsigned int nTxTime, uint64_t& nCoinAge)
940 {
941  uint256 bnCentSecond = 0; // coin age in the unit of cent-seconds
942  nCoinAge = 0;
943 
944  CBlockIndex* pindex = NULL;
945  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTxIn& txin, tx.vin) {
946  // First try finding the previous transaction in database
947  CTransaction txPrev;
948  uint256 hashBlockPrev;
949  if (!GetTransaction(txin.prevout.hash, txPrev, hashBlockPrev, true)) {
950  LogPrintf("GetCoinAge: failed to find vin transaction \n");
951  continue; // previous transaction not in main chain
952  }
953 
954  BlockMap::iterator it = mapBlockIndex.find(hashBlockPrev);
955  if (it != mapBlockIndex.end())
956  pindex = it->second;
957  else {
958  LogPrintf("GetCoinAge() failed to find block index \n");
959  continue;
960  }
961 
962  // Read block header
963  CBlockHeader prevblock = pindex->GetBlockHeader();
964 
965  if (prevblock.nTime + nStakeMinAge > nTxTime)
966  continue; // only count coins meeting min age requirement
967 
968  if (nTxTime < prevblock.nTime) {
969  LogPrintf("GetCoinAge: Timestamp Violation: txtime less than txPrev.nTime");
970  return false; // Transaction timestamp violation
971  }
972 
973  int64_t nValueIn = txPrev.vout[txin.prevout.n].nValue;
974  bnCentSecond += uint256(nValueIn) * (nTxTime - prevblock.nTime);
975  }
976 
977  uint256 bnCoinDay = bnCentSecond / COIN / (24 * 60 * 60);
978  LogPrintf("coin age bnCoinDay=%s\n", bnCoinDay.ToString().c_str());
979  nCoinAge = bnCoinDay.GetCompact();
980  return true;
981 }
982 
983 bool MoneyRange(CAmount nValueOut)
984 {
985  return nValueOut >= 0 && nValueOut <= Params().MaxMoneyOut();
986 }
987 
988 int GetZerocoinStartHeight()
989 {
990  return Params().Zerocoin_StartHeight();
991 }
992 
993 void FindMints(vector<CZerocoinMint> vMintsToFind, vector<CZerocoinMint>& vMintsToUpdate, vector<CZerocoinMint>& vMissingMints, bool fExtendedSearch)
994 {
995  // see which mints are in our public zerocoin database. The mint should be here if it exists, unless
996  // something went wrong
997  for (CZerocoinMint mint : vMintsToFind) {
998  uint256 txHash;
999  if (!zerocoinDB->ReadCoinMint(mint.GetValue(), txHash)) {
1000  vMissingMints.push_back(mint);
1001  continue;
1002  }
1003 
1004  // make sure the txhash and block height meta data are correct for this mint
1005  CTransaction tx;
1006  uint256 hashBlock;
1007  if (!GetTransaction(txHash, tx, hashBlock, true)) {
1008  LogPrintf("%s : cannot find tx %s\n", __func__, txHash.GetHex());
1009  vMissingMints.push_back(mint);
1010  continue;
1011  }
1012 
1013  if (!mapBlockIndex.count(hashBlock)) {
1014  LogPrintf("%s : cannot find block %s\n", __func__, hashBlock.GetHex());
1015  vMissingMints.push_back(mint);
1016  continue;
1017  }
1018 
1019  //see if this mint is spent
1020  uint256 hashTxSpend = 0;
1021  zerocoinDB->ReadCoinSpend(mint.GetSerialNumber(), hashTxSpend);
1022  bool fSpent = hashTxSpend != 0;
1023 
1024  //if marked as spent, check that it actually made it into the chain
1025  CTransaction txSpend;
1026  uint256 hashBlockSpend;
1027  if (fSpent && !GetTransaction(hashTxSpend, txSpend, hashBlockSpend, true)) {
1028  LogPrintf("%s : cannot find spend tx %s\n", __func__, hashTxSpend.GetHex());
1029  zerocoinDB->EraseCoinSpend(mint.GetSerialNumber());
1030  mint.SetUsed(false);
1031  vMintsToUpdate.push_back(mint);
1032  continue;
1033  }
1034 
1035  //The mint has been incorrectly labelled as spent in zerocoinDB and needs to be undone
1036  int nHeightTx = 0;
1037  if (fSpent && !IsSerialInBlockchain(mint.GetSerialNumber(), nHeightTx)) {
1038  LogPrintf("%s : cannot find block %s. Erasing coinspend from zerocoinDB.\n", __func__, hashBlockSpend.GetHex());
1039  zerocoinDB->EraseCoinSpend(mint.GetSerialNumber());
1040  mint.SetUsed(false);
1041  vMintsToUpdate.push_back(mint);
1042  continue;
1043  }
1044 
1045  // if meta data is correct, then no need to update
1046  if (mint.GetTxHash() == txHash && mint.GetHeight() == mapBlockIndex[hashBlock]->nHeight && mint.IsUsed() == fSpent)
1047  continue;
1048 
1049  //mark this mint for update
1050  mint.SetTxHash(txHash);
1051  mint.SetHeight(mapBlockIndex[hashBlock]->nHeight);
1052  mint.SetUsed(fSpent);
1053 
1054  vMintsToUpdate.push_back(mint);
1055  }
1056 
1057  if (fExtendedSearch)
1058  {
1059  // search the blockchain for the meta data on our missing mints
1060  int nZerocoinStartHeight = GetZerocoinStartHeight();
1061 
1062  for (int i = nZerocoinStartHeight; i < chainActive.Height(); i++) {
1063 
1064  if(i % 1000 == 0)
1065  LogPrintf("%s : scanned %d blocks\n", __func__, i - nZerocoinStartHeight);
1066 
1067  if(chainActive[i]->vMintDenominationsInBlock.empty())
1068  continue;
1069 
1070  CBlock block;
1071  if(!ReadBlockFromDisk(block, chainActive[i]))
1072  continue;
1073 
1074  list<CZerocoinMint> vMints;
1075  if(!BlockToZerocoinMintList(block, vMints, true))
1076  continue;
1077 
1078  // search the blocks mints to see if it contains the mint that is requesting meta data updates
1079  for (CZerocoinMint mintBlockChain : vMints) {
1080  for (CZerocoinMint mintMissing : vMissingMints) {
1081  if (mintMissing.GetValue() == mintBlockChain.GetValue()) {
1082  LogPrintf("%s FOUND %s in block %d\n", __func__, mintMissing.GetValue().GetHex(), i);
1083  mintMissing.SetHeight(i);
1084  mintMissing.SetTxHash(mintBlockChain.GetTxHash());
1085  vMintsToUpdate.push_back(mintMissing);
1086  }
1087  }
1088  }
1089  }
1090  }
1091 
1092  //remove any missing mints that were found
1093  for (CZerocoinMint mintMissing : vMissingMints) {
1094  for (CZerocoinMint mintFound : vMintsToUpdate) {
1095  if (mintMissing.GetValue() == mintFound.GetValue())
1096  std::remove(vMissingMints.begin(), vMissingMints.end(), mintMissing);
1097  }
1098  }
1099 
1100 }
1101 
1102 bool GetZerocoinMint(const CBigNum& bnPubcoin, uint256& txHash)
1103 {
1104  txHash = 0;
1105  return zerocoinDB->ReadCoinMint(bnPubcoin, txHash);
1106 }
1107 
1108 bool IsSerialKnown(const CBigNum& bnSerial)
1109 {
1110  uint256 txHash = 0;
1111  return zerocoinDB->ReadCoinSpend(bnSerial, txHash);
1112 }
1113 
1114 bool IsSerialInBlockchain(const CBigNum& bnSerial, int& nHeightTx)
1115 {
1116  uint256 txHash = 0;
1117  // if not in zerocoinDB then its not in the blockchain
1118  if (!zerocoinDB->ReadCoinSpend(bnSerial, txHash))
1119  return false;
1120 
1121  CTransaction tx;
1122  uint256 hashBlock;
1123  if (!GetTransaction(txHash, tx, hashBlock, true))
1124  return false;
1125 
1126  bool inChain = mapBlockIndex.count(hashBlock) && chainActive.Contains(mapBlockIndex[hashBlock]);
1127  if (inChain)
1128  nHeightTx = mapBlockIndex.at(hashBlock)->nHeight;
1129 
1130  return inChain;
1131 }
1132 
1133 bool RemoveSerialFromDB(const CBigNum& bnSerial)
1134 {
1135  return zerocoinDB->EraseCoinSpend(bnSerial);
1136 }
1137 
1139 bool RecordMintToDB(PublicCoin publicZerocoin, const uint256& txHash)
1140 {
1141  //Check the pubCoinValue didn't already store in the zerocoin database. todo: pubcoin memory map?
1142  //write the zerocoinmint to db if we don't already have it
1143  //note that many of the mint parameters are not set here because those params are private to the minter
1144  CZerocoinMint pubCoinTx;
1145  uint256 hashFromDB;
1146  if (zerocoinDB->ReadCoinMint(publicZerocoin.getValue(), hashFromDB)) {
1147  if(hashFromDB == txHash)
1148  return true;
1149 
1150  LogPrintf("RecordMintToDB: failed, we already have this public coin recorded\n");
1151  return false;
1152  }
1153 
1154  if (!zerocoinDB->WriteCoinMint(publicZerocoin, txHash)) {
1155  LogPrintf("RecordMintToDB: failed to record public coin to DB\n");
1156  return false;
1157  }
1158 
1159  return true;
1160 }
1161 
1162 bool TxOutToPublicCoin(const CTxOut txout, PublicCoin& pubCoin, CValidationState& state)
1163 {
1164  CBigNum publicZerocoin;
1165  vector<unsigned char> vchZeroMint;
1166  vchZeroMint.insert(vchZeroMint.end(), txout.scriptPubKey.begin() + SCRIPT_OFFSET,
1167  txout.scriptPubKey.begin() + txout.scriptPubKey.size());
1168  publicZerocoin.setvch(vchZeroMint);
1169 
1170  CoinDenomination denomination = AmountToZerocoinDenomination(txout.nValue);
1171  LogPrint("zero", "%s ZCPRINT denomination %d pubcoin %s\n", __func__, denomination, publicZerocoin.GetHex());
1172  if (denomination == ZQ_ERROR)
1173  return state.DoS(100, error("TxOutToPublicCoin : txout.nValue is not correct"));
1174 
1175  PublicCoin checkPubCoin(Params().Zerocoin_Params(), publicZerocoin, denomination);
1176  pubCoin = checkPubCoin;
1177 
1178  return true;
1179 }
1180 
1181 bool BlockToPubcoinList(const CBlock& block, list<PublicCoin>& listPubcoins, bool fFilterInvalid)
1182 {
1183  for (const CTransaction tx : block.vtx) {
1184  if(!tx.IsZerocoinMint())
1185  continue;
1186 
1187  // Filter out mints that have used invalid outpoints
1188  if (fFilterInvalid) {
1189  bool fValid = true;
1190  for (const CTxIn in : tx.vin) {
1191  if (!ValidOutPoint(in.prevout, INT_MAX)) {
1192  fValid = false;
1193  break;
1194  }
1195  }
1196  if (!fValid)
1197  continue;
1198  }
1199 
1200  uint256 txHash = tx.GetHash();
1201  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vout.size(); i++) {
1202  //Filter out mints that use invalid outpoints - edge case: invalid spend with minted change
1203  if (fFilterInvalid && !ValidOutPoint(COutPoint(txHash, i), INT_MAX))
1204  break;
1205 
1206  const CTxOut txOut = tx.vout[i];
1207  if(!txOut.scriptPubKey.IsZerocoinMint())
1208  continue;
1209 
1210  CValidationState state;
1211  PublicCoin pubCoin(Params().Zerocoin_Params());
1212  if(!TxOutToPublicCoin(txOut, pubCoin, state))
1213  return false;
1214 
1215  listPubcoins.emplace_back(pubCoin);
1216  }
1217  }
1218 
1219  return true;
1220 }
1221 
1222 //return a list of zerocoin mints contained in a specific block
1223 bool BlockToZerocoinMintList(const CBlock& block, std::list<CZerocoinMint>& vMints, bool fFilterInvalid)
1224 {
1225  for (const CTransaction tx : block.vtx) {
1226  if(!tx.IsZerocoinMint())
1227  continue;
1228 
1229  // Filter out mints that have used invalid outpoints
1230  if (fFilterInvalid) {
1231  bool fValid = true;
1232  for (const CTxIn in : tx.vin) {
1233  if (!ValidOutPoint(in.prevout, INT_MAX)) {
1234  fValid = false;
1235  break;
1236  }
1237  }
1238  if (!fValid)
1239  continue;
1240  }
1241 
1242  uint256 txHash = tx.GetHash();
1243  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vout.size(); i++) {
1244  //Filter out mints that use invalid outpoints - edge case: invalid spend with minted change
1245  if (fFilterInvalid && !ValidOutPoint(COutPoint(txHash, i), INT_MAX))
1246  break;
1247 
1248  const CTxOut txOut = tx.vout[i];
1249  if(!txOut.scriptPubKey.IsZerocoinMint())
1250  continue;
1251 
1252  CValidationState state;
1253  PublicCoin pubCoin(Params().Zerocoin_Params());
1254  if(!TxOutToPublicCoin(txOut, pubCoin, state))
1255  return false;
1256 
1257  CZerocoinMint mint = CZerocoinMint(pubCoin.getDenomination(), pubCoin.getValue(), 0, 0, false);
1258  mint.SetTxHash(tx.GetHash());
1259  vMints.push_back(mint);
1260  }
1261  }
1262 
1263  return true;
1264 }
1265 
1266 bool BlockToMintValueVector(const CBlock& block, const CoinDenomination denom, vector<CBigNum>& vValues)
1267 {
1268  for (const CTransaction tx : block.vtx) {
1269  if(!tx.IsZerocoinMint())
1270  continue;
1271 
1272  for (const CTxOut txOut : tx.vout) {
1273  if(!txOut.scriptPubKey.IsZerocoinMint())
1274  continue;
1275 
1276  CValidationState state;
1277  PublicCoin coin(Params().Zerocoin_Params());
1278  if(!TxOutToPublicCoin(txOut, coin, state))
1279  return false;
1280 
1281  if (coin.getDenomination() != denom)
1282  continue;
1283 
1284  vValues.push_back(coin.getValue());
1285  }
1286  }
1287 
1288  return true;
1289 }
1290 
1291 //return a list of zerocoin spends contained in a specific block, list may have many denominations
1292 std::list<libzerocoin::CoinDenomination> ZerocoinSpendListFromBlock(const CBlock& block, bool fFilterInvalid)
1293 {
1294  std::list<libzerocoin::CoinDenomination> vSpends;
1295  for (const CTransaction tx : block.vtx) {
1296  if (!tx.IsZerocoinSpend())
1297  continue;
1298 
1299  for (const CTxIn txin : tx.vin) {
1300  if (!txin.scriptSig.IsZerocoinSpend())
1301  continue;
1302 
1303  if (fFilterInvalid) {
1304  CoinSpend spend = TxInToZerocoinSpend(txin);
1305  if (mapInvalidSerials.count(spend.getCoinSerialNumber()))
1306  continue;
1307  }
1308 
1309  libzerocoin::CoinDenomination c = libzerocoin::IntToZerocoinDenomination(txin.nSequence);
1310  vSpends.push_back(c);
1311  }
1312  }
1313  return vSpends;
1314 }
1315 
1316 bool CheckZerocoinMint(const uint256& txHash, const CTxOut& txout, CValidationState& state, bool fCheckOnly)
1317 {
1318  PublicCoin pubCoin(Params().Zerocoin_Params());
1319  if(!TxOutToPublicCoin(txout, pubCoin, state))
1320  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckZerocoinMint(): TxOutToPublicCoin() failed"));
1321 
1322  if (!pubCoin.validate())
1323  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckZerocoinMint() : PubCoin does not validate"));
1324 
1325  if(!fCheckOnly && !RecordMintToDB(pubCoin, txHash))
1326  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckZerocoinMint(): RecordMintToDB() failed"));
1327 
1328  return true;
1329 }
1330 
1331 CoinSpend TxInToZerocoinSpend(const CTxIn& txin)
1332 {
1333  // Deserialize the CoinSpend intro a fresh object
1334  std::vector<char, zero_after_free_allocator<char> > dataTxIn;
1335  dataTxIn.insert(dataTxIn.end(), txin.scriptSig.begin() + BIGNUM_SIZE, txin.scriptSig.end());
1336 
1337  CDataStream serializedCoinSpend(dataTxIn, SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION);
1338  return CoinSpend(Params().Zerocoin_Params(), serializedCoinSpend);
1339 }
1340 
1341 bool IsZerocoinSpendUnknown(CoinSpend coinSpend, uint256 hashTx, CValidationState& state)
1342 {
1343  uint256 hashTxFromDB;
1344  if(zerocoinDB->ReadCoinSpend(coinSpend.getCoinSerialNumber(), hashTxFromDB))
1345  return hashTx == hashTxFromDB;
1346 
1347  if(!zerocoinDB->WriteCoinSpend(coinSpend.getCoinSerialNumber(), hashTx))
1348  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckZerocoinSpend(): Failed to write zerocoin mint to database"));
1349 
1350  return true;
1351 }
1352 
1353 bool CheckZerocoinSpend(const CTransaction tx, bool fVerifySignature, CValidationState& state)
1354 {
1355  //max needed non-mint outputs should be 2 - one for redemption address and a possible 2nd for change
1356  if (tx.vout.size() > 2) {
1357  int outs = 0;
1358  for (const CTxOut out : tx.vout) {
1359  if (out.IsZerocoinMint())
1360  continue;
1361  outs++;
1362  }
1363  if (outs > 2)
1364  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckZerocoinSpend(): over two non-mint outputs in a zerocoinspend transaction"));
1365  }
1366 
1367  //compute the txout hash that is used for the zerocoinspend signatures
1368  CMutableTransaction txTemp;
1369  for (const CTxOut out : tx.vout) {
1370  txTemp.vout.push_back(out);
1371  }
1372  uint256 hashTxOut = txTemp.GetHash();
1373 
1374  bool fValidated = false;
1375  set<CBigNum> serials;
1376  list<CoinSpend> vSpends;
1377  CAmount nTotalRedeemed = 0;
1378  for (const CTxIn& txin : tx.vin) {
1379 
1380  //only check txin that is a zcspend
1381  if (!txin.scriptSig.IsZerocoinSpend())
1382  continue;
1383 
1384  CoinSpend newSpend = TxInToZerocoinSpend(txin);
1385  vSpends.push_back(newSpend);
1386 
1387  //check that the denomination is valid
1388  if (newSpend.getDenomination() == ZQ_ERROR)
1389  return state.DoS(100, error("Zerocoinspend does not have the correct denomination"));
1390 
1391  //check that denomination is what it claims to be in nSequence
1392  if (newSpend.getDenomination() != txin.nSequence)
1393  return state.DoS(100, error("Zerocoinspend nSequence denomination does not match CoinSpend"));
1394 
1395  //make sure the txout has not changed
1396  if (newSpend.getTxOutHash() != hashTxOut)
1397  return state.DoS(100, error("Zerocoinspend does not use the same txout that was used in the SoK"));
1398 
1399  // Skip signature verification during initial block download
1400  if (fVerifySignature) {
1401  //see if we have record of the accumulator used in the spend tx
1402  CBigNum bnAccumulatorValue = 0;
1403  if(!zerocoinDB->ReadAccumulatorValue(newSpend.getAccumulatorChecksum(), bnAccumulatorValue))
1404  return state.DoS(100, error("Zerocoinspend could not find accumulator associated with checksum"));
1405 
1406  Accumulator accumulator(Params().Zerocoin_Params(), newSpend.getDenomination(), bnAccumulatorValue);
1407 
1408  //Check that the coin is on the accumulator
1409  if(!newSpend.Verify(accumulator))
1410  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckZerocoinSpend(): zerocoin spend did not verify"));
1411  }
1412 
1413  if (serials.count(newSpend.getCoinSerialNumber()))
1414  return state.DoS(100, error("Zerocoinspend serial is used twice in the same tx"));
1415  serials.insert(newSpend.getCoinSerialNumber());
1416 
1417  //make sure that there is no over redemption of coins
1418  nTotalRedeemed += ZerocoinDenominationToAmount(newSpend.getDenomination());
1419  fValidated = true;
1420  }
1421 
1422  if (nTotalRedeemed < tx.GetValueOut()) {
1423  LogPrintf("redeemed = %s , spend = %s \n", FormatMoney(nTotalRedeemed), FormatMoney(tx.GetValueOut()));
1424  return state.DoS(100, error("Transaction spend more than was redeemed in zerocoins"));
1425  }
1426 
1427  // Send signal to wallet if this is ours
1428  if (pwalletMain) {
1429  CWalletDB walletdb(pwalletMain->strWalletFile);
1430  list <CBigNum> listMySerials = walletdb.ListMintedCoinsSerial();
1431  for (const auto& newSpend : vSpends) {
1432  list<CBigNum>::iterator it = find(listMySerials.begin(), listMySerials.end(), newSpend.getCoinSerialNumber());
1433  if (it != listMySerials.end()) {
1434  LogPrintf("%s: %s detected spent zerocoin mint in transaction %s \n", __func__, it->GetHex(), tx.GetHash().GetHex());
1435  pwalletMain->NotifyZerocoinChanged(pwalletMain, it->GetHex(), "Used", CT_UPDATED);
1436  }
1437  }
1438  }
1439 
1440  return fValidated;
1441 }
1442 
1443 bool CheckTransaction(const CTransaction& tx, bool fZerocoinActive, bool fRejectBadUTXO, CValidationState& state)
1444 {
1445  // Basic checks that don't depend on any context
1446  if (tx.vin.empty())
1447  return state.DoS(10, error("CheckTransaction() : vin empty"),
1448  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-vin-empty");
1449  if (tx.vout.empty())
1450  return state.DoS(10, error("CheckTransaction() : vout empty"),
1451  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-vout-empty");
1452 
1453  // Size limits
1454  unsigned int nMaxSize = MAX_ZEROCOIN_TX_SIZE;
1455 
1456  if (::GetSerializeSize(tx, SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION) > nMaxSize)
1457  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckTransaction() : size limits failed"),
1458  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-oversize");
1459 
1460  // Check for negative or overflow output values
1461  CAmount nValueOut = 0;
1462  int nZCSpendCount = 0;
1463  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTxOut& txout, tx.vout) {
1464  if (txout.IsEmpty() && !tx.IsCoinBase() && !tx.IsCoinStake())
1465  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckTransaction(): txout empty for user transaction"));
1466  if (txout.nValue < 0)
1467  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckTransaction() : txout.nValue negative"),
1468  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-vout-negative");
1469  if (txout.nValue > Params().MaxMoneyOut())
1470  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckTransaction() : txout.nValue too high"),
1471  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-vout-toolarge");
1472  nValueOut += txout.nValue;
1473  if (!MoneyRange(nValueOut))
1474  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckTransaction() : txout total out of range"),
1475  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-txouttotal-toolarge");
1476  if (fZerocoinActive && txout.IsZerocoinMint()) {
1477  if(!CheckZerocoinMint(tx.GetHash(), txout, state, false))
1478  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckTransaction() : invalid zerocoin mint"));
1479  }
1480  if (fZerocoinActive && txout.scriptPubKey.IsZerocoinSpend())
1481  nZCSpendCount++;
1482  }
1483 
1484  if (fZerocoinActive) {
1485  if (nZCSpendCount > Params().Zerocoin_MaxSpendsPerTransaction())
1486  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckTransaction() : there are more zerocoin spends than are allowed in one transaction"));
1487 
1488  if (tx.IsZerocoinSpend()) {
1489  //require that a zerocoinspend only has inputs that are zerocoins
1490  for (const CTxIn in : tx.vin) {
1491  if (!in.scriptSig.IsZerocoinSpend())
1492  return state.DoS(100,
1493  error("CheckTransaction() : zerocoinspend contains inputs that are not zerocoins"));
1494  }
1495 
1496  // Do not require signature verification if this is initial sync and a block over 24 hours old
1497  bool fVerifySignature = !IsInitialBlockDownload() && (GetTime() - chainActive.Tip()->GetBlockTime() < (60*60*24));
1498  if (!CheckZerocoinSpend(tx, fVerifySignature, state))
1499  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckTransaction() : invalid zerocoin spend"));
1500  }
1501  }
1502 
1503  // Check for duplicate inputs
1504  set<COutPoint> vInOutPoints;
1505  set<CBigNum> vZerocoinSpendSerials;
1506  for (const CTxIn& txin : tx.vin) {
1507  if (vInOutPoints.count(txin.prevout))
1508  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckTransaction() : duplicate inputs"),
1509  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-inputs-duplicate");
1510 
1511  //duplicate zcspend serials are checked in CheckZerocoinSpend()
1512  if (!txin.scriptSig.IsZerocoinSpend())
1513  vInOutPoints.insert(txin.prevout);
1514  }
1515 
1516  if (tx.IsCoinBase()) {
1517  if (tx.vin[0].scriptSig.size() < 2 || tx.vin[0].scriptSig.size() > 150)
1518  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckTransaction() : coinbase script size=%d", tx.vin[0].scriptSig.size()),
1519  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-cb-length");
1520  } else if (fZerocoinActive && tx.IsZerocoinSpend()) {
1521  if(tx.vin.size() < 1 || static_cast<int>(tx.vin.size()) > Params().Zerocoin_MaxSpendsPerTransaction())
1522  return state.DoS(10, error("CheckTransaction() : Zerocoin Spend has more than allowed txin's"), REJECT_INVALID, "bad-zerocoinspend");
1523  } else {
1524  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTxIn& txin, tx.vin)
1525  if (txin.prevout.IsNull() && (fZerocoinActive && !txin.scriptSig.IsZerocoinSpend()))
1526  return state.DoS(10, error("CheckTransaction() : prevout is null"),
1527  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-prevout-null");
1528  }
1529 
1530  return true;
1531 }
1532 
1533 bool CheckFinalTx(const CTransaction& tx, int flags)
1534 {
1535  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
1536 
1537  // By convention a negative value for flags indicates that the
1538  // current network-enforced consensus rules should be used. In
1539  // a future soft-fork scenario that would mean checking which
1540  // rules would be enforced for the next block and setting the
1541  // appropriate flags. At the present time no soft-forks are
1542  // scheduled, so no flags are set.
1543  flags = std::max(flags, 0);
1544 
1545  // CheckFinalTx() uses chainActive.Height()+1 to evaluate
1546  // nLockTime because when IsFinalTx() is called within
1547  // CBlock::AcceptBlock(), the height of the block *being*
1548  // evaluated is what is used. Thus if we want to know if a
1549  // transaction can be part of the *next* block, we need to call
1550  // IsFinalTx() with one more than chainActive.Height().
1551  const int nBlockHeight = chainActive.Height() + 1;
1552 
1553  // BIP113 will require that time-locked transactions have nLockTime set to
1554  // less than the median time of the previous block they're contained in.
1555  // When the next block is created its previous block will be the current
1556  // chain tip, so we use that to calculate the median time passed to
1557  // IsFinalTx() if LOCKTIME_MEDIAN_TIME_PAST is set.
1558  const int64_t nBlockTime = (flags & LOCKTIME_MEDIAN_TIME_PAST) ? chainActive.Tip()->GetMedianTimePast() : GetAdjustedTime();
1559 
1560  return IsFinalTx(tx, nBlockHeight, nBlockTime);
1561 }
1562 
1563 CAmount GetMinRelayFee(const CTransaction& tx, unsigned int nBytes, bool fAllowFree)
1564 {
1565  {
1566  LOCK(mempool.cs);
1567  uint256 hash = tx.GetHash();
1568  double dPriorityDelta = 0;
1569  CAmount nFeeDelta = 0;
1570  mempool.ApplyDeltas(hash, dPriorityDelta, nFeeDelta);
1571  if (dPriorityDelta > 0 || nFeeDelta > 0)
1572  return 0;
1573  }
1574 
1575  CAmount nMinFee = ::minRelayTxFee.GetFee(nBytes);
1576 
1577  if (fAllowFree) {
1578  // There is a free transaction area in blocks created by most miners,
1579  // * If we are relaying we allow transactions up to DEFAULT_BLOCK_PRIORITY_SIZE - 1000
1580  // to be considered to fall into this category. We don't want to encourage sending
1581  // multiple transactions instead of one big transaction to avoid fees.
1582  if (nBytes < (DEFAULT_BLOCK_PRIORITY_SIZE - 1000))
1583  nMinFee = 0;
1584  }
1585 
1586  if (!MoneyRange(nMinFee))
1587  nMinFee = Params().MaxMoneyOut();
1588  return nMinFee;
1589 }
1590 
1591 
1592 bool AcceptToMemoryPool(CTxMemPool& pool, CValidationState& state, const CTransaction& tx, bool fLimitFree, bool* pfMissingInputs, bool fRejectInsaneFee, bool ignoreFees)
1593 {
1594  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
1595  if (pfMissingInputs)
1596  *pfMissingInputs = false;
1597 
1598  //Temporarily disable zerocoin for maintenance
1599  if (GetAdjustedTime() > GetSporkValue(SPORK_16_ZEROCOIN_MAINTENANCE_MODE) && tx.ContainsZerocoins())
1600  return state.DoS(10, error("AcceptToMemoryPool : Zerocoin transactions are temporarily disabled for maintenance"), REJECT_INVALID, "bad-tx");
1601 
1602  if (!CheckTransaction(tx, chainActive.Height() >= Params().Zerocoin_StartHeight(), true, state))
1603  return state.DoS(100, error("AcceptToMemoryPool: : CheckTransaction failed"), REJECT_INVALID, "bad-tx");
1604 
1605  // Coinbase is only valid in a block, not as a loose transaction
1606  if (tx.IsCoinBase())
1607  return state.DoS(100, error("AcceptToMemoryPool: : coinbase as individual tx"),
1608  REJECT_INVALID, "coinbase");
1609 
1610  //Coinstake is also only valid in a block, not as a loose transaction
1611  if (tx.IsCoinStake())
1612  return state.DoS(100, error("AcceptToMemoryPool: coinstake as individual tx"),
1613  REJECT_INVALID, "coinstake");
1614 
1615  // Rather not work on nonstandard transactions (unless -testnet/-regtest)
1616  string reason;
1617  if (Params().RequireStandard() && !IsStandardTx(tx, reason))
1618  return state.DoS(0,
1619  error("AcceptToMemoryPool : nonstandard transaction: %s", reason),
1620  REJECT_NONSTANDARD, reason);
1621  // is it already in the memory pool?
1622  uint256 hash = tx.GetHash();
1623  if (pool.exists(hash)) {
1624  LogPrintf("%s tx already in mempool\n", __func__);
1625  return false;
1626  }
1627 
1628  // ----------- swiftTX transaction scanning -----------
1629 
1630  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTxIn& in, tx.vin) {
1631  if (mapLockedInputs.count(in.prevout)) {
1632  if (mapLockedInputs[in.prevout] != tx.GetHash()) {
1633  return state.DoS(0,
1634  error("AcceptToMemoryPool : conflicts with existing transaction lock: %s", reason),
1635  REJECT_INVALID, "tx-lock-conflict");
1636  }
1637  }
1638  }
1639 
1640  // Check for conflicts with in-memory transactions
1641  if (!tx.IsZerocoinSpend()) {
1642  LOCK(pool.cs); // protect pool.mapNextTx
1643  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vin.size(); i++) {
1644  COutPoint outpoint = tx.vin[i].prevout;
1645  if (pool.mapNextTx.count(outpoint)) {
1646  // Disable replacement feature for now
1647  return false;
1648  }
1649  }
1650  }
1651 
1652 
1653  {
1654  CCoinsView dummy;
1655  CCoinsViewCache view(&dummy);
1656 
1657  CAmount nValueIn = 0;
1658  if(tx.IsZerocoinSpend()){
1659  nValueIn = tx.GetZerocoinSpent();
1660 
1661  //Check that txid is not already in the chain
1662  int nHeightTx = 0;
1663  if (IsTransactionInChain(tx.GetHash(), nHeightTx))
1664  return state.Invalid(error("AcceptToMemoryPool : zDiv spend tx %s already in block %d", tx.GetHash().GetHex(), nHeightTx),
1665  REJECT_DUPLICATE, "bad-txns-inputs-spent");
1666 
1667  //Check for double spending of serial #'s
1668  for (const CTxIn& txIn : tx.vin) {
1669  if (!txIn.scriptSig.IsZerocoinSpend())
1670  continue;
1671  CoinSpend spend = TxInToZerocoinSpend(txIn);
1672  int nHeightTx = 0;
1673  if (IsSerialInBlockchain(spend.getCoinSerialNumber(), nHeightTx))
1674  return state.Invalid(error("%s : zDiv spend with serial %s is already in block %d\n",
1675  __func__, spend.getCoinSerialNumber().GetHex(), nHeightTx));
1676 
1677  //Is serial in the acceptable range
1678  if (!spend.HasValidSerial(Params().Zerocoin_Params()))
1679  return state.Invalid(error("%s : zDiv spend with serial %s from tx %s is not in valid range\n",
1680  __func__, spend.getCoinSerialNumber().GetHex(), tx.GetHash().GetHex()));
1681  }
1682  } else {
1683  LOCK(pool.cs);
1684  CCoinsViewMemPool viewMemPool(pcoinsTip, pool);
1685  view.SetBackend(viewMemPool);
1686 
1687  // do we already have it?
1688  if (view.HaveCoins(hash))
1689  return false;
1690 
1691  // do all inputs exist?
1692  // Note that this does not check for the presence of actual outputs (see the next check for that),
1693  // only helps filling in pfMissingInputs (to determine missing vs spent).
1694  for (const CTxIn txin : tx.vin) {
1695  if (!view.HaveCoins(txin.prevout.hash)) {
1696  if (pfMissingInputs)
1697  *pfMissingInputs = true;
1698  return false;
1699  }
1700 
1701  //Check for invalid/fraudulent inputs
1702  if (!ValidOutPoint(txin.prevout, chainActive.Height())) {
1703  return state.Invalid(error("%s : tried to spend invalid input %s in tx %s", __func__, txin.prevout.ToString(),
1704  tx.GetHash().GetHex()), REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-invalid-inputs");
1705  }
1706  }
1707 
1708  // are the actual inputs available?
1709  if (!view.HaveInputs(tx))
1710  return state.Invalid(error("AcceptToMemoryPool : inputs already spent"),
1711  REJECT_DUPLICATE, "bad-txns-inputs-spent");
1712 
1713  // Bring the best block into scope
1714  view.GetBestBlock();
1715 
1716  nValueIn = view.GetValueIn(tx);
1717 
1718  // we have all inputs cached now, so switch back to dummy, so we don't need to keep lock on mempool
1719  view.SetBackend(dummy);
1720  }
1721 
1722  // Check for non-standard pay-to-script-hash in inputs
1723  if (Params().RequireStandard() && !AreInputsStandard(tx, view))
1724  return error("AcceptToMemoryPool: : nonstandard transaction input");
1725 
1726  // Check that the transaction doesn't have an excessive number of
1727  // sigops, making it impossible to mine. Since the coinbase transaction
1728  // itself can contain sigops MAX_TX_SIGOPS is less than
1729  // MAX_BLOCK_SIGOPS; we still consider this an invalid rather than
1730  // merely non-standard transaction.
1731  if (!tx.IsZerocoinSpend()) {
1732  unsigned int nSigOps = GetLegacySigOpCount(tx);
1733  unsigned int nMaxSigOps = MAX_TX_SIGOPS_CURRENT;
1734  nSigOps += GetP2SHSigOpCount(tx, view);
1735  if(nSigOps > nMaxSigOps)
1736  return state.DoS(0,
1737  error("AcceptToMemoryPool : too many sigops %s, %d > %d",
1738  hash.ToString(), nSigOps, nMaxSigOps),
1739  REJECT_NONSTANDARD, "bad-txns-too-many-sigops");
1740  }
1741 
1742  CAmount nValueOut = tx.GetValueOut();
1743  CAmount nFees = nValueIn - nValueOut;
1744  double dPriority = 0;
1745  if (!tx.IsZerocoinSpend())
1746  view.GetPriority(tx, chainActive.Height());
1747 
1748  CTxMemPoolEntry entry(tx, nFees, GetTime(), dPriority, chainActive.Height());
1749  unsigned int nSize = entry.GetTxSize();
1750 
1751  // Don't accept it if it can't get into a block
1752  // but prioritise dstx and don't check fees for it
1753  if (mapObfuscationBroadcastTxes.count(hash)) {
1754  mempool.PrioritiseTransaction(hash, hash.ToString(), 1000, 0.1 * COIN);
1755  } else if (!ignoreFees) {
1756  CAmount txMinFee = GetMinRelayFee(tx, nSize, true);
1757  if (fLimitFree && nFees < txMinFee && !tx.IsZerocoinSpend())
1758  return state.DoS(0, error("AcceptToMemoryPool : not enough fees %s, %d < %d",
1759  hash.ToString(), nFees, txMinFee),
1760  REJECT_INSUFFICIENTFEE, "insufficient fee");
1761 
1762  // Require that free transactions have sufficient priority to be mined in the next block.
1763  if (tx.IsZerocoinMint()) {
1764  if(nFees < Params().Zerocoin_MintFee() * tx.GetZerocoinMintCount())
1765  return state.DoS(0, false, REJECT_INSUFFICIENTFEE, "insufficient fee for zerocoinmint");
1766  } else if (!tx.IsZerocoinSpend() && GetBoolArg("-relaypriority", true) && nFees < ::minRelayTxFee.GetFee(nSize) && !AllowFree(view.GetPriority(tx, chainActive.Height() + 1))) {
1767  return state.DoS(0, false, REJECT_INSUFFICIENTFEE, "insufficient priority");
1768  }
1769 
1770  // Continuously rate-limit free (really, very-low-fee) transactions
1771  // This mitigates 'penny-flooding' -- sending thousands of free transactions just to
1772  // be annoying or make others' transactions take longer to confirm.
1773  if (fLimitFree && nFees < ::minRelayTxFee.GetFee(nSize) && !tx.IsZerocoinSpend()) {
1774  static CCriticalSection csFreeLimiter;
1775  static double dFreeCount;
1776  static int64_t nLastTime;
1777  int64_t nNow = GetTime();
1778 
1779  LOCK(csFreeLimiter);
1780 
1781  // Use an exponentially decaying ~10-minute window:
1782  dFreeCount *= pow(1.0 - 1.0 / 600.0, (double)(nNow - nLastTime));
1783  nLastTime = nNow;
1784  // -limitfreerelay unit is thousand-bytes-per-minute
1785  // At default rate it would take over a month to fill 1GB
1786  if (dFreeCount >= GetArg("-limitfreerelay", 30) * 10 * 1000)
1787  return state.DoS(0, error("AcceptToMemoryPool : free transaction rejected by rate limiter"),
1788  REJECT_INSUFFICIENTFEE, "rate limited free transaction");
1789  LogPrint("mempool", "Rate limit dFreeCount: %g => %g\n", dFreeCount, dFreeCount + nSize);
1790  dFreeCount += nSize;
1791  }
1792  }
1793 
1794  if (fRejectInsaneFee && nFees > ::minRelayTxFee.GetFee(nSize) * 10000)
1795  return error("AcceptToMemoryPool: : insane fees %s, %d > %d",
1796  hash.ToString(),
1797  nFees, ::minRelayTxFee.GetFee(nSize) * 10000);
1798 
1799  // Check against previous transactions
1800  // This is done last to help prevent CPU exhaustion denial-of-service attacks.
1801  if (!CheckInputs(tx, state, view, true, STANDARD_SCRIPT_VERIFY_FLAGS, true)) {
1802  return error("AcceptToMemoryPool: : ConnectInputs failed %s", hash.ToString());
1803  }
1804 
1805  // Check again against just the consensus-critical mandatory script
1806  // verification flags, in case of bugs in the standard flags that cause
1807  // transactions to pass as valid when they're actually invalid. For
1808  // instance the STRICTENC flag was incorrectly allowing certain
1809  // CHECKSIG NOT scripts to pass, even though they were invalid.
1810  //
1811  // There is a similar check in CreateNewBlock() to prevent creating
1812  // invalid blocks, however allowing such transactions into the mempool
1813  // can be exploited as a DoS attack.
1814  if (!CheckInputs(tx, state, view, true, MANDATORY_SCRIPT_VERIFY_FLAGS, true)) {
1815  return error("AcceptToMemoryPool: : BUG! PLEASE REPORT THIS! ConnectInputs failed against MANDATORY but not STANDARD flags %s", hash.ToString());
1816  }
1817 
1818  // Store transaction in memory
1819  pool.addUnchecked(hash, entry);
1820  }
1821 
1822  SyncWithWallets(tx, NULL);
1823 
1824  return true;
1825 }
1826 
1827 bool AcceptableInputs(CTxMemPool& pool, CValidationState& state, const CTransaction& tx, bool fLimitFree, bool* pfMissingInputs, bool fRejectInsaneFee, bool isDSTX)
1828 {
1829  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
1830  if (pfMissingInputs)
1831  *pfMissingInputs = false;
1832 
1833  if (!CheckTransaction(tx, chainActive.Height() >= Params().Zerocoin_StartHeight(), true, state))
1834  return error("AcceptableInputs: : CheckTransaction failed");
1835 
1836  // Coinbase is only valid in a block, not as a loose transaction
1837  if (tx.IsCoinBase())
1838  return state.DoS(100, error("AcceptableInputs: : coinbase as individual tx"),
1839  REJECT_INVALID, "coinbase");
1840 
1841  // Rather not work on nonstandard transactions (unless -testnet/-regtest)
1842  string reason;
1843  // for any real tx this will be checked on AcceptToMemoryPool anyway
1844  // if (Params().RequireStandard() && !IsStandardTx(tx, reason))
1845  // return state.DoS(0,
1846  // error("AcceptableInputs : nonstandard transaction: %s", reason),
1847  // REJECT_NONSTANDARD, reason);
1848 
1849  // is it already in the memory pool?
1850  uint256 hash = tx.GetHash();
1851  if (pool.exists(hash))
1852  return false;
1853 
1854  // ----------- swiftTX transaction scanning -----------
1855 
1856  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTxIn& in, tx.vin) {
1857  if (mapLockedInputs.count(in.prevout)) {
1858  if (mapLockedInputs[in.prevout] != tx.GetHash()) {
1859  return state.DoS(0,
1860  error("AcceptableInputs : conflicts with existing transaction lock: %s", reason),
1861  REJECT_INVALID, "tx-lock-conflict");
1862  }
1863  }
1864  }
1865 
1866  // Check for conflicts with in-memory transactions
1867  if (!tx.IsZerocoinSpend()) {
1868  LOCK(pool.cs); // protect pool.mapNextTx
1869  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vin.size(); i++) {
1870  COutPoint outpoint = tx.vin[i].prevout;
1871  if (pool.mapNextTx.count(outpoint)) {
1872  // Disable replacement feature for now
1873  return false;
1874  }
1875  }
1876  }
1877 
1878 
1879  {
1880  CCoinsView dummy;
1881  CCoinsViewCache view(&dummy);
1882 
1883  CAmount nValueIn = 0;
1884  {
1885  LOCK(pool.cs);
1886  CCoinsViewMemPool viewMemPool(pcoinsTip, pool);
1887  view.SetBackend(viewMemPool);
1888 
1889  // do we already have it?
1890  if (view.HaveCoins(hash))
1891  return false;
1892 
1893  // do all inputs exist?
1894  // Note that this does not check for the presence of actual outputs (see the next check for that),
1895  // only helps filling in pfMissingInputs (to determine missing vs spent).
1896  for (const CTxIn txin : tx.vin) {
1897  if (!view.HaveCoins(txin.prevout.hash)) {
1898  if (pfMissingInputs)
1899  *pfMissingInputs = true;
1900  return false;
1901  }
1902 
1903  // check for invalid/fraudulent inputs
1904  if (!ValidOutPoint(txin.prevout, chainActive.Height())) {
1905  return state.Invalid(error("%s : tried to spend invalid input %s in tx %s", __func__, txin.prevout.ToString(),
1906  tx.GetHash().GetHex()), REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-invalid-inputs");
1907  }
1908  }
1909 
1910  // are the actual inputs available?
1911  if (!view.HaveInputs(tx))
1912  return state.Invalid(error("AcceptableInputs : inputs already spent"),
1913  REJECT_DUPLICATE, "bad-txns-inputs-spent");
1914 
1915  // Bring the best block into scope
1916  view.GetBestBlock();
1917 
1918  nValueIn = view.GetValueIn(tx);
1919 
1920  // we have all inputs cached now, so switch back to dummy, so we don't need to keep lock on mempool
1921  view.SetBackend(dummy);
1922  }
1923 
1924  // Check for non-standard pay-to-script-hash in inputs
1925  // for any real tx this will be checked on AcceptToMemoryPool anyway
1926  // if (Params().RequireStandard() && !AreInputsStandard(tx, view))
1927  // return error("AcceptableInputs: : nonstandard transaction input");
1928 
1929  // Check that the transaction doesn't have an excessive number of
1930  // sigops, making it impossible to mine. Since the coinbase transaction
1931  // itself can contain sigops MAX_TX_SIGOPS is less than
1932  // MAX_BLOCK_SIGOPS; we still consider this an invalid rather than
1933  // merely non-standard transaction.
1934  unsigned int nSigOps = GetLegacySigOpCount(tx);
1935  unsigned int nMaxSigOps = MAX_TX_SIGOPS_CURRENT;
1936  nSigOps += GetP2SHSigOpCount(tx, view);
1937  if (nSigOps > nMaxSigOps)
1938  return state.DoS(0,
1939  error("AcceptableInputs : too many sigops %s, %d > %d",
1940  hash.ToString(), nSigOps, nMaxSigOps),
1941  REJECT_NONSTANDARD, "bad-txns-too-many-sigops");
1942 
1943  CAmount nValueOut = tx.GetValueOut();
1944  CAmount nFees = nValueIn - nValueOut;
1945  double dPriority = view.GetPriority(tx, chainActive.Height());
1946 
1947  CTxMemPoolEntry entry(tx, nFees, GetTime(), dPriority, chainActive.Height());
1948  unsigned int nSize = entry.GetTxSize();
1949 
1950  // Don't accept it if it can't get into a block
1951  // but prioritise dstx and don't check fees for it
1952  if (isDSTX) {
1953  mempool.PrioritiseTransaction(hash, hash.ToString(), 1000, 0.1 * COIN);
1954  } else { // same as !ignoreFees for AcceptToMemoryPool
1955  CAmount txMinFee = GetMinRelayFee(tx, nSize, true);
1956  if (fLimitFree && nFees < txMinFee && !tx.IsZerocoinSpend())
1957  return state.DoS(0, error("AcceptableInputs : not enough fees %s, %d < %d",
1958  hash.ToString(), nFees, txMinFee),
1959  REJECT_INSUFFICIENTFEE, "insufficient fee");
1960 
1961  // Require that free transactions have sufficient priority to be mined in the next block.
1962  if (GetBoolArg("-relaypriority", true) && nFees < ::minRelayTxFee.GetFee(nSize) && !AllowFree(view.GetPriority(tx, chainActive.Height() + 1))) {
1963  return state.DoS(0, false, REJECT_INSUFFICIENTFEE, "insufficient priority");
1964  }
1965 
1966  // Continuously rate-limit free (really, very-low-fee) transactions
1967  // This mitigates 'penny-flooding' -- sending thousands of free transactions just to
1968  // be annoying or make others' transactions take longer to confirm.
1969  if (fLimitFree && nFees < ::minRelayTxFee.GetFee(nSize) && !tx.IsZerocoinSpend()) {
1970  static CCriticalSection csFreeLimiter;
1971  static double dFreeCount;
1972  static int64_t nLastTime;
1973  int64_t nNow = GetTime();
1974 
1975  LOCK(csFreeLimiter);
1976 
1977  // Use an exponentially decaying ~10-minute window:
1978  dFreeCount *= pow(1.0 - 1.0 / 600.0, (double)(nNow - nLastTime));
1979  nLastTime = nNow;
1980  // -limitfreerelay unit is thousand-bytes-per-minute
1981  // At default rate it would take over a month to fill 1GB
1982  if (dFreeCount >= GetArg("-limitfreerelay", 30) * 10 * 1000)
1983  return state.DoS(0, error("AcceptableInputs : free transaction rejected by rate limiter"),
1984  REJECT_INSUFFICIENTFEE, "rate limited free transaction");
1985  LogPrint("mempool", "Rate limit dFreeCount: %g => %g\n", dFreeCount, dFreeCount + nSize);
1986  dFreeCount += nSize;
1987  }
1988  }
1989 
1990  if (fRejectInsaneFee && nFees > ::minRelayTxFee.GetFee(nSize) * 10000)
1991  return error("AcceptableInputs: : insane fees %s, %d > %d",
1992  hash.ToString(),
1993  nFees, ::minRelayTxFee.GetFee(nSize) * 10000);
1994 
1995  // Check against previous transactions
1996  // This is done last to help prevent CPU exhaustion denial-of-service attacks.
1997  if (!CheckInputs(tx, state, view, false, STANDARD_SCRIPT_VERIFY_FLAGS, true)) {
1998  return error("AcceptableInputs: : ConnectInputs failed %s", hash.ToString());
1999  }
2000 
2001  // Check again against just the consensus-critical mandatory script
2002  // verification flags, in case of bugs in the standard flags that cause
2003  // transactions to pass as valid when they're actually invalid. For
2004  // instance the STRICTENC flag was incorrectly allowing certain
2005  // CHECKSIG NOT scripts to pass, even though they were invalid.
2006  //
2007  // There is a similar check in CreateNewBlock() to prevent creating
2008  // invalid blocks, however allowing such transactions into the mempool
2009  // can be exploited as a DoS attack.
2010  // for any real tx this will be checked on AcceptToMemoryPool anyway
2011  // if (!CheckInputs(tx, state, view, false, MANDATORY_SCRIPT_VERIFY_FLAGS, true))
2012  // {
2013  // return error("AcceptableInputs: : BUG! PLEASE REPORT THIS! ConnectInputs failed against MANDATORY but not STANDARD flags %s", hash.ToString());
2014  // }
2015 
2016  // Store transaction in memory
2017  // pool.addUnchecked(hash, entry);
2018  }
2019 
2020  // SyncWithWallets(tx, NULL);
2021 
2022  return true;
2023 }
2024 
2026 bool GetTransaction(const uint256& hash, CTransaction& txOut, uint256& hashBlock, bool fAllowSlow)
2027 {
2028  CBlockIndex* pindexSlow = NULL;
2029  {
2030  LOCK(cs_main);
2031  {
2032  if (mempool.lookup(hash, txOut)) {
2033  return true;
2034  }
2035  }
2036 
2037  if (fTxIndex) {
2038  CDiskTxPos postx;
2039  if (pblocktree->ReadTxIndex(hash, postx)) {
2040  CAutoFile file(OpenBlockFile(postx, true), SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
2041  if (file.IsNull())
2042  return error("%s: OpenBlockFile failed", __func__);
2043  CBlockHeader header;
2044  try {
2045  file >> header;
2046  fseek(file.Get(), postx.nTxOffset, SEEK_CUR);
2047  file >> txOut;
2048  } catch (std::exception& e) {
2049  return error("%s : Deserialize or I/O error - %s", __func__, e.what());
2050  }
2051  hashBlock = header.GetHash();
2052  if (txOut.GetHash() != hash)
2053  return error("%s : txid mismatch", __func__);
2054  return true;
2055  }
2056 
2057  // transaction not found in the index, nothing more can be done
2058  return false;
2059  }
2060 
2061  if (fAllowSlow) { // use coin database to locate block that contains transaction, and scan it
2062  int nHeight = -1;
2063  {
2064  CCoinsViewCache& view = *pcoinsTip;
2065  const CCoins* coins = view.AccessCoins(hash);
2066  if (coins)
2067  nHeight = coins->nHeight;
2068  }
2069  if (nHeight > 0)
2070  pindexSlow = chainActive[nHeight];
2071  }
2072  }
2073 
2074  if (pindexSlow) {
2075  CBlock block;
2076  if (ReadBlockFromDisk(block, pindexSlow)) {
2077  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTransaction& tx, block.vtx) {
2078  if (tx.GetHash() == hash) {
2079  txOut = tx;
2080  hashBlock = pindexSlow->GetBlockHash();
2081  return true;
2082  }
2083  }
2084  }
2085  }
2086 
2087  return false;
2088 }
2089 
2090 
2092 //
2093 // CBlock and CBlockIndex
2094 //
2095 
2096 bool WriteBlockToDisk(CBlock& block, CDiskBlockPos& pos)
2097 {
2098  // Open history file to append
2099  CAutoFile fileout(OpenBlockFile(pos), SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
2100  if (fileout.IsNull())
2101  return error("WriteBlockToDisk : OpenBlockFile failed");
2102 
2103  // Write index header
2104  unsigned int nSize = fileout.GetSerializeSize(block);
2105  fileout << FLATDATA(Params().MessageStart()) << nSize;
2106 
2107  // Write block
2108  long fileOutPos = ftell(fileout.Get());
2109  if (fileOutPos < 0)
2110  return error("WriteBlockToDisk : ftell failed");
2111  pos.nPos = (unsigned int)fileOutPos;
2112  fileout << block;
2113 
2114  return true;
2115 }
2116 
2117 bool ReadBlockFromDisk(CBlock& block, const CDiskBlockPos& pos)
2118 {
2119  block.SetNull();
2120 
2121  // Open history file to read
2122  CAutoFile filein(OpenBlockFile(pos, true), SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
2123  if (filein.IsNull())
2124  return error("ReadBlockFromDisk : OpenBlockFile failed");
2125 
2126  // Read block
2127  try {
2128  filein >> block;
2129  } catch (std::exception& e) {
2130  return error("%s : Deserialize or I/O error - %s", __func__, e.what());
2131  }
2132 
2133  // Check the header
2134  if (block.IsProofOfWork()) {
2135  if (!CheckProofOfWork(block.GetHash(), block.nBits))
2136  return error("ReadBlockFromDisk : Errors in block header");
2137  }
2138 
2139  return true;
2140 }
2141 
2142 bool ReadBlockFromDisk(CBlock& block, const CBlockIndex* pindex)
2143 {
2144  if (!ReadBlockFromDisk(block, pindex->GetBlockPos()))
2145  return false;
2146  if (block.GetHash() != pindex->GetBlockHash()) {
2147  LogPrintf("%s : block=%s index=%s\n", __func__, block.GetHash().ToString().c_str(), pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString().c_str());
2148  return error("ReadBlockFromDisk(CBlock&, CBlockIndex*) : GetHash() doesn't match index");
2149  }
2150  return true;
2151 }
2152 
2153 
2154 double ConvertBitsToDouble(unsigned int nBits)
2155 {
2156  int nShift = (nBits >> 24) & 0xff;
2157 
2158  double dDiff =
2159  (double)0x0000ffff / (double)(nBits & 0x00ffffff);
2160 
2161  while (nShift < 29) {
2162  dDiff *= 256.0;
2163  nShift++;
2164  }
2165  while (nShift > 29) {
2166  dDiff /= 256.0;
2167  nShift--;
2168  }
2169 
2170  return dDiff;
2171 }
2172 
2173 int64_t GetBlockValue(int nHeight)
2174 {
2175  int64_t nSubsidy = 0;
2176 
2177  if (Params().NetworkID() == CBaseChainParams::TESTNET) {
2178  if (nHeight < 200 && nHeight > 0)
2179  return 250000 * COIN;
2180  }
2181 
2182  if (nHeight == 0) {
2183  nSubsidy = 8000250 * COIN;
2184  } else {
2185  nSubsidy = 50 * COIN;
2186  }
2187 
2188  return nSubsidy;
2189 }
2190 
2191 int64_t GetMasternodePayment(int nHeight, int64_t blockValue, int nMasternodeCount)
2192 {
2193  int64_t ret = 0;
2194 
2195  if (Params().NetworkID() == CBaseChainParams::TESTNET) {
2196  if (nHeight < 200)
2197  return 0;
2198  }
2199 
2200  if (nHeight <= 43200) {
2201  ret = blockValue / 5;
2202  } else if (nHeight < 86400 && nHeight > 43200) {
2203  ret = blockValue / (100 / 30);
2204  } else if (nHeight < (Params().NetworkID() == CBaseChainParams::TESTNET ? 145000 : 151200) && nHeight >= 86400) {
2205  ret = 50 * COIN;
2206  } else if (nHeight <= Params().LAST_POW_BLOCK() && nHeight >= 151200) {
2207  ret = blockValue / 2;
2208  } else if (nHeight > Params().LAST_POW_BLOCK()) {
2209  int64_t nMoneySupply = chainActive.Tip()->nMoneySupply;
2210 
2211  //if a mn count is inserted into the function we are looking for a specific result for a masternode count
2212  if (nMasternodeCount < 1){
2213  if (IsSporkActive(SPORK_8_MASTERNODE_PAYMENT_ENFORCEMENT))
2214  nMasternodeCount = mnodeman.stable_size();
2215  else
2216  nMasternodeCount = mnodeman.size();
2217  }
2218 
2219  int64_t mNodeCoins = nMasternodeCount * 10000 * COIN;
2220 
2221  // Use this log to compare the masternode count for different clients
2222  LogPrintf("Adjusting seesaw at height %d with %d masternodes (without drift: %d) at %ld\n", nHeight, nMasternodeCount, nMasternodeCount - Params().MasternodeCountDrift(), GetTime());
2223 
2224  if (fDebug)
2225  LogPrintf("GetMasternodePayment(): moneysupply=%s, nodecoins=%s \n", FormatMoney(nMoneySupply).c_str(),
2226  FormatMoney(mNodeCoins).c_str());
2227 
2228  if (mNodeCoins == 0) {
2229  ret = 0;
2230  } else if (nHeight < 325000) {
2231  if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .05) && mNodeCoins > 0) {
2232  ret = blockValue * .85;
2233  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .1) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .05)) {
2234  ret = blockValue * .8;
2235  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .15) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .1)) {
2236  ret = blockValue * .75;
2237  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .2) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .15)) {
2238  ret = blockValue * .7;
2239  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .25) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .2)) {
2240  ret = blockValue * .65;
2241  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .3) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .25)) {
2242  ret = blockValue * .6;
2243  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .35) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .3)) {
2244  ret = blockValue * .55;
2245  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .4) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .35)) {
2246  ret = blockValue * .5;
2247  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .45) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .4)) {
2248  ret = blockValue * .45;
2249  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .5) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .45)) {
2250  ret = blockValue * .4;
2251  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .55) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .5)) {
2252  ret = blockValue * .35;
2253  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .6) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .55)) {
2254  ret = blockValue * .3;
2255  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .65) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .6)) {
2256  ret = blockValue * .25;
2257  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .7) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .65)) {
2258  ret = blockValue * .2;
2259  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .75) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .7)) {
2260  ret = blockValue * .15;
2261  } else {
2262  ret = blockValue * .1;
2263  }
2264  } else if (nHeight > 325000) {
2265  if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .01) && mNodeCoins > 0) {
2266  ret = blockValue * .90;
2267  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .02) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .01)) {
2268  ret = blockValue * .88;
2269  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .03) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .02)) {
2270  ret = blockValue * .87;
2271  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .04) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .03)) {
2272  ret = blockValue * .86;
2273  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .05) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .04)) {
2274  ret = blockValue * .85;
2275  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .06) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .05)) {
2276  ret = blockValue * .84;
2277  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .07) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .06)) {
2278  ret = blockValue * .83;
2279  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .08) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .07)) {
2280  ret = blockValue * .82;
