2281  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .09) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .08)) {
2282  ret = blockValue * .81;
2283  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .10) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .09)) {
2284  ret = blockValue * .80;
2285  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .11) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .10)) {
2286  ret = blockValue * .79;
2287  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .12) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .11)) {
2288  ret = blockValue * .78;
2289  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .13) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .12)) {
2290  ret = blockValue * .77;
2291  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .14) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .13)) {
2292  ret = blockValue * .76;
2293  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .15) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .14)) {
2294  ret = blockValue * .75;
2295  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .16) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .15)) {
2296  ret = blockValue * .74;
2297  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .17) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .16)) {
2298  ret = blockValue * .73;
2299  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .18) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .17)) {
2300  ret = blockValue * .72;
2301  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .19) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .18)) {
2302  ret = blockValue * .71;
2303  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .20) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .19)) {
2304  ret = blockValue * .70;
2305  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .21) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .20)) {
2306  ret = blockValue * .69;
2307  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .22) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .21)) {
2308  ret = blockValue * .68;
2309  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .23) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .22)) {
2310  ret = blockValue * .67;
2311  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .24) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .23)) {
2312  ret = blockValue * .66;
2313  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .25) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .24)) {
2314  ret = blockValue * .65;
2315  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .26) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .25)) {
2316  ret = blockValue * .64;
2317  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .27) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .26)) {
2318  ret = blockValue * .63;
2319  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .28) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .27)) {
2320  ret = blockValue * .62;
2321  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .29) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .28)) {
2322  ret = blockValue * .61;
2323  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .30) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .29)) {
2324  ret = blockValue * .60;
2325  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .31) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .30)) {
2326  ret = blockValue * .59;
2327  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .32) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .31)) {
2328  ret = blockValue * .58;
2329  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .33) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .32)) {
2330  ret = blockValue * .57;
2331  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .34) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .33)) {
2332  ret = blockValue * .56;
2333  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .35) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .34)) {
2334  ret = blockValue * .55;
2335  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .363) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .35)) {
2336  ret = blockValue * .54;
2337  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .376) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .363)) {
2338  ret = blockValue * .53;
2339  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .389) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .376)) {
2340  ret = blockValue * .52;
2341  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .402) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .389)) {
2342  ret = blockValue * .51;
2343  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .415) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .402)) {
2344  ret = blockValue * .50;
2345  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .428) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .415)) {
2346  ret = blockValue * .49;
2347  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .441) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .428)) {
2348  ret = blockValue * .48;
2349  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .454) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .441)) {
2350  ret = blockValue * .47;
2351  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .467) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .454)) {
2352  ret = blockValue * .46;
2353  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .48) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .467)) {
2354  ret = blockValue * .45;
2355  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .493) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .48)) {
2356  ret = blockValue * .44;
2357  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .506) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .493)) {
2358  ret = blockValue * .43;
2359  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .519) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .506)) {
2360  ret = blockValue * .42;
2361  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .532) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .519)) {
2362  ret = blockValue * .41;
2363  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .545) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .532)) {
2364  ret = blockValue * .40;
2365  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .558) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .545)) {
2366  ret = blockValue * .39;
2367  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .571) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .558)) {
2368  ret = blockValue * .38;
2369  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .584) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .571)) {
2370  ret = blockValue * .37;
2371  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .597) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .584)) {
2372  ret = blockValue * .36;
2373  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .61) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .597)) {
2374  ret = blockValue * .35;
2375  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .623) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .61)) {
2376  ret = blockValue * .34;
2377  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .636) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .623)) {
2378  ret = blockValue * .33;
2379  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .649) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .636)) {
2380  ret = blockValue * .32;
2381  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .662) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .649)) {
2382  ret = blockValue * .31;
2383  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .675) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .662)) {
2384  ret = blockValue * .30;
2385  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .688) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .675)) {
2386  ret = blockValue * .29;
2387  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .701) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .688)) {
2388  ret = blockValue * .28;
2389  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .714) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .701)) {
2390  ret = blockValue * .27;
2391  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .727) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .714)) {
2392  ret = blockValue * .26;
2393  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .74) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .727)) {
2394  ret = blockValue * .25;
2395  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .753) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .74)) {
2396  ret = blockValue * .24;
2397  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .766) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .753)) {
2398  ret = blockValue * .23;
2399  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .779) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .766)) {
2400  ret = blockValue * .22;
2401  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .792) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .779)) {
2402  ret = blockValue * .21;
2403  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .805) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .792)) {
2404  ret = blockValue * .20;
2405  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .818) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .805)) {
2406  ret = blockValue * .19;
2407  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .831) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .818)) {
2408  ret = blockValue * .18;
2409  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .844) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .831)) {
2410  ret = blockValue * .17;
2411  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .857) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .844)) {
2412  ret = blockValue * .16;
2413  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .87) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .857)) {
2414  ret = blockValue * .15;
2415  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .883) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .87)) {
2416  ret = blockValue * .14;
2417  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .896) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .883)) {
2418  ret = blockValue * .13;
2419  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .909) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .896)) {
2420  ret = blockValue * .12;
2421  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .922) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .909)) {
2422  ret = blockValue * .11;
2423  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .935) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .922)) {
2424  ret = blockValue * .10;
2425  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .945) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .935)) {
2426  ret = blockValue * .09;
2427  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .961) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .945)) {
2428  ret = blockValue * .08;
2429  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .974) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .961)) {
2430  ret = blockValue * .07;
2431  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .987) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .974)) {
2432  ret = blockValue * .06;
2433  } else if (mNodeCoins <= (nMoneySupply * .99) && mNodeCoins > (nMoneySupply * .987)) {
2434  ret = blockValue * .05;
2435  } else {
2436  ret = blockValue * .01;
2437  }
2438  }
2439  }
2440 
2441  return ret;
2442 }
2443 
2444 bool IsInitialBlockDownload()
2445 {
2446  LOCK(cs_main);
2447  if (fImporting || fReindex || fVerifyingBlocks || chainActive.Height() < Checkpoints::GetTotalBlocksEstimate())
2448  return true;
2449  static bool lockIBDState = false;
2450  if (lockIBDState)
2451  return false;
2452  bool state = (chainActive.Height() < pindexBestHeader->nHeight - 24 * 6 ||
2453  pindexBestHeader->GetBlockTime() < GetTime() - 6 * 60 * 60); // ~144 blocks behind -> 2 x fork detection time
2454  if (!state)
2455  lockIBDState = true;
2456  return state;
2457 }
2458 
2459 bool fLargeWorkForkFound = false;
2460 bool fLargeWorkInvalidChainFound = false;
2461 CBlockIndex *pindexBestForkTip = NULL, *pindexBestForkBase = NULL;
2462 
2463 void CheckForkWarningConditions()
2464 {
2465  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
2466  // Before we get past initial download, we cannot reliably alert about forks
2467  // (we assume we don't get stuck on a fork before the last checkpoint)
2468  if (IsInitialBlockDownload())
2469  return;
2470 
2471  // If our best fork is no longer within 72 blocks (+/- 3 hours if no one mines it)
2472  // of our head, drop it
2473  if (pindexBestForkTip && chainActive.Height() - pindexBestForkTip->nHeight >= 72)
2474  pindexBestForkTip = NULL;
2475 
2476  if (pindexBestForkTip || (pindexBestInvalid && pindexBestInvalid->nChainWork > chainActive.Tip()->nChainWork + (GetBlockProof(*chainActive.Tip()) * 6))) {
2477  if (!fLargeWorkForkFound && pindexBestForkBase) {
2478  if (pindexBestForkBase->phashBlock) {
2479  std::string warning = std::string("'Warning: Large-work fork detected, forking after block ") +
2480  pindexBestForkBase->phashBlock->ToString() + std::string("'");
2481  CAlert::Notify(warning, true);
2482  }
2483  }
2484  if (pindexBestForkTip && pindexBestForkBase) {
2485  if (pindexBestForkBase->phashBlock) {
2486  LogPrintf("CheckForkWarningConditions: Warning: Large valid fork found\n forking the chain at height %d (%s)\n lasting to height %d (%s).\nChain state database corruption likely.\n",
2487  pindexBestForkBase->nHeight, pindexBestForkBase->phashBlock->ToString(),
2488  pindexBestForkTip->nHeight, pindexBestForkTip->phashBlock->ToString());
2489  fLargeWorkForkFound = true;
2490  }
2491  } else {
2492  LogPrintf("CheckForkWarningConditions: Warning: Found invalid chain at least ~6 blocks longer than our best chain.\nChain state database corruption likely.\n");
2493  fLargeWorkInvalidChainFound = true;
2494  }
2495  } else {
2496  fLargeWorkForkFound = false;
2497  fLargeWorkInvalidChainFound = false;
2498  }
2499 }
2500 
2501 void CheckForkWarningConditionsOnNewFork(CBlockIndex* pindexNewForkTip)
2502 {
2503  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
2504  // If we are on a fork that is sufficiently large, set a warning flag
2505  CBlockIndex* pfork = pindexNewForkTip;
2506  CBlockIndex* plonger = chainActive.Tip();
2507  while (pfork && pfork != plonger) {
2508  while (plonger && plonger->nHeight > pfork->nHeight)
2509  plonger = plonger->pprev;
2510  if (pfork == plonger)
2511  break;
2512  pfork = pfork->pprev;
2513  }
2514 
2515  // We define a condition which we should warn the user about as a fork of at least 7 blocks
2516  // who's tip is within 72 blocks (+/- 3 hours if no one mines it) of ours
2517  // or a chain that is entirely longer than ours and invalid (note that this should be detected by both)
2518  // We use 7 blocks rather arbitrarily as it represents just under 10% of sustained network
2519  // hash rate operating on the fork.
2520  // We define it this way because it allows us to only store the highest fork tip (+ base) which meets
2521  // the 7-block condition and from this always have the most-likely-to-cause-warning fork
2522  if (pfork && (!pindexBestForkTip || (pindexBestForkTip && pindexNewForkTip->nHeight > pindexBestForkTip->nHeight)) &&
2523  pindexNewForkTip->nChainWork - pfork->nChainWork > (GetBlockProof(*pfork) * 7) &&
2524  chainActive.Height() - pindexNewForkTip->nHeight < 72) {
2525  pindexBestForkTip = pindexNewForkTip;
2526  pindexBestForkBase = pfork;
2527  }
2528 
2529  CheckForkWarningConditions();
2530 }
2531 
2532 // Requires cs_main.
2533 void Misbehaving(NodeId pnode, int howmuch)
2534 {
2535  if (howmuch == 0)
2536  return;
2537 
2538  CNodeState* state = State(pnode);
2539  if (state == NULL)
2540  return;
2541 
2542  state->nMisbehavior += howmuch;
2543  int banscore = GetArg("-banscore", 100);
2544  if (state->nMisbehavior >= banscore && state->nMisbehavior - howmuch < banscore) {
2545  LogPrintf("Misbehaving: %s (%d -> %d) BAN THRESHOLD EXCEEDED\n", state->name, state->nMisbehavior - howmuch, state->nMisbehavior);
2546  state->fShouldBan = true;
2547  } else
2548  LogPrintf("Misbehaving: %s (%d -> %d)\n", state->name, state->nMisbehavior - howmuch, state->nMisbehavior);
2549 }
2550 
2551 void static InvalidChainFound(CBlockIndex* pindexNew)
2552 {
2553  if (!pindexBestInvalid || pindexNew->nChainWork > pindexBestInvalid->nChainWork)
2554  pindexBestInvalid = pindexNew;
2555 
2556  LogPrintf("InvalidChainFound: invalid block=%s height=%d log2_work=%.8g date=%s\n",
2557  pindexNew->GetBlockHash().ToString(), pindexNew->nHeight,
2558  log(pindexNew->nChainWork.getdouble()) / log(2.0), DateTimeStrFormat("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S",
2559  pindexNew->GetBlockTime()));
2560  LogPrintf("InvalidChainFound: current best=%s height=%d log2_work=%.8g date=%s\n",
2561  chainActive.Tip()->GetBlockHash().ToString(), chainActive.Height(), log(chainActive.Tip()->nChainWork.getdouble()) / log(2.0),
2562  DateTimeStrFormat("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S", chainActive.Tip()->GetBlockTime()));
2563  CheckForkWarningConditions();
2564 }
2565 
2566 void static InvalidBlockFound(CBlockIndex* pindex, const CValidationState& state)
2567 {
2568  int nDoS = 0;
2569  if (state.IsInvalid(nDoS)) {
2570  std::map<uint256, NodeId>::iterator it = mapBlockSource.find(pindex->GetBlockHash());
2571  if (it != mapBlockSource.end() && State(it->second)) {
2572  CBlockReject reject = {state.GetRejectCode(), state.GetRejectReason().substr(0, MAX_REJECT_MESSAGE_LENGTH), pindex->GetBlockHash()};
2573  State(it->second)->rejects.push_back(reject);
2574  if (nDoS > 0)
2575  Misbehaving(it->second, nDoS);
2576  }
2577  }
2578  if (!state.CorruptionPossible()) {
2579  pindex->nStatus |= BLOCK_FAILED_VALID;
2580  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindex);
2581  setBlockIndexCandidates.erase(pindex);
2582  InvalidChainFound(pindex);
2583  }
2584 }
2585 
2586 void UpdateCoins(const CTransaction& tx, CValidationState& state, CCoinsViewCache& inputs, CTxUndo& txundo, int nHeight)
2587 {
2588  // mark inputs spent
2589  if (!tx.IsCoinBase() && !tx.IsZerocoinSpend()) {
2590  txundo.vprevout.reserve(tx.vin.size());
2591  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTxIn& txin, tx.vin) {
2592  txundo.vprevout.push_back(CTxInUndo());
2593  bool ret = inputs.ModifyCoins(txin.prevout.hash)->Spend(txin.prevout, txundo.vprevout.back());
2594  assert(ret);
2595  }
2596  }
2597 
2598  // add outputs
2599  inputs.ModifyCoins(tx.GetHash())->FromTx(tx, nHeight);
2600 }
2601 
2602 bool CScriptCheck::operator()()
2603 {
2604  const CScript& scriptSig = ptxTo->vin[nIn].scriptSig;
2605  if (!VerifyScript(scriptSig, scriptPubKey, nFlags, CachingTransactionSignatureChecker(ptxTo, nIn, cacheStore), &error)) {
2606  return ::error("CScriptCheck(): %s:%d VerifySignature failed: %s", ptxTo->GetHash().ToString(), nIn, ScriptErrorString(error));
2607  }
2608  return true;
2609 }
2610 
2611 CBitcoinAddress addressExp1("DQZzqnSR6PXxagep1byLiRg9ZurCZ5KieQ");
2612 CBitcoinAddress addressExp2("DTQYdnNqKuEHXyNeeYhPQGGGdqHbXYwjpj");
2613 
2614 map<COutPoint, COutPoint> mapInvalidOutPoints;
2615 map<CBigNum, CAmount> mapInvalidSerials;
2616 void AddInvalidSpendsToMap(const CBlock& block)
2617 {
2618  for (const CTransaction tx : block.vtx) {
2619  if (!tx.ContainsZerocoins())
2620  continue;
2621 
2622  //Check all zerocoinspends for bad serials
2623  for (const CTxIn in : tx.vin) {
2624  if (in.scriptSig.IsZerocoinSpend()) {
2625  CoinSpend spend = TxInToZerocoinSpend(in);
2626 
2627  //If serial is not valid, mark all outputs as bad
2628  if (!spend.HasValidSerial(Params().Zerocoin_Params())) {
2629  mapInvalidSerials[spend.getCoinSerialNumber()] = spend.getDenomination() * COIN;
2630 
2631  // Derive the actual valid serial from the invalid serial if possible
2632  CBigNum bnActualSerial = spend.CalculateValidSerial(Params().Zerocoin_Params());
2633  uint256 txHash;
2634 
2635  if (zerocoinDB->ReadCoinSpend(bnActualSerial, txHash)) {
2636  mapInvalidSerials[bnActualSerial] = spend.getDenomination() * COIN;
2637 
2638  CTransaction txPrev;
2639  uint256 hashBlock;
2640  if (!GetTransaction(txHash, txPrev, hashBlock, true))
2641  continue;
2642 
2643  //Record all txouts from txPrev as invalid
2644  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < txPrev.vout.size(); i++) {
2645  //map to an empty outpoint to represent that this is the first in the chain of bad outs
2646  mapInvalidOutPoints[COutPoint(txPrev.GetHash(), i)] = COutPoint();
2647  }
2648  }
2649 
2650  //Record all txouts from this invalid zerocoin spend tx as invalid
2651  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vout.size(); i++) {
2652  //map to an empty outpoint to represent that this is the first in the chain of bad outs
2653  mapInvalidOutPoints[COutPoint(tx.GetHash(), i)] = COutPoint();
2654  }
2655  }
2656  }
2657  }
2658  }
2659 }
2660 
2661 // Populate global map (mapInvalidOutPoints) of invalid/fraudulent OutPoints that are banned from being used on the chain.
2662 CAmount nFilteredThroughBittrex = 0;
2663 bool fListPopulatedAfterLock = false;
2664 void PopulateInvalidOutPointMap()
2665 {
2666  if (fListPopulatedAfterLock)
2667  return;
2668  nFilteredThroughBittrex = 0;
2669 
2670  //Calculate over the entire period between the first bad tx and the tip of the chain - or the point at which this becomes enforced
2671  int nHeightLast = min(Params().Zerocoin_Block_RecalculateAccumulators() + 1, chainActive.Height());
2672 
2673  map<COutPoint, int> mapValidMixed;
2674  for (int i = Params().Zerocoin_Block_FirstFraudulent(); i < nHeightLast; i++) {
2675  CBlockIndex* pindex = chainActive[i];
2676  CBlock block;
2677  if (!ReadBlockFromDisk(block, pindex))
2678  continue;
2679 
2680  //Find all the invalid spends for this block and record them
2681  AddInvalidSpendsToMap(block);
2682 
2683  //Any tx's that use a bad TxOut as an input is marked as invalid
2684  for (CTransaction tx : block.vtx) {
2685  for (CTxIn txIn : tx.vin) {
2686  if (mapInvalidOutPoints.count(txIn.prevout)) {
2687 
2688  //If this is a stake transaction, masternode payments should not be considered fraudulent
2689  std::list<COutPoint> listOutPoints;
2690  if (tx.IsCoinStake()) {
2691  CTxDestination dest;
2692  if (!ExtractDestination(tx.vout[1].scriptPubKey, dest))
2693  continue;
2694 
2695  CBitcoinAddress addressKernel(dest);
2696  for (unsigned int j = 1 ; j < tx.vout.size(); j++) { //1 because first is blank for coinstake
2697 
2698  //If a payment goes to a different address, then count it as a masternode payment
2699  CTxDestination destOut;
2700  if (!ExtractDestination(tx.vout[j].scriptPubKey, destOut)) {
2701  listOutPoints.emplace_back(COutPoint(tx.GetHash(), j));
2702  continue;
2703  }
2704  CBitcoinAddress addressOut(destOut);
2705  if (addressOut == addressKernel) {
2706 
2707  //Anything past these two addresses is only guilty by association/washed funds
2708  if (addressOut == addressExp1 || addressOut == addressExp2) {
2709  nFilteredThroughBittrex += tx.vout[j].nValue;
2710  continue;
2711  }
2712 
2713  //Mark this outpoint as invalid
2714  listOutPoints.emplace_back(COutPoint(tx.GetHash(), j));
2715  }
2716  }
2717  } else {
2718  // Mark all outpoints invalid because they descend from exploited spends
2719  for (COutPoint p : tx.GetOutPoints()) {
2720  if (tx.vout[p.n].scriptPubKey.IsZerocoinMint()) {
2721  listOutPoints.emplace_back(p);
2722  } else {
2723  //Anything past these two addresses is only guilty by association/washed funds
2724  CTxDestination dest;
2725  if (!ExtractDestination(tx.vout[p.n].scriptPubKey, dest)) {
2726  listOutPoints.emplace_back(p);
2727  continue;
2728  }
2729 
2730  CBitcoinAddress address(dest);
2731  if (address == addressExp1 || address == addressExp2) {
2732  nFilteredThroughBittrex += tx.vout[p.n].nValue;
2733  continue;
2734  }
2735  //record this outpoint as invalid
2736  listOutPoints.emplace_back(p);
2737  }
2738  }
2739  }
2740 
2741  //Record each fraudulent outpoint and its cause.
2742  for (COutPoint o : listOutPoints)
2743  mapInvalidOutPoints[o] = txIn.prevout;
2744 
2745  //The entire tx set of outpoints are added, break here
2746  break;
2747  }
2748  }
2749  }
2750 
2751  if (pindex->nHeight > Params().Zerocoin_Block_RecalculateAccumulators())
2752  fListPopulatedAfterLock = true;
2753  }
2754 }
2755 
2756 bool ValidOutPoint(const COutPoint out, int nHeight)
2757 {
2758  bool isInvalid = nHeight >= Params().Block_Enforce_Invalid() && mapInvalidOutPoints.count(out);
2759  return !isInvalid;
2760 }
2761 
2762 CAmount GetInvalidUTXOValue()
2763 {
2764  CAmount nValue = 0;
2765  for (auto it : mapInvalidOutPoints) {
2766  const COutPoint out = it.first;
2767  bool fSpent = false;
2768  CCoinsViewCache cache(pcoinsTip);
2769  const CCoins *coins = cache.AccessCoins(out.hash);
2770  if(!coins || !coins->IsAvailable(out.n))
2771  fSpent = true;
2772 
2773  if (!fSpent)
2774  nValue += coins->vout[out.n].nValue;
2775  }
2776 
2777  return nValue;
2778 }
2779 
2780 bool CheckInputs(const CTransaction& tx, CValidationState& state, const CCoinsViewCache& inputs, bool fScriptChecks, unsigned int flags, bool cacheStore, std::vector<CScriptCheck>* pvChecks)
2781 {
2782  if (!tx.IsCoinBase() && !tx.IsZerocoinSpend()) {
2783  if (pvChecks)
2784  pvChecks->reserve(tx.vin.size());
2785 
2786  // This doesn't trigger the DoS code on purpose; if it did, it would make it easier
2787  // for an attacker to attempt to split the network.
2788  if (!inputs.HaveInputs(tx))
2789  return state.Invalid(error("CheckInputs() : %s inputs unavailable", tx.GetHash().ToString()));
2790 
2791  // While checking, GetBestBlock() refers to the parent block.
2792  // This is also true for mempool checks.
2793  CBlockIndex* pindexPrev = mapBlockIndex.find(inputs.GetBestBlock())->second;
2794  int nSpendHeight = pindexPrev->nHeight + 1;
2795  CAmount nValueIn = 0;
2796  CAmount nFees = 0;
2797  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vin.size(); i++) {
2798  const COutPoint& prevout = tx.vin[i].prevout;
2799  const CCoins* coins = inputs.AccessCoins(prevout.hash);
2800  assert(coins);
2801 
2802  // If prev is coinbase, check that it's matured
2803  if (coins->IsCoinBase() || coins->IsCoinStake()) {
2804  if (nSpendHeight - coins->nHeight < Params().COINBASE_MATURITY())
2805  return state.Invalid(
2806  error("CheckInputs() : tried to spend coinbase at depth %d, coinstake=%d", nSpendHeight - coins->nHeight, coins->IsCoinStake()),
2807  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-premature-spend-of-coinbase");
2808  }
2809 
2810  // Check for negative or overflow input values
2811  nValueIn += coins->vout[prevout.n].nValue;
2812  if (!MoneyRange(coins->vout[prevout.n].nValue) || !MoneyRange(nValueIn))
2813  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckInputs() : txin values out of range"),
2814  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-inputvalues-outofrange");
2815  }
2816 
2817  if (!tx.IsCoinStake()) {
2818  if (nValueIn < tx.GetValueOut())
2819  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckInputs() : %s value in (%s) < value out (%s)",
2820  tx.GetHash().ToString(), FormatMoney(nValueIn), FormatMoney(tx.GetValueOut())),
2821  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-in-belowout");
2822 
2823  // Tally transaction fees
2824  CAmount nTxFee = nValueIn - tx.GetValueOut();
2825  if (nTxFee < 0)
2826  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckInputs() : %s nTxFee < 0", tx.GetHash().ToString()),
2827  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-fee-negative");
2828  nFees += nTxFee;
2829  if (!MoneyRange(nFees))
2830  return state.DoS(100, error("CheckInputs() : nFees out of range"),
2831  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-fee-outofrange");
2832  }
2833  // The first loop above does all the inexpensive checks.
2834  // Only if ALL inputs pass do we perform expensive ECDSA signature checks.
2835  // Helps prevent CPU exhaustion attacks.
2836 
2837  // Skip ECDSA signature verification when connecting blocks
2838  // before the last block chain checkpoint. This is safe because block merkle hashes are
2839  // still computed and checked, and any change will be caught at the next checkpoint.
2840  if (fScriptChecks) {
2841  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vin.size(); i++) {
2842  const COutPoint& prevout = tx.vin[i].prevout;
2843  const CCoins* coins = inputs.AccessCoins(prevout.hash);
2844  assert(coins);
2845 
2846  // Verify signature
2847  CScriptCheck check(*coins, tx, i, flags, cacheStore);
2848  if (pvChecks) {
2849  pvChecks->push_back(CScriptCheck());
2850  check.swap(pvChecks->back());
2851  } else if (!check()) {
2852  if (flags & STANDARD_NOT_MANDATORY_VERIFY_FLAGS) {
2853  // Check whether the failure was caused by a
2854  // non-mandatory script verification check, such as
2855  // non-standard DER encodings or non-null dummy
2856  // arguments; if so, don't trigger DoS protection to
2857  // avoid splitting the network between upgraded and
2858  // non-upgraded nodes.
2859  CScriptCheck check(*coins, tx, i,
2860  flags & ~STANDARD_NOT_MANDATORY_VERIFY_FLAGS, cacheStore);
2861  if (check())
2862  return state.Invalid(false, REJECT_NONSTANDARD, strprintf("non-mandatory-script-verify-flag (%s)", ScriptErrorString(check.GetScriptError())));
2863  }
2864  // Failures of other flags indicate a transaction that is
2865  // invalid in new blocks, e.g. a invalid P2SH. We DoS ban
2866  // such nodes as they are not following the protocol. That
2867  // said during an upgrade careful thought should be taken
2868  // as to the correct behavior - we may want to continue
2869  // peering with non-upgraded nodes even after a soft-fork
2870  // super-majority vote has passed.
2871  return state.DoS(100, false, REJECT_INVALID, strprintf("mandatory-script-verify-flag-failed (%s)", ScriptErrorString(check.GetScriptError())));
2872  }
2873  }
2874  }
2875  }
2876 
2877  return true;
2878 }
2879 
2880 bool DisconnectBlock(CBlock& block, CValidationState& state, CBlockIndex* pindex, CCoinsViewCache& view, bool* pfClean)
2881 {
2882  if (pindex->GetBlockHash() != view.GetBestBlock())
2883  LogPrintf("%s : pindex=%s view=%s\n", __func__, pindex->GetBlockHash().GetHex(), view.GetBestBlock().GetHex());
2884  assert(pindex->GetBlockHash() == view.GetBestBlock());
2885 
2886  if (pfClean)
2887  *pfClean = false;
2888 
2889  bool fClean = true;
2890 
2891  CBlockUndo blockUndo;
2892  CDiskBlockPos pos = pindex->GetUndoPos();
2893  if (pos.IsNull())
2894  return error("DisconnectBlock() : no undo data available");
2895  if (!blockUndo.ReadFromDisk(pos, pindex->pprev->GetBlockHash()))
2896  return error("DisconnectBlock() : failure reading undo data");
2897 
2898  if (blockUndo.vtxundo.size() + 1 != block.vtx.size())
2899  return error("DisconnectBlock() : block and undo data inconsistent");
2900 
2901  // undo transactions in reverse order
2902  for (int i = block.vtx.size() - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
2903  const CTransaction& tx = block.vtx[i];
2904 
2909  if (tx.ContainsZerocoins()) {
2910  if (tx.IsZerocoinSpend()) {
2911  //erase all zerocoinspends in this transaction
2912  for (const CTxIn txin : tx.vin) {
2913  if (txin.scriptSig.IsZerocoinSpend()) {
2914  CoinSpend spend = TxInToZerocoinSpend(txin);
2915  if (!zerocoinDB->EraseCoinSpend(spend.getCoinSerialNumber()))
2916  return error("failed to erase spent zerocoin in block");
2917  }
2918  }
2919  }
2920  if (tx.IsZerocoinMint()) {
2921  //erase all zerocoinmints in this transaction
2922  for (const CTxOut txout : tx.vout) {
2923  if (txout.scriptPubKey.empty() || !txout.scriptPubKey.IsZerocoinMint())
2924  continue;
2925 
2926  PublicCoin pubCoin(Params().Zerocoin_Params());
2927  if (!TxOutToPublicCoin(txout, pubCoin, state))
2928  return error("DisconnectBlock(): TxOutToPublicCoin() failed");
2929 
2930  if(!zerocoinDB->EraseCoinMint(pubCoin.getValue()))
2931  return error("DisconnectBlock(): Failed to erase coin mint");
2932  }
2933  }
2934  }
2935 
2936  uint256 hash = tx.GetHash();
2937 
2938  // Check that all outputs are available and match the outputs in the block itself
2939  // exactly. Note that transactions with only provably unspendable outputs won't
2940  // have outputs available even in the block itself, so we handle that case
2941  // specially with outsEmpty.
2942  {
2943  CCoins outsEmpty;
2944  CCoinsModifier outs = view.ModifyCoins(hash);
2945  outs->ClearUnspendable();
2946 
2947  CCoins outsBlock(tx, pindex->nHeight);
2948  // The CCoins serialization does not serialize negative numbers.
2949  // No network rules currently depend on the version here, so an inconsistency is harmless
2950  // but it must be corrected before txout nversion ever influences a network rule.
2951  if (outsBlock.nVersion < 0)
2952  outs->nVersion = outsBlock.nVersion;
2953  if (*outs != outsBlock)
2954  fClean = fClean && error("DisconnectBlock() : added transaction mismatch? database corrupted");
2955 
2956  // remove outputs
2957  outs->Clear();
2958  }
2959 
2960  // restore inputs
2961  if (!tx.IsCoinBase() && !tx.IsZerocoinSpend()) { // not coinbases or zerocoinspend because they dont have traditional inputs
2962  const CTxUndo& txundo = blockUndo.vtxundo[i - 1];
2963  if (txundo.vprevout.size() != tx.vin.size())
2964  return error("DisconnectBlock() : transaction and undo data inconsistent - txundo.vprevout.siz=%d tx.vin.siz=%d", txundo.vprevout.size(), tx.vin.size());
2965  for (unsigned int j = tx.vin.size(); j-- > 0;) {
2966  const COutPoint& out = tx.vin[j].prevout;
2967  const CTxInUndo& undo = txundo.vprevout[j];
2968  CCoinsModifier coins = view.ModifyCoins(out.hash);
2969  if (undo.nHeight != 0) {
2970  // undo data contains height: this is the last output of the prevout tx being spent
2971  if (!coins->IsPruned())
2972  fClean = fClean && error("DisconnectBlock() : undo data overwriting existing transaction");
2973  coins->Clear();
2974  coins->fCoinBase = undo.fCoinBase;
2975  coins->nHeight = undo.nHeight;
2976  coins->nVersion = undo.nVersion;
2977  } else {
2978  if (coins->IsPruned())
2979  fClean = fClean && error("DisconnectBlock() : undo data adding output to missing transaction");
2980  }
2981  if (coins->IsAvailable(out.n))
2982  fClean = fClean && error("DisconnectBlock() : undo data overwriting existing output");
2983  if (coins->vout.size() < out.n + 1)
2984  coins->vout.resize(out.n + 1);
2985  coins->vout[out.n] = undo.txout;
2986  }
2987  }
2988  }
2989 
2990  // move best block pointer to prevout block
2991  view.SetBestBlock(pindex->pprev->GetBlockHash());
2992 
2993  if (!fVerifyingBlocks) {
2994  //if block is an accumulator checkpoint block, remove checkpoint and checksums from db
2995  uint256 nCheckpoint = pindex->nAccumulatorCheckpoint;
2996  if(nCheckpoint != pindex->pprev->nAccumulatorCheckpoint) {
2997  if(!EraseAccumulatorValues(nCheckpoint, pindex->pprev->nAccumulatorCheckpoint))
2998  return error("DisconnectBlock(): failed to erase checkpoint");
2999  }
3000  }
3001 
3002  if (pfClean) {
3003  *pfClean = fClean;
3004  return true;
3005  } else {
3006  return fClean;
3007  }
3008 }
3009 
3010 void static FlushBlockFile(bool fFinalize = false)
3011 {
3012  LOCK(cs_LastBlockFile);
3013 
3014  CDiskBlockPos posOld(nLastBlockFile, 0);
3015 
3016  FILE* fileOld = OpenBlockFile(posOld);
3017  if (fileOld) {
3018  if (fFinalize)
3019  TruncateFile(fileOld, vinfoBlockFile[nLastBlockFile].nSize);
3020  FileCommit(fileOld);
3021  fclose(fileOld);
3022  }
3023 
3024  fileOld = OpenUndoFile(posOld);
3025  if (fileOld) {
3026  if (fFinalize)
3027  TruncateFile(fileOld, vinfoBlockFile[nLastBlockFile].nUndoSize);
3028  FileCommit(fileOld);
3029  fclose(fileOld);
3030  }
3031 }
3032 
3033 bool FindUndoPos(CValidationState& state, int nFile, CDiskBlockPos& pos, unsigned int nAddSize);
3034 
3035 static CCheckQueue<CScriptCheck> scriptcheckqueue(128);
3036 
3037 void ThreadScriptCheck()
3038 {
3039  RenameThread("divi-scriptch");
3040  scriptcheckqueue.Thread();
3041 }
3042 
3043 void RecalculateZDIVMinted()
3044 {
3045  CBlockIndex *pindex = chainActive[Params().Zerocoin_StartHeight()];
3046  int nHeightEnd = chainActive.Height();
3047  while (true) {
3048  if (pindex->nHeight % 1000 == 0)
3049  LogPrintf("%s : block %d...\n", __func__, pindex->nHeight);
3050 
3051  //overwrite possibly wrong vMintsInBlock data
3052  CBlock block;
3053  assert(ReadBlockFromDisk(block, pindex));
3054 
3055  std::list<CZerocoinMint> listMints;
3056  BlockToZerocoinMintList(block, listMints, true);
3057 
3058  vector<libzerocoin::CoinDenomination> vDenomsBefore = pindex->vMintDenominationsInBlock;
3059  pindex->vMintDenominationsInBlock.clear();
3060  for (auto mint : listMints)
3061  pindex->vMintDenominationsInBlock.emplace_back(mint.GetDenomination());
3062 
3063  if (pindex->nHeight < nHeightEnd)
3064  pindex = chainActive.Next(pindex);
3065  else
3066  break;
3067  }
3068 }
3069 
3070 void RecalculateZDIVSpent()
3071 {
3072  CBlockIndex* pindex = chainActive[Params().Zerocoin_StartHeight()];
3073  while (true) {
3074  if (pindex->nHeight % 1000 == 0)
3075  LogPrintf("%s : block %d...\n", __func__, pindex->nHeight);
3076 
3077  //Rewrite zDIV supply
3078  CBlock block;
3079  assert(ReadBlockFromDisk(block, pindex));
3080 
3081  list<libzerocoin::CoinDenomination> listDenomsSpent = ZerocoinSpendListFromBlock(block, true);
3082 
3083  //Reset the supply to previous block
3084  pindex->mapZerocoinSupply = pindex->pprev->mapZerocoinSupply;
3085 
3086  //Add mints to zDIV supply
3087  for (auto denom : libzerocoin::zerocoinDenomList) {
3088  long nDenomAdded = count(pindex->vMintDenominationsInBlock.begin(), pindex->vMintDenominationsInBlock.end(), denom);
3089  pindex->mapZerocoinSupply.at(denom) += nDenomAdded;
3090  }
3091 
3092  //Remove spends from zDIV supply
3093  for (auto denom : listDenomsSpent)
3094  pindex->mapZerocoinSupply.at(denom)--;
3095 
3096  //Rewrite money supply
3097  assert(pblocktree->WriteBlockIndex(CDiskBlockIndex(pindex)));
3098 
3099  if (pindex->nHeight < chainActive.Height())
3100  pindex = chainActive.Next(pindex);
3101  else
3102  break;
3103  }
3104 }
3105 
3106 bool RecalculateDIVSupply(int nHeightStart)
3107 {
3108  if (nHeightStart > chainActive.Height())
3109  return false;
3110 
3111  CBlockIndex* pindex = chainActive[nHeightStart];
3112  CAmount nSupplyPrev = pindex->pprev->nMoneySupply;
3113  if (nHeightStart == Params().Zerocoin_StartHeight())
3114  nSupplyPrev = CAmount(5449796547496199);
3115 
3116  while (true) {
3117  if (pindex->nHeight % 1000 == 0)
3118  LogPrintf("%s : block %d...\n", __func__, pindex->nHeight);
3119 
3120  CBlock block;
3121  assert(ReadBlockFromDisk(block, pindex));
3122 
3123  CAmount nValueIn = 0;
3124  CAmount nValueOut = 0;
3125  for (const CTransaction tx : block.vtx) {
3126  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vin.size(); i++) {
3127  if (tx.IsCoinBase())
3128  break;
3129 
3130  if (tx.vin[i].scriptSig.IsZerocoinSpend()) {
3131  nValueIn += tx.vin[i].nSequence * COIN;
3132  continue;
3133  }
3134 
3135  COutPoint prevout = tx.vin[i].prevout;
3136  CTransaction txPrev;
3137  uint256 hashBlock;
3138  assert(GetTransaction(prevout.hash, txPrev, hashBlock, true));
3139  nValueIn += txPrev.vout[prevout.n].nValue;
3140  }
3141 
3142  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx.vout.size(); i++) {
3143  if (i == 0 && tx.IsCoinStake())
3144  continue;
3145 
3146  nValueOut += tx.vout[i].nValue;
3147  }
3148  }
3149 
3150  // Rewrite money supply
3151  pindex->nMoneySupply = nSupplyPrev + nValueOut - nValueIn;
3152  nSupplyPrev = pindex->nMoneySupply;
3153 
3154  // Add fraudulent funds to the supply and remove any recovered funds.
3155  if (pindex->nHeight == Params().Zerocoin_Block_RecalculateAccumulators()) {
3156  PopulateInvalidOutPointMap();
3157  LogPrintf("%s : Original money supply=%s\n", __func__, FormatMoney(pindex->nMoneySupply));
3158 
3159  pindex->nMoneySupply += nFilteredThroughBittrex;
3160  LogPrintf("%s : Adding bittrex filtered funds to supply + %s : supply=%s\n", __func__, FormatMoney(nFilteredThroughBittrex), FormatMoney(pindex->nMoneySupply));
3161 
3162  CAmount nLocked = GetInvalidUTXOValue();
3163  pindex->nMoneySupply -= nLocked;
3164  LogPrintf("%s : Removing locked from supply - %s : supply=%s\n", __func__, FormatMoney(nLocked), FormatMoney(pindex->nMoneySupply));
3165  }
3166 
3167  assert(pblocktree->WriteBlockIndex(CDiskBlockIndex(pindex)));
3168 
3169  if (pindex->nHeight < chainActive.Height())
3170  pindex = chainActive.Next(pindex);
3171  else
3172  break;
3173  }
3174  return true;
3175 }
3176 
3177 bool ReindexAccumulators(list<uint256>& listMissingCheckpoints, string& strError)
3178 {
3179  // DIVI: recalculate Accumulator Checkpoints that failed to database properly
3180  if (!listMissingCheckpoints.empty() && chainActive.Height() >= Params().Zerocoin_StartHeight()) {
3181  //uiInterface.InitMessage(_("Calculating missing accumulators..."));
3182  LogPrintf("%s : finding missing checkpoints\n", __func__);
3183 
3184  //search the chain to see when zerocoin started
3185  int nZerocoinStart = Params().Zerocoin_StartHeight();
3186 
3187  // find each checkpoint that is missing
3188  CBlockIndex* pindex = chainActive[nZerocoinStart];
3189  while (!listMissingCheckpoints.empty()) {
3190  if (ShutdownRequested())
3191  return false;
3192 
3193  // find checkpoints by iterating through the blockchain beginning with the first zerocoin block
3194  if (pindex->nAccumulatorCheckpoint != pindex->pprev->nAccumulatorCheckpoint) {
3195 
3196  //double dPercent = (pindex->nHeight - nZerocoinStart) / (double) (chainActive.Height() - nZerocoinStart);
3197  //uiInterface.ShowProgress(_("Calculating missing accumulators..."), (int) (dPercent * 100));
3198  if (find(listMissingCheckpoints.begin(), listMissingCheckpoints.end(), pindex->nAccumulatorCheckpoint) != listMissingCheckpoints.end()) {
3199  uint256 nCheckpointCalculated = 0;
3200  if (!CalculateAccumulatorCheckpoint(pindex->nHeight, nCheckpointCalculated)) {
3201  // GetCheckpoint could have terminated due to a shutdown request. Check this here.
3202  if (ShutdownRequested())
3203  break;
3204  strError = _("Failed to calculate accumulator checkpoint");
3205  return false;
3206  }
3207 
3208  //check that the calculated checkpoint is what is in the index.
3209  if (nCheckpointCalculated != pindex->nAccumulatorCheckpoint) {
3210  LogPrintf("%s : height=%d calculated_checkpoint=%s actual=%s\n", __func__, pindex->nHeight, nCheckpointCalculated.GetHex(), pindex->nAccumulatorCheckpoint.GetHex());
3211  strError = _("Calculated accumulator checkpoint is not what is recorded by block index");
3212  return false;
3213  }
3214 
3215  auto it = find(listMissingCheckpoints.begin(), listMissingCheckpoints.end(), pindex->nAccumulatorCheckpoint);
3216  listMissingCheckpoints.erase(it);
3217  }
3218  }
3219 
3220  // if we have iterated to the end of the blockchain, then checkpoints should be in sync
3221  if (pindex->nHeight + 1 <= chainActive.Height())
3222  pindex = chainActive.Next(pindex);
3223  else
3224  break;
3225  }
3226  }
3227  return true;
3228 }
3229 
3230 static int64_t nTimeVerify = 0;
3231 static int64_t nTimeConnect = 0;
3232 static int64_t nTimeIndex = 0;
3233 static int64_t nTimeCallbacks = 0;
3234 static int64_t nTimeTotal = 0;
3235 
3236 bool ConnectBlock(const CBlock& block, CValidationState& state, CBlockIndex* pindex, CCoinsViewCache& view, bool fJustCheck, bool fAlreadyChecked)
3237 {
3238  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
3239  // Check it again in case a previous version let a bad block in
3240  if (!fAlreadyChecked && !CheckBlock(block, state, !fJustCheck, !fJustCheck))
3241  return false;
3242 
3243  // verify that the view's current state corresponds to the previous block
3244  uint256 hashPrevBlock = pindex->pprev == NULL ? uint256(0) : pindex->pprev->GetBlockHash();
3245  if (hashPrevBlock != view.GetBestBlock())
3246  LogPrintf("%s: hashPrev=%s view=%s\n", __func__, hashPrevBlock.ToString().c_str(), view.GetBestBlock().ToString().c_str());
3247  assert(hashPrevBlock == view.GetBestBlock());
3248 
3249  // Special case for the genesis block, skipping connection of its transactions
3250  // (its coinbase is unspendable)
3251  if (block.GetHash() == Params().HashGenesisBlock()) {
3252  view.SetBestBlock(pindex->GetBlockHash());
3253  return true;
3254  }
3255 
3256  if (pindex->nHeight <= Params().LAST_POW_BLOCK() && block.IsProofOfStake())
3257  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock() : PoS period not active"),
3258  REJECT_INVALID, "PoS-early");
3259 
3260  if (pindex->nHeight > Params().LAST_POW_BLOCK() && block.IsProofOfWork())
3261  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock() : PoW period ended"),
3262  REJECT_INVALID, "PoW-ended");
3263 
3264  bool fScriptChecks = pindex->nHeight >= Checkpoints::GetTotalBlocksEstimate();
3265 
3266  // Do not allow blocks that contain transactions which 'overwrite' older transactions,
3267  // unless those are already completely spent.
3268  // If such overwrites are allowed, coinbases and transactions depending upon those
3269  // can be duplicated to remove the ability to spend the first instance -- even after
3270  // being sent to another address.
3271  // See BIP30 and http://r6.ca/blog/20120206T005236Z.html for more information.
3272  // This logic is not necessary for memory pool transactions, as AcceptToMemoryPool
3273  // already refuses previously-known transaction ids entirely.
3274  // This rule was originally applied all blocks whose timestamp was after March 15, 2012, 0:00 UTC.
3275  // Now that the whole chain is irreversibly beyond that time it is applied to all blocks except the
3276  // two in the chain that violate it. This prevents exploiting the issue against nodes in their
3277  // initial block download.
3278  bool fEnforceBIP30 = (!pindex->phashBlock) || // Enforce on CreateNewBlock invocations which don't have a hash.
3279  !((pindex->nHeight == 91842 && pindex->GetBlockHash() == uint256("0x00000000000a4d0a398161ffc163c503763b1f4360639393e0e4c8e300e0caec")) ||
3280  (pindex->nHeight == 91880 && pindex->GetBlockHash() == uint256("0x00000000000743f190a18c5577a3c2d2a1f610ae9601ac046a38084ccb7cd721")));
3281  if (fEnforceBIP30) {
3282  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTransaction& tx, block.vtx) {
3283  const CCoins* coins = view.AccessCoins(tx.GetHash());
3284  if (coins && !coins->IsPruned())
3285  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock() : tried to overwrite transaction"),
3286  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-BIP30");
3287  }
3288  }
3289 
3290  // BIP16 didn't become active until Apr 1 2012
3291  int64_t nBIP16SwitchTime = 1333238400;
3292  bool fStrictPayToScriptHash = (pindex->GetBlockTime() >= nBIP16SwitchTime);
3293 
3294  unsigned int flags = fStrictPayToScriptHash ? SCRIPT_VERIFY_P2SH : SCRIPT_VERIFY_NONE;
3295 
3296  // Start enforcing the DERSIG (BIP66) rules, for block.nVersion=3 blocks, when 75% of the network has upgraded:
3297  if (block.nVersion >= 3 && CBlockIndex::IsSuperMajority(3, pindex->pprev, Params().EnforceBlockUpgradeMajority())) {
3298  flags |= SCRIPT_VERIFY_DERSIG;
3299  }
3300 
3301  CBlockUndo blockundo;
3302 
3303  CCheckQueueControl<CScriptCheck> control(fScriptChecks && nScriptCheckThreads ? &scriptcheckqueue : NULL);
3304 
3305  int64_t nTimeStart = GetTimeMicros();
3306  CAmount nFees = 0;
3307  int nInputs = 0;
3308  unsigned int nSigOps = 0;
3309  CDiskTxPos pos(pindex->GetBlockPos(), GetSizeOfCompactSize(block.vtx.size()));
3310  std::vector<std::pair<uint256, CDiskTxPos> > vPos;
3311  vPos.reserve(block.vtx.size());
3312  blockundo.vtxundo.reserve(block.vtx.size() - 1);
3313  CAmount nValueOut = 0;
3314  CAmount nValueIn = 0;
3315  unsigned int nMaxBlockSigOps = MAX_BLOCK_SIGOPS_CURRENT;
3316  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < block.vtx.size(); i++) {
3317  const CTransaction& tx = block.vtx[i];
3318 
3319  nInputs += tx.vin.size();
3320  nSigOps += GetLegacySigOpCount(tx);
3321  if (nSigOps > nMaxBlockSigOps)
3322  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock() : too many sigops"),
3323  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-blk-sigops");
3324 
3325  //Temporarily disable zerocoin transactions for maintenance
3326  if (block.nTime > GetSporkValue(SPORK_16_ZEROCOIN_MAINTENANCE_MODE) && !IsInitialBlockDownload() && tx.ContainsZerocoins())
3327  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock() : zerocoin transactions are currently in maintenance mode"));
3328 
3329  if (tx.IsZerocoinSpend()) {
3330  int nHeightTx = 0;
3331  if (IsTransactionInChain(tx.GetHash(), nHeightTx)) {
3332  //when verifying blocks on init, the blocks are scanned without being disconnected - prevent that from causing an error
3333  if (!fVerifyingBlocks || (fVerifyingBlocks && pindex->nHeight > nHeightTx))
3334  return state.DoS(100, error("%s : txid %s already exists in block %d , trying to include it again in block %d", __func__,
3335  tx.GetHash().GetHex(), nHeightTx, pindex->nHeight),
3336  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-inputs-missingorspent");
3337  }
3338 
3339  //Check for double spending of serial #'s
3340  for (const CTxIn& txIn : tx.vin) {
3341  if (!txIn.scriptSig.IsZerocoinSpend())
3342  continue;
3343  CoinSpend spend = TxInToZerocoinSpend(txIn);
3344  nValueIn += spend.getDenomination() * COIN;
3345 
3346  // Make sure that the serial number is in valid range
3347  if (!spend.HasValidSerial(Params().Zerocoin_Params())) {
3348  string strError = strprintf("%s : txid=%s in block %d contains invalid serial %s\n", __func__, tx.GetHash().GetHex(), pindex->nHeight, spend.getCoinSerialNumber());
3349  if (pindex->nHeight >= Params().Zerocoin_Block_EnforceSerialRange())
3350  return state.DoS(100, error(strError.c_str()));
3351  strError = "NOT ENFORCING : " + strError;
3352  LogPrintf(strError.c_str());
3353  }
3354 
3355  //Is the serial already in the blockchain?
3356  uint256 hashTxFromDB;
3357  int nHeightTxSpend = 0;
3358  if (zerocoinDB->ReadCoinSpend(spend.getCoinSerialNumber(), hashTxFromDB)) {
3359  if(IsSerialInBlockchain(spend.getCoinSerialNumber(), nHeightTxSpend)) {
3360  if(!fVerifyingBlocks || (fVerifyingBlocks && pindex->nHeight > nHeightTxSpend))
3361  return state.DoS(100, error("%s : zDiv with serial %s is already in the block %d\n",
3362  __func__, spend.getCoinSerialNumber().GetHex(), nHeightTxSpend));
3363  }
3364  }
3365 
3366  //record spend to database
3367  if (!zerocoinDB->WriteCoinSpend(spend.getCoinSerialNumber(), tx.GetHash()))
3368  return error("%s : failed to record coin serial to database");
3369  }
3370  } else if (!tx.IsCoinBase()) {
3371  if (!view.HaveInputs(tx))
3372  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock() : inputs missing/spent"),
3373  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-inputs-missingorspent");
3374 
3375  // Check that the inputs are not marked as invalid/fraudulent
3376  for (CTxIn in : tx.vin) {
3377  if (!ValidOutPoint(in.prevout, pindex->nHeight)) {
3378  return state.DoS(100, error("%s : tried to spend invalid input %s in tx %s", __func__, in.prevout.ToString(),
3379  tx.GetHash().GetHex()), REJECT_INVALID, "bad-txns-invalid-inputs");
3380  }
3381  }
3382 
3383  if (fStrictPayToScriptHash) {
3384  // Add in sigops done by pay-to-script-hash inputs;
3385  // this is to prevent a "rogue miner" from creating
3386  // an incredibly-expensive-to-validate block.
3387  nSigOps += GetP2SHSigOpCount(tx, view);
3388  if (nSigOps > nMaxBlockSigOps)
3389  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock() : too many sigops"),
3390  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-blk-sigops");
3391  }
3392 
3393  if (!tx.IsCoinStake())
3394  nFees += view.GetValueIn(tx) - tx.GetValueOut();
3395  nValueIn += view.GetValueIn(tx);
3396 
3397  std::vector<CScriptCheck> vChecks;
3398  if (!CheckInputs(tx, state, view, fScriptChecks, flags, false, nScriptCheckThreads ? &vChecks : NULL))
3399  return false;
3400  control.Add(vChecks);
3401  }
3402  nValueOut += tx.GetValueOut();
3403 
3404  CTxUndo undoDummy;
3405  if (i > 0) {
3406  blockundo.vtxundo.push_back(CTxUndo());
3407  }
3408  UpdateCoins(tx, state, view, i == 0 ? undoDummy : blockundo.vtxundo.back(), pindex->nHeight);
3409 
3410  vPos.push_back(std::make_pair(tx.GetHash(), pos));
3411  pos.nTxOffset += ::GetSerializeSize(tx, SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
3412  }
3413 
3414  std::list<CZerocoinMint> listMints;
3415  bool fFilterInvalid = pindex->nHeight >= Params().Zerocoin_Block_RecalculateAccumulators();
3416  BlockToZerocoinMintList(block, listMints, fFilterInvalid);
3417  std::list<libzerocoin::CoinDenomination> listSpends = ZerocoinSpendListFromBlock(block, fFilterInvalid);
3418 
3419  if (pindex->nHeight == Params().Zerocoin_Block_RecalculateAccumulators() + 1) {
3420  RecalculateZDIVMinted();
3421  RecalculateZDIVSpent();
3422  RecalculateDIVSupply(Params().Zerocoin_StartHeight());
3423  }
3424 
3425  // Initialize zerocoin supply to the supply from previous block
3426  if (pindex->pprev && pindex->pprev->GetBlockHeader().nVersion > 3) {
3427  for (auto& denom : zerocoinDenomList) {
3428  pindex->mapZerocoinSupply.at(denom) = pindex->pprev->mapZerocoinSupply.at(denom);
3429  }
3430  }
3431 
3432  // Track zerocoin money supply
3433  CAmount nAmountZerocoinSpent = 0;
3434  pindex->vMintDenominationsInBlock.clear();
3435  if (pindex->pprev) {
3436  for (auto& m : listMints) {
3437  libzerocoin::CoinDenomination denom = m.GetDenomination();
3438  pindex->vMintDenominationsInBlock.push_back(m.GetDenomination());
3439  pindex->mapZerocoinSupply.at(denom)++;
3440  }
3441 
3442  for (auto& denom : listSpends) {
3443  pindex->mapZerocoinSupply.at(denom)--;
3444  nAmountZerocoinSpent += libzerocoin::ZerocoinDenominationToAmount(denom);
3445 
3446  // zerocoin failsafe
3447  if (pindex->mapZerocoinSupply.at(denom) < 0)
3448  return state.DoS(100, error("Block contains zerocoins that spend more than are in the available supply to spend"));
3449  }
3450  }
3451 
3452  //DC-start: commented for error in Genesis Block/Coins minting.
3453  //for (auto& denom : zerocoinDenomList) {
3454  //LogPrint("zero" "%s coins for denomination %d pubcoin %s\n", func, pindex->mapZerocoinSupply.at(denom), denom);
3455  //}
3456  //DC-end
3457 
3458  // track money supply and mint amount info
3459  CAmount nMoneySupplyPrev = pindex->pprev ? pindex->pprev->nMoneySupply : 0;
3460  pindex->nMoneySupply = nMoneySupplyPrev + nValueOut - nValueIn;
3461  pindex->nMint = pindex->nMoneySupply - nMoneySupplyPrev + nFees;
3462 
3463 // LogPrintf("XX69----------> ConnectBlock(): nValueOut: %s, nValueIn: %s, nFees: %s, nMint: %s zDivSpent: %s\n",
3464 // FormatMoney(nValueOut), FormatMoney(nValueIn),
3465 // FormatMoney(nFees), FormatMoney(pindex->nMint), FormatMoney(nAmountZerocoinSpent));
3466 
3467  if (!pblocktree->WriteBlockIndex(CDiskBlockIndex(pindex)))
3468  return error("Connect() : WriteBlockIndex for pindex failed");
3469 
3470  int64_t nTime1 = GetTimeMicros();
3471  nTimeConnect += nTime1 - nTimeStart;
3472  LogPrint("bench", " - Connect %u transactions: %.2fms (%.3fms/tx, %.3fms/txin) [%.2fs]\n", (unsigned)block.vtx.size(), 0.001 * (nTime1 - nTimeStart), 0.001 * (nTime1 - nTimeStart) / block.vtx.size(), nInputs <= 1 ? 0 : 0.001 * (nTime1 - nTimeStart) / (nInputs - 1), nTimeConnect * 0.000001);
3473 
3474  //PoW phase redistributed fees to miner. PoS stage destroys fees.
3475  CAmount nExpectedMint = GetBlockValue(pindex->pprev->nHeight);
3476  if (block.IsProofOfWork())
3477  nExpectedMint += nFees;
3478 
3479  if (!IsBlockValueValid(block, nExpectedMint, pindex->nMint)) {
3480  return state.DoS(100,
3481  error("ConnectBlock() : reward pays too much (actual=%s vs limit=%s)",
3482  FormatMoney(pindex->nMint), FormatMoney(nExpectedMint)),
3483  REJECT_INVALID, "bad-cb-amount");
3484  }
3485 
3486  // zerocoin accumulator: if a new accumulator checkpoint was generated, check that it is the correct value
3487  if (!fVerifyingBlocks && pindex->nHeight >= Params().Zerocoin_StartHeight() && pindex->nHeight % 10 == 0) {
3488  uint256 nCheckpointCalculated = 0;
3489 
3490  // if IDB, invalid outpoints must be calculated or else acc checkpoint will be incorrect
3491  if (pindex->nHeight == Params().Zerocoin_Block_RecalculateAccumulators())
3492  PopulateInvalidOutPointMap();
3493 
3494  if (!CalculateAccumulatorCheckpoint(pindex->nHeight, nCheckpointCalculated)) {
3495  //Calculate list of checkpoints that may be missing due to deletion on block 809000, and rewinding back before 809000
3496  int nStop = Params().Zerocoin_Block_RecalculateAccumulators() + 20;
3497  if (pindex->nHeight < nStop && pindex->nHeight > Params().Zerocoin_Block_LastGoodCheckpoint()) {
3498  LogPrintf("%s : Checkpoint not found for block %d, recalculating accumulators\n", __func__, pindex->nHeight);
3499  CBlockIndex* pindexCheckpoint = chainActive[Params().Zerocoin_Block_LastGoodCheckpoint()];
3500  list<uint256> listCheckpoints;
3501  while (pindexCheckpoint->nHeight <= nStop) {
3502  if (!count(listCheckpoints.begin(), listCheckpoints.end(), pindexCheckpoint->nAccumulatorCheckpoint))
3503  listCheckpoints.emplace_back(pindexCheckpoint->nAccumulatorCheckpoint);
3504 
3505  pindexCheckpoint = chainActive.Next(pindexCheckpoint);
3506  if (!pindexCheckpoint)
3507  break;
3508  }
3509 
3510  string strError;
3511  if (!ReindexAccumulators(listCheckpoints, strError) || !CalculateAccumulatorCheckpoint(pindex->nHeight, nCheckpointCalculated))
3512  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock() : failed to recalculate accumulator checkpoint"));
3513  } else {
3514  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock() : failed to calculate accumulator checkpoint"));
3515  }
3516  }
3517 
3518  if (nCheckpointCalculated != block.nAccumulatorCheckpoint) {
3519  LogPrintf("%s: block=%d calculated: %s\n block: %s\n", __func__, pindex->nHeight, nCheckpointCalculated.GetHex(), block.nAccumulatorCheckpoint.GetHex());
3520  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock() : accumulator does not match calculated value"));
3521  }
3522  } else if (!fVerifyingBlocks) {
3523  if (block.nAccumulatorCheckpoint != pindex->pprev->nAccumulatorCheckpoint)
3524  return state.DoS(100, error("ConnectBlock() : new accumulator checkpoint generated on a block that is not multiple of 10"));
3525  }
3526 
3527  if (!control.Wait())
3528  return state.DoS(100, false);
3529  int64_t nTime2 = GetTimeMicros();
3530  nTimeVerify += nTime2 - nTimeStart;
3531  LogPrint("bench", " - Verify %u txins: %.2fms (%.3fms/txin) [%.2fs]\n", nInputs - 1, 0.001 * (nTime2 - nTimeStart), nInputs <= 1 ? 0 : 0.001 * (nTime2 - nTimeStart) / (nInputs - 1), nTimeVerify * 0.000001);
3532 
3533  if (fJustCheck)
3534  return true;
3535 
3536  // Write undo information to disk
3537  if (pindex->GetUndoPos().IsNull() || !pindex->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_SCRIPTS)) {
3538  if (pindex->GetUndoPos().IsNull()) {
3539  CDiskBlockPos pos;
3540  if (!FindUndoPos(state, pindex->nFile, pos, ::GetSerializeSize(blockundo, SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION) + 40))
3541  return error("ConnectBlock() : FindUndoPos failed");
3542  if (!blockundo.WriteToDisk(pos, pindex->pprev->GetBlockHash()))
3543  return state.Abort("Failed to write undo data");
3544 
3545  // update nUndoPos in block index
3546  pindex->nUndoPos = pos.nPos;
3547  pindex->nStatus |= BLOCK_HAVE_UNDO;
3548  }
3549 
3550  pindex->RaiseValidity(BLOCK_VALID_SCRIPTS);
3551  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindex);
3552  }
3553 
3554  if (fTxIndex)
3555  if (!pblocktree->WriteTxIndex(vPos))
3556  return state.Abort("Failed to write transaction index");
3557 
3558  // add this block to the view's block chain
3559  view.SetBestBlock(pindex->GetBlockHash());
3560 
3561  int64_t nTime3 = GetTimeMicros();
3562  nTimeIndex += nTime3 - nTime2;
3563  LogPrint("bench", " - Index writing: %.2fms [%.2fs]\n", 0.001 * (nTime3 - nTime2), nTimeIndex * 0.000001);
3564 
3565  // Watch for changes to the previous coinbase transaction.
3566  static uint256 hashPrevBestCoinBase;
3567  g_signals.UpdatedTransaction(hashPrevBestCoinBase);
3568  hashPrevBestCoinBase = block.vtx[0].GetHash();
3569 
3570  int64_t nTime4 = GetTimeMicros();
3571  nTimeCallbacks += nTime4 - nTime3;
3572  LogPrint("bench", " - Callbacks: %.2fms [%.2fs]\n", 0.001 * (nTime4 - nTime3), nTimeCallbacks * 0.000001);
3573 
3574  //Continue tracking possible movement of fraudulent funds until they are completely frozen
3575  if (pindex->nHeight >= Params().Zerocoin_Block_FirstFraudulent() && pindex->nHeight <= Params().Zerocoin_Block_RecalculateAccumulators() + 1)
3576  AddInvalidSpendsToMap(block);
3577 
3578  return true;
3579 }
3580 
3581 enum FlushStateMode {
3582  FLUSH_STATE_IF_NEEDED,
3583  FLUSH_STATE_PERIODIC,
3584  FLUSH_STATE_ALWAYS
3585 };
3586 
3592 bool static FlushStateToDisk(CValidationState& state, FlushStateMode mode)
3593 {
3594  LOCK(cs_main);
3595  static int64_t nLastWrite = 0;
3596  try {
3597  if ((mode == FLUSH_STATE_ALWAYS) ||
3598  ((mode == FLUSH_STATE_PERIODIC || mode == FLUSH_STATE_IF_NEEDED) && pcoinsTip->GetCacheSize() > nCoinCacheSize) ||
3599  (mode == FLUSH_STATE_PERIODIC && GetTimeMicros() > nLastWrite + DATABASE_WRITE_INTERVAL * 1000000)) {
3600  // Typical CCoins structures on disk are around 100 bytes in size.
3601  // Pushing a new one to the database can cause it to be written
3602  // twice (once in the log, and once in the tables). This is already
3603  // an overestimation, as most will delete an existing entry or
3604  // overwrite one. Still, use a conservative safety factor of 2.
3605  if (!CheckDiskSpace(100 * 2 * 2 * pcoinsTip->GetCacheSize()))
3606  return state.Error("out of disk space");
3607  // First make sure all block and undo data is flushed to disk.
3608  FlushBlockFile();
3609  // Then update all block file information (which may refer to block and undo files).
3610  bool fileschanged = false;
3611  for (set<int>::iterator it = setDirtyFileInfo.begin(); it != setDirtyFileInfo.end();) {
3612  if (!pblocktree->WriteBlockFileInfo(*it, vinfoBlockFile[*it])) {
3613  return state.Abort("Failed to write to block index");
3614  }
3615  fileschanged = true;
3616  setDirtyFileInfo.erase(it++);
3617  }
3618  if (fileschanged && !pblocktree->WriteLastBlockFile(nLastBlockFile)) {
3619  return state.Abort("Failed to write to block index");
3620  }
3621  for (set<CBlockIndex*>::iterator it = setDirtyBlockIndex.begin(); it != setDirtyBlockIndex.end();) {
3622  if (!pblocktree->WriteBlockIndex(CDiskBlockIndex(*it))) {
3623  return state.Abort("Failed to write to block index");
3624  }
3625  setDirtyBlockIndex.erase(it++);
3626  }
3627  pblocktree->Sync();
3628  // Finally flush the chainstate (which may refer to block index entries).
3629  if (!pcoinsTip->Flush())
3630  return state.Abort("Failed to write to coin database");
3631  // Update best block in wallet (so we can detect restored wallets).
3632  if (mode != FLUSH_STATE_IF_NEEDED) {
3633  g_signals.SetBestChain(chainActive.GetLocator());
3634  }
3635  nLastWrite = GetTimeMicros();
3636  }
3637  } catch (const std::runtime_error& e) {
3638  return state.Abort(std::string("System error while flushing: ") + e.what());
3639  }
3640  return true;
3641 }
3642 
3643 void FlushStateToDisk()
3644 {
3645  CValidationState state;
3646  FlushStateToDisk(state, FLUSH_STATE_ALWAYS);
3647 }
3648 
3650 void static UpdateTip(CBlockIndex* pindexNew)
3651 {
3652  chainActive.SetTip(pindexNew);
3653 
3654  // If turned on AutoZeromint will automatically convert DIV to zDIV
3655  if (pwalletMain->isZeromintEnabled ())
3656  pwalletMain->AutoZeromint ();
3657 
3658  // New best block
3659  nTimeBestReceived = GetTime();
3660  mempool.AddTransactionsUpdated(1);
3661 
3662  LogPrintf("UpdateTip: new best=%s height=%d log2_work=%.8g tx=%lu date=%s progress=%f cache=%u\n",
3663  chainActive.Tip()->GetBlockHash().ToString(), chainActive.Height(), log(chainActive.Tip()->nChainWork.getdouble()) / log(2.0), (unsigned long)chainActive.Tip()->nChainTx,
3664  DateTimeStrFormat("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S", chainActive.Tip()->GetBlockTime()),
3665  Checkpoints::GuessVerificationProgress(chainActive.Tip()), (unsigned int)pcoinsTip->GetCacheSize());
3666 
3667  cvBlockChange.notify_all();
3668 
3669  // Check the version of the last 100 blocks to see if we need to upgrade:
3670  static bool fWarned = false;
3671  if (!IsInitialBlockDownload() && !fWarned) {
3672  int nUpgraded = 0;
3673  const CBlockIndex* pindex = chainActive.Tip();
3674  for (int i = 0; i < 100 && pindex != NULL; i++) {
3675  if (pindex->nVersion > CBlock::CURRENT_VERSION)
3676  ++nUpgraded;
3677  pindex = pindex->pprev;
3678  }
3679  if (nUpgraded > 0)
3680  LogPrintf("SetBestChain: %d of last 100 blocks above version %d\n", nUpgraded, (int)CBlock::CURRENT_VERSION);
3681  if (nUpgraded > 100 / 2) {
3682  // strMiscWarning is read by GetWarnings(), called by Qt and the JSON-RPC code to warn the user:
3683  strMiscWarning = _("Warning: This version is obsolete, upgrade required!");
3684  CAlert::Notify(strMiscWarning, true);
3685  fWarned = true;
3686  }
3687  }
3688 }
3689 
3691 bool static DisconnectTip(CValidationState& state)
3692 {
3693  CBlockIndex* pindexDelete = chainActive.Tip();
3694  assert(pindexDelete);
3695  mempool.check(pcoinsTip);
3696  // Read block from disk.
3697  CBlock block;
3698  if (!ReadBlockFromDisk(block, pindexDelete))
3699  return state.Abort("Failed to read block");
3700  // Apply the block atomically to the chain state.
3701  int64_t nStart = GetTimeMicros();
3702  {
3703  CCoinsViewCache view(pcoinsTip);
3704  if (!DisconnectBlock(block, state, pindexDelete, view))
3705  return error("DisconnectTip() : DisconnectBlock %s failed", pindexDelete->GetBlockHash().ToString());
3706  assert(view.Flush());
3707  }
3708  LogPrint("bench", "- Disconnect block: %.2fms\n", (GetTimeMicros() - nStart) * 0.001);
3709  // Write the chain state to disk, if necessary.
3710  if (!FlushStateToDisk(state, FLUSH_STATE_ALWAYS))
3711  return false;
3712  // Resurrect mempool transactions from the disconnected block.
3713  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTransaction& tx, block.vtx) {
3714  // ignore validation errors in resurrected transactions
3715  list<CTransaction> removed;
3716  CValidationState stateDummy;
3717  if (tx.IsCoinBase() || tx.IsCoinStake() || !AcceptToMemoryPool(mempool, stateDummy, tx, false, NULL))
3718  mempool.remove(tx, removed, true);
3719  }
3720  mempool.removeCoinbaseSpends(pcoinsTip, pindexDelete->nHeight);
3721  mempool.check(pcoinsTip);
3722  // Update chainActive and related variables.
3723  UpdateTip(pindexDelete->pprev);
3724  // Let wallets know transactions went from 1-confirmed to
3725  // 0-confirmed or conflicted:
3726  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTransaction& tx, block.vtx) {
3727  SyncWithWallets(tx, NULL);
3728  }
3729  return true;
3730 }
3731 
3732 static int64_t nTimeReadFromDisk = 0;
3733 static int64_t nTimeConnectTotal = 0;
3734 static int64_t nTimeFlush = 0;
3735 static int64_t nTimeChainState = 0;
3736 static int64_t nTimePostConnect = 0;
3737 
3742 bool static ConnectTip(CValidationState& state, CBlockIndex* pindexNew, CBlock* pblock, bool fAlreadyChecked)
3743 {
3744  assert(pindexNew->pprev == chainActive.Tip());
3745  mempool.check(pcoinsTip);
3746  CCoinsViewCache view(pcoinsTip);
3747 
3748  if (pblock == NULL)
3749  fAlreadyChecked = false;
3750 
3751  // Read block from disk.
3752  int64_t nTime1 = GetTimeMicros();
3753  CBlock block;
3754  if (!pblock) {
3755  if (!ReadBlockFromDisk(block, pindexNew))
3756  return state.Abort("Failed to read block");
3757  pblock = &block;
3758  }
3759  // Apply the block atomically to the chain state.
3760  int64_t nTime2 = GetTimeMicros();
3761  nTimeReadFromDisk += nTime2 - nTime1;
3762  int64_t nTime3;
3763  LogPrint("bench", " - Load block from disk: %.2fms [%.2fs]\n", (nTime2 - nTime1) * 0.001, nTimeReadFromDisk * 0.000001);
3764  {
3765  CInv inv(MSG_BLOCK, pindexNew->GetBlockHash());
3766  bool rv = ConnectBlock(*pblock, state, pindexNew, view, false, fAlreadyChecked);
3767  g_signals.BlockChecked(*pblock, state);
3768  if (!rv) {
3769  if (state.IsInvalid())
3770  InvalidBlockFound(pindexNew, state);
3771  return error("ConnectTip() : ConnectBlock %s failed", pindexNew->GetBlockHash().ToString());
3772  }
3773  mapBlockSource.erase(inv.hash);
3774  nTime3 = GetTimeMicros();
3775  nTimeConnectTotal += nTime3 - nTime2;
3776  LogPrint("bench", " - Connect total: %.2fms [%.2fs]\n", (nTime3 - nTime2) * 0.001, nTimeConnectTotal * 0.000001);
3777  assert(view.Flush());
3778  }
3779  int64_t nTime4 = GetTimeMicros();
3780  nTimeFlush += nTime4 - nTime3;
3781  LogPrint("bench", " - Flush: %.2fms [%.2fs]\n", (nTime4 - nTime3) * 0.001, nTimeFlush * 0.000001);
3782 
3783  // Write the chain state to disk, if necessary. Always write to disk if this is the first of a new file.
3784  FlushStateMode flushMode = FLUSH_STATE_IF_NEEDED;
3785  if (pindexNew->pprev && (pindexNew->GetBlockPos().nFile != pindexNew->pprev->GetBlockPos().nFile))
3786  flushMode = FLUSH_STATE_ALWAYS;
3787  if (!FlushStateToDisk(state, flushMode))
3788  return false;
3789  int64_t nTime5 = GetTimeMicros();
3790  nTimeChainState += nTime5 - nTime4;
3791  LogPrint("bench", " - Writing chainstate: %.2fms [%.2fs]\n", (nTime5 - nTime4) * 0.001, nTimeChainState * 0.000001);
3792 
3793  // Remove conflicting transactions from the mempool.
3794  list<CTransaction> txConflicted;
3795  mempool.removeForBlock(pblock->vtx, pindexNew->nHeight, txConflicted);
3796  mempool.check(pcoinsTip);
3797  // Update chainActive & related variables.
3798  UpdateTip(pindexNew);
3799  // Tell wallet about transactions that went from mempool
3800  // to conflicted:
3801  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTransaction& tx, txConflicted) {
3802  SyncWithWallets(tx, NULL);
3803  }
3804  // ... and about transactions that got confirmed:
3805  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTransaction& tx, pblock->vtx) {
3806  SyncWithWallets(tx, pblock);
3807  }
3808 
3809  int64_t nTime6 = GetTimeMicros();
3810  nTimePostConnect += nTime6 - nTime5;
3811  nTimeTotal += nTime6 - nTime1;
3812  LogPrint("bench", " - Connect postprocess: %.2fms [%.2fs]\n", (nTime6 - nTime5) * 0.001, nTimePostConnect * 0.000001);
3813  LogPrint("bench", "- Connect block: %.2fms [%.2fs]\n", (nTime6 - nTime1) * 0.001, nTimeTotal * 0.000001);
3814  return true;
3815 }
3816 
3817 bool DisconnectBlocksAndReprocess(int blocks)
3818 {
3819  LOCK(cs_main);
3820 
3821  CValidationState state;
3822 
3823  LogPrintf("DisconnectBlocksAndReprocess: Got command to replay %d blocks\n", blocks);
3824  for (int i = 0; i <= blocks; i++)
3825  DisconnectTip(state);
3826 
3827  return true;
3828 }
3829 
3830 /*
3831  DisconnectBlockAndInputs
3832 
3833  Remove conflicting blocks for successful SwiftX transaction locks
3834  This should be very rare (Probably will never happen)
3835 */
3836 // ***TODO*** clean up here
3837 bool DisconnectBlockAndInputs(CValidationState& state, CTransaction txLock)
3838 {
3839  // All modifications to the coin state will be done in this cache.
3840  // Only when all have succeeded, we push it to pcoinsTip.
3841  // CCoinsViewCache view(*pcoinsTip, true);
3842 
3843  CBlockIndex* BlockReading = chainActive.Tip();
3844  CBlockIndex* pindexNew = NULL;
3845 
3846  bool foundConflictingTx = false;
3847 
3848  //remove anything conflicting in the memory pool
3849  list<CTransaction> txConflicted;
3850  mempool.removeConflicts(txLock, txConflicted);
3851 
3852 
3853  // List of what to disconnect (typically nothing)
3854  vector<CBlockIndex*> vDisconnect;
3855 
3856  for (unsigned int i = 1; BlockReading && BlockReading->nHeight > 0 && !foundConflictingTx && i < 6; i++) {
3857  vDisconnect.push_back(BlockReading);
3858  pindexNew = BlockReading->pprev; //new best block
3859 
3860  CBlock block;
3861  if (!ReadBlockFromDisk(block, BlockReading))
3862  return state.Abort(_("Failed to read block"));
3863 
3864  // Queue memory transactions to resurrect.
3865  // We only do this for blocks after the last checkpoint (reorganisation before that
3866  // point should only happen with -reindex/-loadblock, or a misbehaving peer.
3867  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTransaction& tx, block.vtx) {
3868  if (!tx.IsCoinBase()) {
3869  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTxIn& in1, txLock.vin) {
3870  BOOST_FOREACH (const CTxIn& in2, tx.vin) {
3871  if (in1.prevout == in2.prevout) foundConflictingTx = true;
3872  }
3873  }
3874  }
3875  }
3876 
3877  if (BlockReading->pprev == NULL) {
3878  assert(BlockReading);
3879  break;
3880  }
3881  BlockReading = BlockReading->pprev;
3882  }
3883 
3884  if (!foundConflictingTx) {
3885  LogPrintf("DisconnectBlockAndInputs: Can't find a conflicting transaction to inputs\n");
3886  return false;
3887  }
3888 
3889  if (vDisconnect.size() > 0) {
3890  LogPrintf("REORGANIZE: Disconnect Conflicting Blocks %lli blocks; %s..\n", vDisconnect.size(), pindexNew->GetBlockHash().ToString());
3891  BOOST_FOREACH (CBlockIndex* pindex, vDisconnect) {
3892  LogPrintf(" -- disconnect %s\n", pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString());
3893  DisconnectTip(state);
3894  }
3895  }
3896 
3897  return true;
3898 }
3899 
3900 
3905 static CBlockIndex* FindMostWorkChain()
3906 {
3907  do {
3908  CBlockIndex* pindexNew = NULL;
3909 
3910  // Find the best candidate header.
3911  {
3912  std::set<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndexWorkComparator>::reverse_iterator it = setBlockIndexCandidates.rbegin();
3913  if (it == setBlockIndexCandidates.rend())
3914  return NULL;
3915  pindexNew = *it;
3916  }
3917 
3918  // Check whether all blocks on the path between the currently active chain and the candidate are valid.
3919  // Just going until the active chain is an optimization, as we know all blocks in it are valid already.
3920  CBlockIndex* pindexTest = pindexNew;
3921  bool fInvalidAncestor = false;
3922  while (pindexTest && !chainActive.Contains(pindexTest)) {
3923  assert(pindexTest->nChainTx || pindexTest->nHeight == 0);
3924 
3925  // Pruned nodes may have entries in setBlockIndexCandidates for
3926  // which block files have been deleted. Remove those as candidates
3927  // for the most work chain if we come across them; we can't switch
3928  // to a chain unless we have all the non-active-chain parent blocks.
3929  bool fFailedChain = pindexTest->nStatus & BLOCK_FAILED_MASK;
3930  bool fMissingData = !(pindexTest->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA);
3931  if (fFailedChain || fMissingData) {
3932  // Candidate chain is not usable (either invalid or missing data)
3933  if (fFailedChain && (pindexBestInvalid == NULL || pindexNew->nChainWork > pindexBestInvalid->nChainWork))
3934  pindexBestInvalid = pindexNew;
3935  CBlockIndex* pindexFailed = pindexNew;
3936  // Remove the entire chain from the set.
3937  while (pindexTest != pindexFailed) {
3938  if (fFailedChain) {
3939  pindexFailed->nStatus |= BLOCK_FAILED_CHILD;
3940  } else if (fMissingData) {
3941  // If we're missing data, then add back to mapBlocksUnlinked,
3942  // so that if the block arrives in the future we can try adding
3943  // to setBlockIndexCandidates again.
3944  mapBlocksUnlinked.insert(std::make_pair(pindexFailed->pprev, pindexFailed));
3945  }
3946  setBlockIndexCandidates.erase(pindexFailed);
3947  pindexFailed = pindexFailed->pprev;
3948  }
3949  setBlockIndexCandidates.erase(pindexTest);
3950  fInvalidAncestor = true;
3951  break;
3952  }
3953  pindexTest = pindexTest->pprev;
3954  }
3955  if (!fInvalidAncestor)
3956  return pindexNew;
3957  } while (true);
3958 }
3959 
3961 static void PruneBlockIndexCandidates()
3962 {
3963  // Note that we can't delete the current block itself, as we may need to return to it later in case a
3964  // reorganization to a better block fails.
3965  std::set<CBlockIndex*, CBlockIndexWorkComparator>::iterator it = setBlockIndexCandidates.begin();
3966  while (it != setBlockIndexCandidates.end() && setBlockIndexCandidates.value_comp()(*it, chainActive.Tip())) {
3967  setBlockIndexCandidates.erase(it++);
3968  }
3969  // Either the current tip or a successor of it we're working towards is left in setBlockIndexCandidates.
3970  assert(!setBlockIndexCandidates.empty());
3971 }
3972 
3977 static bool ActivateBestChainStep(CValidationState& state, CBlockIndex* pindexMostWork, CBlock* pblock, bool fAlreadyChecked)
3978 {
3979  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
3980  if (pblock == NULL)
3981  fAlreadyChecked = false;
3982  bool fInvalidFound = false;
3983  const CBlockIndex* pindexOldTip = chainActive.Tip();
3984  const CBlockIndex* pindexFork = chainActive.FindFork(pindexMostWork);
3985 
3986  // Disconnect active blocks which are no longer in the best chain.
3987  while (chainActive.Tip() && chainActive.Tip() != pindexFork) {
3988  if (!DisconnectTip(state))
3989  return false;
3990  }
3991 
3992  // Build list of new blocks to connect.
3993  std::vector<CBlockIndex*> vpindexToConnect;
3994  bool fContinue = true;
3995  int nHeight = pindexFork ? pindexFork->nHeight : -1;
3996  while (fContinue && nHeight != pindexMostWork->nHeight) {
3997  // Don't iterate the entire list of potential improvements toward the best tip, as we likely only need
3998  // a few blocks along the way.
3999  int nTargetHeight = std::min(nHeight + 32, pindexMostWork->nHeight);
4000  vpindexToConnect.clear();
4001  vpindexToConnect.reserve(nTargetHeight - nHeight);
4002  CBlockIndex* pindexIter = pindexMostWork->GetAncestor(nTargetHeight);
4003  while (pindexIter && pindexIter->nHeight != nHeight) {
4004  vpindexToConnect.push_back(pindexIter);
4005  pindexIter = pindexIter->pprev;
4006  }
4007  nHeight = nTargetHeight;
4008 
4009  // Connect new blocks.
4010  BOOST_REVERSE_FOREACH (CBlockIndex* pindexConnect, vpindexToConnect) {
4011  if (!ConnectTip(state, pindexConnect, pindexConnect == pindexMostWork ? pblock : NULL, fAlreadyChecked)) {
4012  if (state.IsInvalid()) {
4013  // The block violates a consensus rule.
4014  if (!state.CorruptionPossible())
4015  InvalidChainFound(vpindexToConnect.back());
4016  state = CValidationState();
4017  fInvalidFound = true;
4018  fContinue = false;
4019  break;
4020  } else {
4021  // A system error occurred (disk space, database error, ...).
4022  return false;
4023  }
4024  } else {
4025  PruneBlockIndexCandidates();
4026  if (!pindexOldTip || chainActive.Tip()->nChainWork > pindexOldTip->nChainWork) {
4027  // We're in a better position than we were. Return temporarily to release the lock.
4028  fContinue = false;
4029  break;
4030  }
4031  }
4032  }
4033  }
4034 
4035  // Callbacks/notifications for a new best chain.
4036  if (fInvalidFound)
4037  CheckForkWarningConditionsOnNewFork(vpindexToConnect.back());
4038  else
4039  CheckForkWarningConditions();
4040 
4041  return true;
4042 }
4043 
4049 bool ActivateBestChain(CValidationState& state, CBlock* pblock, bool fAlreadyChecked)
4050 {
4051  CBlockIndex* pindexNewTip = NULL;
4052  CBlockIndex* pindexMostWork = NULL;
4053  do {
4054  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
4055 
4056  bool fInitialDownload;
4057  while (true) {
4058  TRY_LOCK(cs_main, lockMain);
4059  if (!lockMain) {
4060  MilliSleep(50);
4061  continue;
4062  }
4063 
4064  pindexMostWork = FindMostWorkChain();
4065 
4066  // Whether we have anything to do at all.
4067  if (pindexMostWork == NULL || pindexMostWork == chainActive.Tip())
4068  return true;
4069 
4070  if (!ActivateBestChainStep(state, pindexMostWork, pblock && pblock->GetHash() == pindexMostWork->GetBlockHash() ? pblock : NULL, fAlreadyChecked))
4071  return false;
4072 
4073  pindexNewTip = chainActive.Tip();
4074  fInitialDownload = IsInitialBlockDownload();
4075  break;
4076  }
4077  // When we reach this point, we switched to a new tip (stored in pindexNewTip).
4078 
4079  // Notifications/callbacks that can run without cs_main
4080  if (!fInitialDownload) {
4081  uint256 hashNewTip = pindexNewTip->GetBlockHash();
4082  // Relay inventory, but don't relay old inventory during initial block download.
4083  int nBlockEstimate = Checkpoints::GetTotalBlocksEstimate();
4084  {
4085  LOCK(cs_vNodes);
4086  BOOST_FOREACH (CNode* pnode, vNodes)
4087  if (chainActive.Height() > (pnode->nStartingHeight != -1 ? pnode->nStartingHeight - 2000 : nBlockEstimate))
4088  pnode->PushInventory(CInv(MSG_BLOCK, hashNewTip));
4089  }
4090  // Notify external listeners about the new tip.
4091  uiInterface.NotifyBlockTip(hashNewTip);
4092  }
4093  } while (pindexMostWork != chainActive.Tip());
4094  CheckBlockIndex();
4095 
4096  // Write changes periodically to disk, after relay.
4097  if (!FlushStateToDisk(state, FLUSH_STATE_PERIODIC)) {
4098  return false;
4099  }
4100 
4101  return true;
4102 }
4103 
4104 bool InvalidateBlock(CValidationState& state, CBlockIndex* pindex)
4105 {
4106  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
4107 
4108  // Mark the block itself as invalid.
4109  pindex->nStatus |= BLOCK_FAILED_VALID;
4110  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindex);
4111  setBlockIndexCandidates.erase(pindex);
4112 
4113  while (chainActive.Contains(pindex)) {
4114  CBlockIndex* pindexWalk = chainActive.Tip();
4115  pindexWalk->nStatus |= BLOCK_FAILED_CHILD;
4116  setDirtyBlockIndex.insert(pindexWalk);
4117  setBlockIndexCandidates.erase(pindexWalk);
4118  // ActivateBestChain considers blocks already in chainActive
4119  // unconditionally valid already, so force disconnect away from it.
4120  if (!DisconnectTip(state)) {
4121  return false;
4122  }
4123  }
4124 
4125  // The resulting new best tip may not be in setBlockIndexCandidates anymore, so
4126  // add them again.
4127  BlockMap::iterator it = mapBlockIndex.begin();
4128  while (it != mapBlockIndex.end()) {
4129  if (it->second->IsValid(BLOCK_VALID_TRANSACTIONS) && it->second->nChainTx && !setBlockIndexCandidates.value_comp()(it->second, chainActive.Tip())) {
4130  setBlockIndexCandidates.insert(it->second);
4131  }
4132  it++;
4133  }
4134 
4135  InvalidChainFound(pindex);
4136  return true;
4137 }
4138 
4139 bool ReconsiderBlock(CValidationState& state, CBlockIndex* pindex)
4140 {
4141  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
4142 
4143  int nHeight = pindex->nHeight;
4144 
4145  // Remove the invalidity flag from this block and all its descendants.
4146  BlockMap::iterator it = mapBlockIndex.begin();
4147  while (it != mapBlockIndex.end()) {
