6099  else if (pfrom->nVersion == 0) {
6100  // Must have a version message before anything else
6101  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 1);
6102  return false;
6103  }
6104 
6105 
6106  else if (strCommand == "verack") {
6107  pfrom->SetRecvVersion(min(pfrom->nVersion, PROTOCOL_VERSION));
6108 
6109  // Mark this node as currently connected, so we update its timestamp later.
6110  if (pfrom->fNetworkNode) {
6111  LOCK(cs_main);
6112  State(pfrom->GetId())->fCurrentlyConnected = true;
6113  }
6114  }
6115 
6116 
6117  else if (strCommand == "addr") {
6118  vector<CAddress> vAddr;
6119  vRecv >> vAddr;
6120 
6121  // Don't want addr from older versions unless seeding
6122  if (pfrom->nVersion < CADDR_TIME_VERSION && addrman.size() > 1000)
6123  return true;
6124  if (vAddr.size() > 1000) {
6125  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 20);
6126  return error("message addr size() = %u", vAddr.size());
6127  }
6128 
6129  // Store the new addresses
6130  vector<CAddress> vAddrOk;
6131  int64_t nNow = GetAdjustedTime();
6132  int64_t nSince = nNow - 10 * 60;
6133  BOOST_FOREACH (CAddress& addr, vAddr) {
6134  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
6135 
6136  if (addr.nTime <= 100000000 || addr.nTime > nNow + 10 * 60)
6137  addr.nTime = nNow - 5 * 24 * 60 * 60;
6138  pfrom->AddAddressKnown(addr);
6139  bool fReachable = IsReachable(addr);
6140  if (addr.nTime > nSince && !pfrom->fGetAddr && vAddr.size() <= 10 && addr.IsRoutable()) {
6141  // Relay to a limited number of other nodes
6142  {
6143  LOCK(cs_vNodes);
6144  // Use deterministic randomness to send to the same nodes for 24 hours
6145  // at a time so the setAddrKnowns of the chosen nodes prevent repeats
6146  static uint256 hashSalt;
6147  if (hashSalt == 0)
6148  hashSalt = GetRandHash();
6149  uint64_t hashAddr = addr.GetHash();
6150  uint256 hashRand = hashSalt ^ (hashAddr << 32) ^ ((GetTime() + hashAddr) / (24 * 60 * 60));
6151  hashRand = Hash(BEGIN(hashRand), END(hashRand));
6152  multimap<uint256, CNode*> mapMix;
6153  BOOST_FOREACH (CNode* pnode, vNodes) {
6154  if (pnode->nVersion < CADDR_TIME_VERSION)
6155  continue;
6156  unsigned int nPointer;
6157  memcpy(&nPointer, &pnode, sizeof(nPointer));
6158  uint256 hashKey = hashRand ^ nPointer;
6159  hashKey = Hash(BEGIN(hashKey), END(hashKey));
6160  mapMix.insert(make_pair(hashKey, pnode));
6161  }
6162  int nRelayNodes = fReachable ? 2 : 1; // limited relaying of addresses outside our network(s)
6163  for (multimap<uint256, CNode*>::iterator mi = mapMix.begin(); mi != mapMix.end() && nRelayNodes-- > 0; ++mi)
6164  ((*mi).second)->PushAddress(addr);
6165  }
6166  }
6167  // Do not store addresses outside our network
6168  if (fReachable)
6169  vAddrOk.push_back(addr);
6170  }
6171  addrman.Add(vAddrOk, pfrom->addr, 2 * 60 * 60);
6172  if (vAddr.size() < 1000)
6173  pfrom->fGetAddr = false;
6174  if (pfrom->fOneShot)
6175  pfrom->fDisconnect = true;
6176  }
6177 
6178 
6179  else if (strCommand == "inv") {
6180  vector<CInv> vInv;
6181  vRecv >> vInv;
6182  if (vInv.size() > MAX_INV_SZ) {
6183  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 20);
6184  return error("message inv size() = %u", vInv.size());
6185  }
6186 
6187  LOCK(cs_main);
6188 
6189  std::vector<CInv> vToFetch;
6190 
6191  for (unsigned int nInv = 0; nInv < vInv.size(); nInv++) {
6192  const CInv& inv = vInv[nInv];
6193 
6194  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
6195  pfrom->AddInventoryKnown(inv);
6196 
6197  bool fAlreadyHave = AlreadyHave(inv);
6198  LogPrint("net", "got inv: %s %s peer=%d\n", inv.ToString(), fAlreadyHave ? "have" : "new", pfrom->id);
6199 
6200  if (!fAlreadyHave && !fImporting && !fReindex && inv.type != MSG_BLOCK)
6201  pfrom->AskFor(inv);
6202 
6203 
6204  if (inv.type == MSG_BLOCK) {
6205  UpdateBlockAvailability(pfrom->GetId(), inv.hash);
6206  if (!fAlreadyHave && !fImporting && !fReindex && !mapBlocksInFlight.count(inv.hash)) {
6207  // Add this to the list of blocks to request
6208  vToFetch.push_back(inv);
6209  LogPrint("net", "getblocks (%d) %s to peer=%d\n", pindexBestHeader->nHeight, inv.hash.ToString(), pfrom->id);
6210  }
6211  }
6212 
6213  // Track requests for our stuff
6214  g_signals.Inventory(inv.hash);
6215 
6216  if (pfrom->nSendSize > (SendBufferSize() * 2)) {
6217  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 50);
6218  return error("send buffer size() = %u", pfrom->nSendSize);
6219  }
6220  }
6221 
6222  if (!vToFetch.empty())
6223  pfrom->PushMessage("getdata", vToFetch);
6224  }
6225 
6226 
6227  else if (strCommand == "getdata") {
6228  vector<CInv> vInv;
6229  vRecv >> vInv;
6230  if (vInv.size() > MAX_INV_SZ) {
6231  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 20);
6232  return error("message getdata size() = %u", vInv.size());
6233  }
6234 
6235  if (fDebug || (vInv.size() != 1))
6236  LogPrint("net", "received getdata (%u invsz) peer=%d\n", vInv.size(), pfrom->id);
6237 
6238  if ((fDebug && vInv.size() > 0) || (vInv.size() == 1))
6239  LogPrint("net", "received getdata for: %s peer=%d\n", vInv[0].ToString(), pfrom->id);
6240 
6241  pfrom->vRecvGetData.insert(pfrom->vRecvGetData.end(), vInv.begin(), vInv.end());
6242  ProcessGetData(pfrom);
6243  }
6244 
6245 
6246  else if (strCommand == "getblocks" || strCommand == "getheaders") {
6247  CBlockLocator locator;
6248  uint256 hashStop;
6249  vRecv >> locator >> hashStop;
6250 
6251  LOCK(cs_main);
6252 
6253  // Find the last block the caller has in the main chain
6254  CBlockIndex* pindex = FindForkInGlobalIndex(chainActive, locator);
6255 
6256  // Send the rest of the chain
6257  if (pindex)
6258  pindex = chainActive.Next(pindex);
6259  int nLimit = 500;
6260  LogPrint("net", "getblocks %d to %s limit %d from peer=%d\n", (pindex ? pindex->nHeight : -1), hashStop == uint256(0) ? "end" : hashStop.ToString(), nLimit, pfrom->id);
6261  for (; pindex; pindex = chainActive.Next(pindex)) {
6262  if (pindex->GetBlockHash() == hashStop) {
6263  LogPrint("net", " getblocks stopping at %d %s\n", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString());
6264  break;
6265  }
6266  pfrom->PushInventory(CInv(MSG_BLOCK, pindex->GetBlockHash()));
6267  if (--nLimit <= 0) {
6268  // When this block is requested, we'll send an inv that'll make them
6269  // getblocks the next batch of inventory.
6270  LogPrint("net", " getblocks stopping at limit %d %s\n", pindex->nHeight, pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString());
6271  pfrom->hashContinue = pindex->GetBlockHash();
6272  break;
6273  }
6274  }
6275  }
6276 
6277 
6278  else if (strCommand == "headers" && Params().HeadersFirstSyncingActive()) {
6279  CBlockLocator locator;
6280  uint256 hashStop;
6281  vRecv >> locator >> hashStop;
6282 
6283  LOCK(cs_main);
6284 
6285  if (IsInitialBlockDownload())
6286  return true;
6287 
6288  CBlockIndex* pindex = NULL;
6289  if (locator.IsNull()) {
6290  // If locator is null, return the hashStop block
6291  BlockMap::iterator mi = mapBlockIndex.find(hashStop);
6292  if (mi == mapBlockIndex.end())
6293  return true;
6294  pindex = (*mi).second;
6295  } else {
6296  // Find the last block the caller has in the main chain
6297  pindex = FindForkInGlobalIndex(chainActive, locator);
6298  if (pindex)
6299  pindex = chainActive.Next(pindex);
6300  }
6301 
6302  // we must use CBlocks, as CBlockHeaders won't include the 0x00 nTx count at the end
6303  vector<CBlock> vHeaders;
6304  int nLimit = MAX_HEADERS_RESULTS;
6305  if (fDebug)
6306  LogPrintf("getheaders %d to %s from peer=%d\n", (pindex ? pindex->nHeight : -1), hashStop.ToString(), pfrom->id);
6307  for (; pindex; pindex = chainActive.Next(pindex)) {
6308  vHeaders.push_back(pindex->GetBlockHeader());
6309  if (--nLimit <= 0 || pindex->GetBlockHash() == hashStop)
6310  break;
6311  }
6312  pfrom->PushMessage("headers", vHeaders);
6313  }
6314 
6315 
6316  else if (strCommand == "tx" || strCommand == "dstx") {
6317  vector<uint256> vWorkQueue;
6318  vector<uint256> vEraseQueue;
6319  CTransaction tx;
6320 
6321  //masternode signed transaction
6322  bool ignoreFees = false;
6323  CTxIn vin;
6324  vector<unsigned char> vchSig;
6325  int64_t sigTime;
6326 
6327  if (strCommand == "tx") {
6328  vRecv >> tx;
6329  } else if (strCommand == "dstx") {
6330  //these allow masternodes to publish a limited amount of free transactions
6331  vRecv >> tx >> vin >> vchSig >> sigTime;
6332 
6333  CMasternode* pmn = mnodeman.Find(vin);
6334  if (pmn != NULL) {
6335  if (!pmn->allowFreeTx) {
6336  //multiple peers can send us a valid masternode transaction
6337  if (fDebug) LogPrintf("dstx: Masternode sending too many transactions %s\n", tx.GetHash().ToString());
6338  return true;
6339  }
6340 
6341  std::string strMessage = tx.GetHash().ToString() + boost::lexical_cast<std::string>(sigTime);
6342 
6343  std::string errorMessage = "";
6344  if (!obfuScationSigner.VerifyMessage(pmn->pubKeyMasternode, vchSig, strMessage, errorMessage)) {
6345  LogPrintf("dstx: Got bad masternode address signature %s \n", vin.ToString());
6346  //pfrom->Misbehaving(20);
6347  return false;
6348  }
6349 
6350  LogPrintf("dstx: Got Masternode transaction %s\n", tx.GetHash().ToString());
6351 
6352  ignoreFees = true;
6353  pmn->allowFreeTx = false;
6354 
6355  if (!mapObfuscationBroadcastTxes.count(tx.GetHash())) {
6356  CObfuscationBroadcastTx dstx;
6357  dstx.tx = tx;
6358  dstx.vin = vin;
6359  dstx.vchSig = vchSig;
6360  dstx.sigTime = sigTime;
6361 
6362  mapObfuscationBroadcastTxes.insert(make_pair(tx.GetHash(), dstx));
6363  }
6364  }
6365  }
6366 
6367  CInv inv(MSG_TX, tx.GetHash());
6368  pfrom->AddInventoryKnown(inv);
6369 
6370  LOCK(cs_main);
6371 
6372  bool fMissingInputs = false;
6373  bool fMissingZerocoinInputs = false;
6374  CValidationState state;
6375 
6376  mapAlreadyAskedFor.erase(inv);
6377 
6378  if (!tx.IsZerocoinSpend() && AcceptToMemoryPool(mempool, state, tx, true, &fMissingInputs, false, ignoreFees)) {
6379  mempool.check(pcoinsTip);
6380  RelayTransaction(tx);
6381  vWorkQueue.push_back(inv.hash);
6382 
6383  LogPrint("mempool", "AcceptToMemoryPool: peer=%d %s : accepted %s (poolsz %u)\n",
6384  pfrom->id, pfrom->cleanSubVer,
6385  tx.GetHash().ToString(),
6386  mempool.mapTx.size());
6387 
6388  // Recursively process any orphan transactions that depended on this one
6389  set<NodeId> setMisbehaving;
6390  for(unsigned int i = 0; i < vWorkQueue.size(); i++) {
6391  map<uint256, set<uint256> >::iterator itByPrev = mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev.find(vWorkQueue[i]);
6392  if(itByPrev == mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev.end())
6393  continue;
6394  for(set<uint256>::iterator mi = itByPrev->second.begin();
6395  mi != itByPrev->second.end();
6396  ++mi) {
6397  const uint256 &orphanHash = *mi;
6398  const CTransaction &orphanTx = mapOrphanTransactions[orphanHash].tx;
6399  NodeId fromPeer = mapOrphanTransactions[orphanHash].fromPeer;
6400  bool fMissingInputs2 = false;
6401  // Use a dummy CValidationState so someone can't setup nodes to counter-DoS based on orphan
6402  // resolution (that is, feeding people an invalid transaction based on LegitTxX in order to get
6403  // anyone relaying LegitTxX banned)
6404  CValidationState stateDummy;
6405 
6406 
6407  if(setMisbehaving.count(fromPeer))
6408  continue;
6409  if(AcceptToMemoryPool(mempool, stateDummy, orphanTx, true, &fMissingInputs2)) {
6410  LogPrint("mempool", " accepted orphan tx %s\n", orphanHash.ToString());
6411  RelayTransaction(orphanTx);
6412  vWorkQueue.push_back(orphanHash);
6413  vEraseQueue.push_back(orphanHash);
6414  } else if(!fMissingInputs2) {
6415  int nDos = 0;
6416  if(stateDummy.IsInvalid(nDos) && nDos > 0) {
6417  // Punish peer that gave us an invalid orphan tx
6418  Misbehaving(fromPeer, nDos);
6419  setMisbehaving.insert(fromPeer);
6420  LogPrint("mempool", " invalid orphan tx %s\n", orphanHash.ToString());
6421  }
6422  // Has inputs but not accepted to mempool
6423  // Probably non-standard or insufficient fee/priority
6424  LogPrint("mempool", " removed orphan tx %s\n", orphanHash.ToString());
6425  vEraseQueue.push_back(orphanHash);
6426  }
6427  mempool.check(pcoinsTip);
6428  }
6429  }
6430 
6431  BOOST_FOREACH (uint256 hash, vEraseQueue)EraseOrphanTx(hash);
6432  } else if (tx.IsZerocoinSpend() && AcceptToMemoryPool(mempool, state, tx, true, &fMissingZerocoinInputs, false, ignoreFees)) {
6433  //Presstab: ZCoin has a bunch of code commented out here. Is this something that should have more going on?
6434  //Also there is nothing that handles fMissingZerocoinInputs. Does there need to be?
6435  RelayTransaction(tx);
6436  LogPrint("mempool", "AcceptToMemoryPool: Zerocoinspend peer=%d %s : accepted %s (poolsz %u)\n",
6437  pfrom->id, pfrom->cleanSubVer,
6438  tx.GetHash().ToString(),
6439  mempool.mapTx.size());
6440  } else if (fMissingInputs) {
6441  AddOrphanTx(tx, pfrom->GetId());
6442 
6443  // DoS prevention: do not allow mapOrphanTransactions to grow unbounded
6444  unsigned int nMaxOrphanTx = (unsigned int)std::max((int64_t)0, GetArg("-maxorphantx", DEFAULT_MAX_ORPHAN_TRANSACTIONS));
6445  unsigned int nEvicted = LimitOrphanTxSize(nMaxOrphanTx);
6446  if (nEvicted > 0)
6447  LogPrint("mempool", "mapOrphan overflow, removed %u tx\n", nEvicted);
6448  } else if (pfrom->fWhitelisted) {
6449  // Always relay transactions received from whitelisted peers, even
6450  // if they are already in the mempool (allowing the node to function
6451  // as a gateway for nodes hidden behind it).
6452 
6453  RelayTransaction(tx);
6454  }
6455 
6456  if (strCommand == "dstx") {
6457  CInv inv(MSG_DSTX, tx.GetHash());
6458  RelayInv(inv);
6459  }
6460 
6461  int nDoS = 0;
6462  if (state.IsInvalid(nDoS)) {
6463  LogPrint("mempool", "%s from peer=%d %s was not accepted into the memory pool: %s\n", tx.GetHash().ToString(),
6464  pfrom->id, pfrom->cleanSubVer,
6465  state.GetRejectReason());
6466  pfrom->PushMessage("reject", strCommand, state.GetRejectCode(),
6467  state.GetRejectReason().substr(0, MAX_REJECT_MESSAGE_LENGTH), inv.hash);
6468  if (nDoS > 0)
6469  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), nDoS);
6470  }
6471  }
6472 
6473 
6474  else if (strCommand == "headers" && Params().HeadersFirstSyncingActive() && !fImporting && !fReindex) // Ignore headers received while importing
6475  {
6476  std::vector<CBlockHeader> headers;
6477 
6478  // Bypass the normal CBlock deserialization, as we don't want to risk deserializing 2000 full blocks.
6479  unsigned int nCount = ReadCompactSize(vRecv);
6480  if (nCount > MAX_HEADERS_RESULTS) {
6481  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 20);
6482  return error("headers message size = %u", nCount);
6483  }
6484  headers.resize(nCount);
6485  for (unsigned int n = 0; n < nCount; n++) {
6486  vRecv >> headers[n];
6487  ReadCompactSize(vRecv); // ignore tx count; assume it is 0.
6488  }
6489 
6490  LOCK(cs_main);
6491 
6492  if (nCount == 0) {
6493  // Nothing interesting. Stop asking this peers for more headers.
6494  return true;
6495  }
6496  CBlockIndex* pindexLast = NULL;
6497  BOOST_FOREACH (const CBlockHeader& header, headers) {
6498  CValidationState state;
6499  if (pindexLast != NULL && header.hashPrevBlock != pindexLast->GetBlockHash()) {
6500  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 20);
6501  return error("non-continuous headers sequence");
6502  }
6503 
6504  /*TODO: this has a CBlock cast on it so that it will compile. There should be a solution for this
6505  * before headers are reimplemented on mainnet
6506  */
6507  if (!AcceptBlockHeader((CBlock)header, state, &pindexLast)) {
6508  int nDoS;
6509  if (state.IsInvalid(nDoS)) {
6510  if (nDoS > 0)
6511  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), nDoS);
6512  std::string strError = "invalid header received " + header.GetHash().ToString();
6513  return error(strError.c_str());
6514  }
6515  }
6516  }
6517 
6518  if (pindexLast)
6519  UpdateBlockAvailability(pfrom->GetId(), pindexLast->GetBlockHash());
6520 
6521  if (nCount == MAX_HEADERS_RESULTS && pindexLast) {
6522  // Headers message had its maximum size; the peer may have more headers.
6523  // TODO: optimize: if pindexLast is an ancestor of chainActive.Tip or pindexBestHeader, continue
6524  // from there instead.
6525  LogPrintf("more getheaders (%d) to end to peer=%d (startheight:%d)\n", pindexLast->nHeight, pfrom->id, pfrom->nStartingHeight);
6526  pfrom->PushMessage("getheaders", chainActive.GetLocator(pindexLast), uint256(0));
6527  }
6528 
6529  CheckBlockIndex();
6530  }
6531 
6532  else if (strCommand == "block" && !fImporting && !fReindex) // Ignore blocks received while importing
6533  {
6534  CBlock block;
6535  vRecv >> block;
6536  uint256 hashBlock = block.GetHash();
6537  CInv inv(MSG_BLOCK, hashBlock);
6538  LogPrint("net", "received block %s peer=%d\n", inv.hash.ToString(), pfrom->id);
6539 
6540  //sometimes we will be sent their most recent block and its not the one we want, in that case tell where we are
6541  if (!mapBlockIndex.count(block.hashPrevBlock)) {
6542  if (find(pfrom->vBlockRequested.begin(), pfrom->vBlockRequested.end(), hashBlock) != pfrom->vBlockRequested.end()) {
6543  //we already asked for this block, so lets work backwards and ask for the previous block
6544  pfrom->PushMessage("getblocks", chainActive.GetLocator(), block.hashPrevBlock);
6545  pfrom->vBlockRequested.push_back(block.hashPrevBlock);
6546  } else {
6547  //ask to sync to this block
6548  pfrom->PushMessage("getblocks", chainActive.GetLocator(), hashBlock);
6549  pfrom->vBlockRequested.push_back(hashBlock);
6550  }
6551  } else {
6552  pfrom->AddInventoryKnown(inv);
6553 
6554  CValidationState state;
6555  if (!mapBlockIndex.count(block.GetHash())) {
6556  ProcessNewBlock(state, pfrom, &block);
6557  int nDoS;
6558  if(state.IsInvalid(nDoS)) {
6559  pfrom->PushMessage("reject", strCommand, state.GetRejectCode(),
6560  state.GetRejectReason().substr(0, MAX_REJECT_MESSAGE_LENGTH), inv.hash);
6561  if(nDoS > 0) {
6562  TRY_LOCK(cs_main, lockMain);
6563  if(lockMain) Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), nDoS);
6564  }
6565  }
6566  //disconnect this node if its old protocol version
6567  pfrom->DisconnectOldProtocol(ActiveProtocol(), strCommand);
6568  } else {
6569  LogPrint("net", "%s : Already processed block %s, skipping ProcessNewBlock()\n", __func__, block.GetHash().GetHex());
6570  }
6571  }
6572  }
6573 
6574 
6575  // This asymmetric behavior for inbound and outbound connections was introduced
6576  // to prevent a fingerprinting attack: an attacker can send specific fake addresses
6577  // to users' AddrMan and later request them by sending getaddr messages.
6578  // Making users (which are behind NAT and can only make outgoing connections) ignore
6579  // getaddr message mitigates the attack.
6580  else if ((strCommand == "getaddr") && (pfrom->fInbound)) {
6581  pfrom->vAddrToSend.clear();
6582  vector<CAddress> vAddr = addrman.GetAddr();
6583  BOOST_FOREACH (const CAddress& addr, vAddr)
6584  pfrom->PushAddress(addr);
6585  }
6586 
6587 
6588  else if (strCommand == "mempool") {
6589  LOCK2(cs_main, pfrom->cs_filter);
6590 
6591  std::vector<uint256> vtxid;
6592  mempool.queryHashes(vtxid);
6593  vector<CInv> vInv;
6594  BOOST_FOREACH (uint256& hash, vtxid) {
6595  CInv inv(MSG_TX, hash);
6596  CTransaction tx;
6597  bool fInMemPool = mempool.lookup(hash, tx);
6598  if (!fInMemPool) continue; // another thread removed since queryHashes, maybe...
6599  if ((pfrom->pfilter && pfrom->pfilter->IsRelevantAndUpdate(tx)) ||
6600  (!pfrom->pfilter))
6601  vInv.push_back(inv);
6602  if (vInv.size() == MAX_INV_SZ) {
6603  pfrom->PushMessage("inv", vInv);
6604  vInv.clear();
6605  }
6606  }
6607  if (vInv.size() > 0)
6608  pfrom->PushMessage("inv", vInv);
6609  }
6610 
6611 
6612  else if (strCommand == "ping") {
6613  if (pfrom->nVersion > BIP0031_VERSION) {
6614  uint64_t nonce = 0;
6615  vRecv >> nonce;
6616  // Echo the message back with the nonce. This allows for two useful features:
6617  //
6618  // 1) A remote node can quickly check if the connection is operational
6619  // 2) Remote nodes can measure the latency of the network thread. If this node
6620  // is overloaded it won't respond to pings quickly and the remote node can
6621  // avoid sending us more work, like chain download requests.
6622  //
6623  // The nonce stops the remote getting confused between different pings: without
6624  // it, if the remote node sends a ping once per second and this node takes 5
6625  // seconds to respond to each, the 5th ping the remote sends would appear to
6626  // return very quickly.
6627  pfrom->PushMessage("pong", nonce);
6628  }
6629  }
6630 
6631 
6632  else if (strCommand == "pong") {
6633  int64_t pingUsecEnd = nTimeReceived;
6634  uint64_t nonce = 0;
6635  size_t nAvail = vRecv.in_avail();
6636  bool bPingFinished = false;
6637  std::string sProblem;
6638 
6639  if (nAvail >= sizeof(nonce)) {
6640  vRecv >> nonce;
6641 
6642  // Only process pong message if there is an outstanding ping (old ping without nonce should never pong)
6643  if (pfrom->nPingNonceSent != 0) {
6644  if (nonce == pfrom->nPingNonceSent) {
6645  // Matching pong received, this ping is no longer outstanding
6646  bPingFinished = true;
6647  int64_t pingUsecTime = pingUsecEnd - pfrom->nPingUsecStart;
6648  if (pingUsecTime > 0) {
6649  // Successful ping time measurement, replace previous
6650  pfrom->nPingUsecTime = pingUsecTime;
6651  } else {
6652  // This should never happen
6653  sProblem = "Timing mishap";
6654  }
6655  } else {
6656  // Nonce mismatches are normal when pings are overlapping
6657  sProblem = "Nonce mismatch";
6658  if (nonce == 0) {
6659  // This is most likely a bug in another implementation somewhere, cancel this ping
6660  bPingFinished = true;
6661  sProblem = "Nonce zero";
6662  }
6663  }
6664  } else {
6665  sProblem = "Unsolicited pong without ping";
6666  }
6667  } else {
6668  // This is most likely a bug in another implementation somewhere, cancel this ping
6669  bPingFinished = true;
6670  sProblem = "Short payload";
6671  }
6672 
6673  if (!(sProblem.empty())) {
6674  LogPrint("net", "pong peer=%d %s: %s, %x expected, %x received, %u bytes\n",
6675  pfrom->id,
6676  pfrom->cleanSubVer,
6677  sProblem,
6678  pfrom->nPingNonceSent,
6679  nonce,
6680  nAvail);
6681  }
6682  if (bPingFinished) {
6683  pfrom->nPingNonceSent = 0;
6684  }
6685  }
6686 
6687 
6688  else if (fAlerts && strCommand == "alert") {
6689  CAlert alert;
6690  vRecv >> alert;
6691 
6692  uint256 alertHash = alert.GetHash();
6693  if (pfrom->setKnown.count(alertHash) == 0) {
6694  if (alert.ProcessAlert()) {
6695  // Relay
6696  pfrom->setKnown.insert(alertHash);
6697  {
6698  LOCK(cs_vNodes);
6699  BOOST_FOREACH (CNode* pnode, vNodes)
6700  alert.RelayTo(pnode);
6701  }
6702  } else {
6703  // Small DoS penalty so peers that send us lots of
6704  // duplicate/expired/invalid-signature/whatever alerts
6705  // eventually get banned.
6706  // This isn't a Misbehaving(100) (immediate ban) because the
6707  // peer might be an older or different implementation with
6708  // a different signature key, etc.
6709  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 10);
6710  }
6711  }
6712  }
6713 
6714  else if (!(nLocalServices & NODE_BLOOM) &&
6715  (strCommand == "filterload" ||
6716  strCommand == "filteradd" ||
6717  strCommand == "filterclear")) {
6718  LogPrintf("bloom message=%s\n", strCommand);
6719  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 100);
6720  }
6721 
6722  else if (strCommand == "filterload") {
6723  CBloomFilter filter;
6724  vRecv >> filter;
6725 
6726  if (!filter.IsWithinSizeConstraints())
6727  // There is no excuse for sending a too-large filter
6728  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 100);
6729  else {
6730  LOCK(pfrom->cs_filter);
6731  delete pfrom->pfilter;
6732  pfrom->pfilter = new CBloomFilter(filter);
6733  pfrom->pfilter->UpdateEmptyFull();
6734  }
6735  pfrom->fRelayTxes = true;
6736  }
6737 
6738 
6739  else if (strCommand == "filteradd") {
6740  vector<unsigned char> vData;
6741  vRecv >> vData;
6742 
6743  // Nodes must NEVER send a data item > 520 bytes (the max size for a script data object,
6744  // and thus, the maximum size any matched object can have) in a filteradd message
6745  if (vData.size() > MAX_SCRIPT_ELEMENT_SIZE) {
6746  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 100);
6747  } else {
6748  LOCK(pfrom->cs_filter);
6749  if (pfrom->pfilter)
6750  pfrom->pfilter->insert(vData);
6751  else
6752  Misbehaving(pfrom->GetId(), 100);
6753  }
6754  }
6755 
6756 
6757  else if (strCommand == "filterclear") {
6758  LOCK(pfrom->cs_filter);
6759  delete pfrom->pfilter;
6760  pfrom->pfilter = new CBloomFilter();
6761  pfrom->fRelayTxes = true;
6762  }
6763 
6764 
6765  else if (strCommand == "reject") {
6766  if (fDebug) {
6767  try {
6768  string strMsg;
6769  unsigned char ccode;
6770  string strReason;
6771  vRecv >> LIMITED_STRING(strMsg, CMessageHeader::COMMAND_SIZE) >> ccode >> LIMITED_STRING(strReason, MAX_REJECT_MESSAGE_LENGTH);
6772 
6773  ostringstream ss;
6774  ss << strMsg << " code " << itostr(ccode) << ": " << strReason;
6775 
6776  if (strMsg == "block" || strMsg == "tx") {
6777  uint256 hash;
6778  vRecv >> hash;
6779  ss << ": hash " << hash.ToString();
6780  }
6781  LogPrint("net", "Reject %s\n", SanitizeString(ss.str()));
6782  } catch (std::ios_base::failure& e) {
6783  // Avoid feedback loops by preventing reject messages from triggering a new reject message.
6784  LogPrint("net", "Unparseable reject message received\n");
6785  }
6786  }
6787  } else {
6788  //probably one the extensions
6789  obfuScationPool.ProcessMessageObfuscation(pfrom, strCommand, vRecv);
6790  mnodeman.ProcessMessage(pfrom, strCommand, vRecv);
6791  budget.ProcessMessage(pfrom, strCommand, vRecv);
6792  masternodePayments.ProcessMessageMasternodePayments(pfrom, strCommand, vRecv);
6793  ProcessMessageSwiftTX(pfrom, strCommand, vRecv);
6794  ProcessSpork(pfrom, strCommand, vRecv);
6795  masternodeSync.ProcessMessage(pfrom, strCommand, vRecv);
6796  }
6797 
6798 
6799  return true;
6800 }
6801 
6802 // Note: whenever a protocol update is needed toggle between both implementations (comment out the formerly active one)
6803 // so we can leave the existing clients untouched (old SPORK will stay on so they don't see even older clients).
6804 // Those old clients won't react to the changes of the other (new) SPORK because at the time of their implementation
6805 // it was the one which was commented out
6806 int ActiveProtocol()
6807 {
6808 
6809  // SPORK_14 was used for 70910. Leave it 'ON' so they don't see > 70910 nodes. They won't react to SPORK_15
6810  // messages because it's not in their code
6811 
6812 /* if (IsSporkActive(SPORK_14_NEW_PROTOCOL_ENFORCEMENT))
6813  return MIN_PEER_PROTO_VERSION_AFTER_ENFORCEMENT;
6814 */
6815 
6816  // SPORK_15 is used for 70911. Nodes < 70911 don't see it and still get their protocol version via SPORK_14 and their
6817  // own ModifierUpgradeBlock()
6818 
6819  if (IsSporkActive(SPORK_15_NEW_PROTOCOL_ENFORCEMENT_2))
6820  return MIN_PEER_PROTO_VERSION_AFTER_ENFORCEMENT;
6821  return MIN_PEER_PROTO_VERSION_BEFORE_ENFORCEMENT;
6822 }
6823 
6824 // requires LOCK(cs_vRecvMsg)
6825 bool ProcessMessages(CNode* pfrom)
6826 {
6827  //if (fDebug)
6828  // LogPrintf("ProcessMessages(%u messages)\n", pfrom->vRecvMsg.size());
6829 
6830  //
6831  // Message format
6832  // (4) message start
6833  // (12) command
6834  // (4) size
6835  // (4) checksum
6836  // (x) data
6837  //
6838  bool fOk = true;
6839 
6840  if (!pfrom->vRecvGetData.empty())
6841  ProcessGetData(pfrom);
6842 
6843  // this maintains the order of responses
6844  if (!pfrom->vRecvGetData.empty()) return fOk;
6845 
6846  std::deque<CNetMessage>::iterator it = pfrom->vRecvMsg.begin();
6847  while (!pfrom->fDisconnect && it != pfrom->vRecvMsg.end()) {
6848  // Don't bother if send buffer is too full to respond anyway
6849  if (pfrom->nSendSize >= SendBufferSize())
6850  break;
6851 
6852  // get next message
6853  CNetMessage& msg = *it;
6854 
6855  //if (fDebug)
6856  // LogPrintf("ProcessMessages(message %u msgsz, %u bytes, complete:%s)\n",
6857  // msg.hdr.nMessageSize, msg.vRecv.size(),
6858  // msg.complete() ? "Y" : "N");
6859 
6860  // end, if an incomplete message is found
6861  if (!msg.complete())
6862  break;
6863 
6864  // at this point, any failure means we can delete the current message
6865  it++;
6866 
6867  // Scan for message start
6868  if (memcmp(msg.hdr.pchMessageStart, Params().MessageStart(), MESSAGE_START_SIZE) != 0) {
6869  LogPrintf("PROCESSMESSAGE: INVALID MESSAGESTART %s peer=%d\n", SanitizeString(msg.hdr.GetCommand()), pfrom->id);
6870  fOk = false;
6871  break;
6872  }
6873 
6874  // Read header
6875  CMessageHeader& hdr = msg.hdr;
6876  if (!hdr.IsValid()) {
6877  LogPrintf("PROCESSMESSAGE: ERRORS IN HEADER %s peer=%d\n", SanitizeString(hdr.GetCommand()), pfrom->id);
6878  continue;
6879  }
6880  string strCommand = hdr.GetCommand();
6881 
6882  // Message size
6883  unsigned int nMessageSize = hdr.nMessageSize;
6884 
6885  // Checksum
6886  CDataStream& vRecv = msg.vRecv;
6887  uint256 hash = Hash(vRecv.begin(), vRecv.begin() + nMessageSize);
6888  unsigned int nChecksum = 0;
6889  memcpy(&nChecksum, &hash, sizeof(nChecksum));
6890  if (nChecksum != hdr.nChecksum) {
6891  LogPrintf("ProcessMessages(%s, %u bytes): CHECKSUM ERROR nChecksum=%08x hdr.nChecksum=%08x\n",
6892  SanitizeString(strCommand), nMessageSize, nChecksum, hdr.nChecksum);
6893  continue;
6894  }
6895 
6896  // Process message
6897  bool fRet = false;
6898  try {
6899  fRet = ProcessMessage(pfrom, strCommand, vRecv, msg.nTime);
6900  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
6901  } catch (std::ios_base::failure& e) {
6902  pfrom->PushMessage("reject", strCommand, REJECT_MALFORMED, string("error parsing message"));
6903  if (strstr(e.what(), "end of data")) {
6904  // Allow exceptions from under-length message on vRecv
6905  LogPrintf("ProcessMessages(%s, %u bytes): Exception '%s' caught, normally caused by a message being shorter than its stated length\n", SanitizeString(strCommand), nMessageSize, e.what());
6906  } else if (strstr(e.what(), "size too large")) {
6907  // Allow exceptions from over-long size
6908  LogPrintf("ProcessMessages(%s, %u bytes): Exception '%s' caught\n", SanitizeString(strCommand), nMessageSize, e.what());
6909  } else {
6910  PrintExceptionContinue(&e, "ProcessMessages()");
6911  }
6912  } catch (boost::thread_interrupted) {
6913  throw;
6914  } catch (std::exception& e) {
6915  PrintExceptionContinue(&e, "ProcessMessages()");
6916  } catch (...) {
6917  PrintExceptionContinue(NULL, "ProcessMessages()");
6918  }
6919 
6920  if (!fRet)
6921  LogPrintf("ProcessMessage(%s, %u bytes) FAILED peer=%d\n", SanitizeString(strCommand), nMessageSize, pfrom->id);
6922 
6923  break;
6924  }
6925 
6926  // In case the connection got shut down, its receive buffer was wiped
6927  if (!pfrom->fDisconnect)
6928  pfrom->vRecvMsg.erase(pfrom->vRecvMsg.begin(), it);
6929 
6930  return fOk;
6931 }
6932 
6933 
6934 bool SendMessages(CNode* pto, bool fSendTrickle)
6935 {
6936  {
6937  // Don't send anything until we get their version message
6938  if (pto->nVersion == 0)
6939  return true;
6940 
6941  //
6942  // Message: ping
6943  //
6944  bool pingSend = false;
6945  if (pto->fPingQueued) {
6946  // RPC ping request by user
6947  pingSend = true;
6948  }
6949  if (pto->nPingNonceSent == 0 && pto->nPingUsecStart + PING_INTERVAL * 1000000 < GetTimeMicros()) {
6950  // Ping automatically sent as a latency probe & keepalive.
6951  pingSend = true;
6952  }
6953  if (pingSend) {
6954  uint64_t nonce = 0;
6955  while (nonce == 0) {
6956  GetRandBytes((unsigned char*)&nonce, sizeof(nonce));
6957  }
6958  pto->fPingQueued = false;
6959  pto->nPingUsecStart = GetTimeMicros();
6960  if (pto->nVersion > BIP0031_VERSION) {
6961  pto->nPingNonceSent = nonce;
6962  pto->PushMessage("ping", nonce);
6963  } else {
6964  // Peer is too old to support ping command with nonce, pong will never arrive.
6965  pto->nPingNonceSent = 0;
6966  pto->PushMessage("ping");
6967  }
6968  }
6969 
6970  TRY_LOCK(cs_main, lockMain); // Acquire cs_main for IsInitialBlockDownload() and CNodeState()
6971  if (!lockMain)
6972  return true;
6973 
6974  // Address refresh broadcast
6975  static int64_t nLastRebroadcast;
6976  if (!IsInitialBlockDownload() && (GetTime() - nLastRebroadcast > 24 * 60 * 60)) {
6977  LOCK(cs_vNodes);
6978  BOOST_FOREACH (CNode* pnode, vNodes) {
6979  // Periodically clear setAddrKnown to allow refresh broadcasts
6980  if (nLastRebroadcast)
6981  pnode->setAddrKnown.clear();
6982 
6983  // Rebroadcast our address
6984  AdvertizeLocal(pnode);
6985  }
6986  if (!vNodes.empty())
6987  nLastRebroadcast = GetTime();
6988  }
6989 
6990  //
6991  // Message: addr
6992  //
6993  if (fSendTrickle) {
6994  vector<CAddress> vAddr;
6995  vAddr.reserve(pto->vAddrToSend.size());
6996  BOOST_FOREACH (const CAddress& addr, pto->vAddrToSend) {
6997  // returns true if wasn't already contained in the set
6998  if (pto->setAddrKnown.insert(addr).second) {
6999  vAddr.push_back(addr);
7000  // receiver rejects addr messages larger than 1000
7001  if (vAddr.size() >= 1000) {
7002  pto->PushMessage("addr", vAddr);
7003  vAddr.clear();
7004  }
7005  }
7006  }
7007  pto->vAddrToSend.clear();
7008  if (!vAddr.empty())
7009  pto->PushMessage("addr", vAddr);
7010  }
7011 
7012  CNodeState& state = *State(pto->GetId());
7013  if (state.fShouldBan) {
7014  if (pto->fWhitelisted)
7015  LogPrintf("Warning: not punishing whitelisted peer %s!\n", pto->addr.ToString());
7016  else {
7017  pto->fDisconnect = true;
7018  if (pto->addr.IsLocal())
7019  LogPrintf("Warning: not banning local peer %s!\n", pto->addr.ToString());
7020  else {
7021  CNode::Ban(pto->addr);
7022  }
7023  }
7024  state.fShouldBan = false;
7025  }
7026 
7027  BOOST_FOREACH (const CBlockReject& reject, state.rejects)
7028  pto->PushMessage("reject", (string) "block", reject.chRejectCode, reject.strRejectReason, reject.hashBlock);
7029  state.rejects.clear();
7030 
7031  // Start block sync
7032  if (pindexBestHeader == NULL)
7033  pindexBestHeader = chainActive.Tip();
7034  bool fFetch = state.fPreferredDownload || (nPreferredDownload == 0 && !pto->fClient && !pto->fOneShot); // Download if this is a nice peer, or we have no nice peers and this one might do.
7035  if (!state.fSyncStarted && !pto->fClient && fFetch /*&& !fImporting*/ && !fReindex) {
7036  // Only actively request headers from a single peer, unless we're close to end of initial download.
7037  if (nSyncStarted == 0 || pindexBestHeader->GetBlockTime() > GetAdjustedTime() - 6 * 60 * 60) { // NOTE: was "close to today" and 24h in Bitcoin
7038  state.fSyncStarted = true;
7039  nSyncStarted++;
7040  //CBlockIndex *pindexStart = pindexBestHeader->pprev ? pindexBestHeader->pprev : pindexBestHeader;
7041  //LogPrint("net", "initial getheaders (%d) to peer=%d (startheight:%d)\n", pindexStart->nHeight, pto->id, pto->nStartingHeight);
7042  //pto->PushMessage("getheaders", chainActive.GetLocator(pindexStart), uint256(0));
7043  pto->PushMessage("getblocks", chainActive.GetLocator(chainActive.Tip()), uint256(0));
7044  }
7045  }
7046 
7047  // Resend wallet transactions that haven't gotten in a block yet
7048  // Except during reindex, importing and IBD, when old wallet
7049  // transactions become unconfirmed and spams other nodes.
7050  if (!fReindex /*&& !fImporting && !IsInitialBlockDownload()*/) {
7051  g_signals.Broadcast();
7052  }
7053 
7054  //
7055  // Message: inventory
7056  //
7057  vector<CInv> vInv;
7058  vector<CInv> vInvWait;
7059  {
7060  LOCK(pto->cs_inventory);
7061  vInv.reserve(pto->vInventoryToSend.size());
7062  vInvWait.reserve(pto->vInventoryToSend.size());
7063  BOOST_FOREACH (const CInv& inv, pto->vInventoryToSend) {
7064  if (pto->setInventoryKnown.count(inv))
7065  continue;
7066 
7067  // trickle out tx inv to protect privacy
7068  if (inv.type == MSG_TX && !fSendTrickle) {
7069  // 1/4 of tx invs blast to all immediately
7070  static uint256 hashSalt;
7071  if (hashSalt == 0)
7072  hashSalt = GetRandHash();
7073  uint256 hashRand = inv.hash ^ hashSalt;
7074  hashRand = Hash(BEGIN(hashRand), END(hashRand));
7075  bool fTrickleWait = ((hashRand & 3) != 0);
7076 
7077  if (fTrickleWait) {
7078  vInvWait.push_back(inv);
7079  continue;
7080  }
7081  }
7082 
7083  // returns true if wasn't already contained in the set
7084  if (pto->setInventoryKnown.insert(inv).second) {
7085  vInv.push_back(inv);
7086  if (vInv.size() >= 1000) {
7087  pto->PushMessage("inv", vInv);
7088  vInv.clear();
7089  }
7090  }
7091  }
7092  pto->vInventoryToSend = vInvWait;
7093  }
7094  if (!vInv.empty())
7095  pto->PushMessage("inv", vInv);
7096 
7097  // Detect whether we're stalling
7098  int64_t nNow = GetTimeMicros();
7099  if (!pto->fDisconnect && state.nStallingSince && state.nStallingSince < nNow - 1000000 * BLOCK_STALLING_TIMEOUT) {
7100  // Stalling only triggers when the block download window cannot move. During normal steady state,
7101  // the download window should be much larger than the to-be-downloaded set of blocks, so disconnection
7102  // should only happen during initial block download.
7103  LogPrintf("Peer=%d is stalling block download, disconnecting\n", pto->id);
7104  pto->fDisconnect = true;
7105  }
7106  // In case there is a block that has been in flight from this peer for (2 + 0.5 * N) times the block interval
7107  // (with N the number of validated blocks that were in flight at the time it was requested), disconnect due to
7108  // timeout. We compensate for in-flight blocks to prevent killing off peers due to our own downstream link
7109  // being saturated. We only count validated in-flight blocks so peers can't advertize nonexisting block hashes
7110  // to unreasonably increase our timeout.
7111  if (!pto->fDisconnect && state.vBlocksInFlight.size() > 0 && state.vBlocksInFlight.front().nTime < nNow - 500000 * Params().TargetSpacing() * (4 + state.vBlocksInFlight.front().nValidatedQueuedBefore)) {
7112  LogPrintf("Timeout downloading block %s from peer=%d, disconnecting\n", state.vBlocksInFlight.front().hash.ToString(), pto->id);
7113  pto->fDisconnect = true;
7114  }
7115 
7116  //
7117  // Message: getdata (blocks)
7118  //
7119  vector<CInv> vGetData;
7120  if (!pto->fDisconnect && !pto->fClient && fFetch && state.nBlocksInFlight < MAX_BLOCKS_IN_TRANSIT_PER_PEER) {
7121  vector<CBlockIndex*> vToDownload;
7122  NodeId staller = -1;
7123  FindNextBlocksToDownload(pto->GetId(), MAX_BLOCKS_IN_TRANSIT_PER_PEER - state.nBlocksInFlight, vToDownload, staller);
7124  BOOST_FOREACH (CBlockIndex* pindex, vToDownload) {
7125  vGetData.push_back(CInv(MSG_BLOCK, pindex->GetBlockHash()));
7126  MarkBlockAsInFlight(pto->GetId(), pindex->GetBlockHash(), pindex);
7127  LogPrintf("Requesting block %s (%d) peer=%d\n", pindex->GetBlockHash().ToString(),
7128  pindex->nHeight, pto->id);
7129  }
7130  if (state.nBlocksInFlight == 0 && staller != -1) {
7131  if (State(staller)->nStallingSince == 0) {
7132  State(staller)->nStallingSince = nNow;
7133  LogPrint("net", "Stall started peer=%d\n", staller);
7134  }
7135  }
7136  }
7137 
7138  //
7139  // Message: getdata (non-blocks)
7140  //
7141  while (!pto->fDisconnect && !pto->mapAskFor.empty() && (*pto->mapAskFor.begin()).first <= nNow) {
7142  const CInv& inv = (*pto->mapAskFor.begin()).second;
7143  if (!AlreadyHave(inv)) {
7144  if (fDebug)
7145  LogPrint("net", "Requesting %s peer=%d\n", inv.ToString(), pto->id);
7146  vGetData.push_back(inv);
7147  if (vGetData.size() >= 1000) {
7148  pto->PushMessage("getdata", vGetData);
7149  vGetData.clear();
7150  }
7151  }
7152  pto->mapAskFor.erase(pto->mapAskFor.begin());
7153  }
7154  if (!vGetData.empty())
7155  pto->PushMessage("getdata", vGetData);
7156  }
7157  return true;
7158 }
7159 
7160 
7161 bool CBlockUndo::WriteToDisk(CDiskBlockPos& pos, const uint256& hashBlock)
7162 {
7163  // Open history file to append
7164  CAutoFile fileout(OpenUndoFile(pos), SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
7165  if (fileout.IsNull())
7166  return error("CBlockUndo::WriteToDisk : OpenUndoFile failed");
7167 
7168  // Write index header
7169  unsigned int nSize = fileout.GetSerializeSize(*this);
7170  fileout << FLATDATA(Params().MessageStart()) << nSize;
7171 
7172  // Write undo data
7173  long fileOutPos = ftell(fileout.Get());
7174  if (fileOutPos < 0)
7175  return error("CBlockUndo::WriteToDisk : ftell failed");
7176  pos.nPos = (unsigned int)fileOutPos;
7177  fileout << *this;
7178 
7179  // calculate & write checksum
7180  CHashWriter hasher(SER_GETHASH, PROTOCOL_VERSION);
7181  hasher << hashBlock;
7182  hasher << *this;
7183  fileout << hasher.GetHash();
7184 
7185  return true;
7186 }
7187 
7188 bool CBlockUndo::ReadFromDisk(const CDiskBlockPos& pos, const uint256& hashBlock)
7189 {
7190  // Open history file to read
7191  CAutoFile filein(OpenUndoFile(pos, true), SER_DISK, CLIENT_VERSION);
7192  if (filein.IsNull())
7193  return error("CBlockUndo::ReadFromDisk : OpenBlockFile failed");
7194 
7195  // Read block
7196  uint256 hashChecksum;
7197  try {
7198  filein >> *this;
7199  filein >> hashChecksum;
7200  } catch (std::exception& e) {
7201  return error("%s : Deserialize or I/O error - %s", __func__, e.what());
7202  }
7203 
7204  // Verify checksum
7205  CHashWriter hasher(SER_GETHASH, PROTOCOL_VERSION);
7206  hasher << hashBlock;
7207  hasher << *this;
7208  if (hashChecksum != hasher.GetHash())
7209  return error("CBlockUndo::ReadFromDisk : Checksum mismatch");
7210 
7211  return true;
7212 }
7213 
7214 std::string CBlockFileInfo::ToString() const
7215 {
7216  return strprintf("CBlockFileInfo(blocks=%u, size=%u, heights=%u...%u, time=%s...%s)", nBlocks, nSize, nHeightFirst, nHeightLast, DateTimeStrFormat("%Y-%m-%d", nTimeFirst), DateTimeStrFormat("%Y-%m-%d", nTimeLast));
7217 }
7218 
7219 
7220 class CMainCleanup
7221 {
7222 public:
7223  CMainCleanup() {}
7224  ~CMainCleanup()
7225  {
7226  // block headers
7227  BlockMap::iterator it1 = mapBlockIndex.begin();
7228  for (; it1 != mapBlockIndex.end(); it1++)
7229  delete (*it1).second;
7230  mapBlockIndex.clear();
7231 
7232  // orphan transactions
7233  mapOrphanTransactions.clear();
7234  mapOrphanTransactionsByPrev.clear();
7235  }
7236 } instance_of_cmaincleanup;

CTxMemPool::mapNextTx
